loans.name: Ayissatou

texts.fr: Cette femme  est mariée, elle n’a pas d’enfants et vit avec son époux dans le quartier de forever qui est un quartier de la ville de Lomé, en 2005  elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de bois de chauffage. elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de charbons de bois, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Badou, elle réalise d’excellente recette, les pluies de ces derniers temps ont rendu son stock inutilisable, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 10 tas de bois de chauffage et de 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This lady is married but has no children. She lives with her husband in the Forever district of Lomé. In 2005 she launched a firewood activity which she complemented later on with the sale of charcoal. She gets her supplies inland in the town of Badou. She generates excellent revenues, but the recent rainfall has rendered her stock unusable and she would like to get fresh supplies. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES for the purchase of ten piles of firewood and 20 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Yao Agbéviadé

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un père de famille, il a 2 enfants, afin de subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il s’est lancée dans les travaux d’imprimerie, il a ouvert à cet effet sa propre imprimerie qu’il appelle « IMPRIMERIE PREMICES », il a en ce moment des commandes qu’il doit exécuter, pour y parvenir il doit se réapprovisionner en papiers, c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers papiers d’imprimerie.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a family man who has two children. In order to cover his family's expenses he launched a printing business. In this context, he opened his own printing works which he has named "IMPRIMERIE PREMICES". At present he has orders to execute and in order to do this he needs to get fresh supplies of paper. For this reason he is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy various types of printing paper.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
doña Victoria  H. es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa de habitacion, se levanta a las 2 de la mañana para elaborar su comida ya que tiene que despachar a varias personas que llevan de su comida a sus trabajos para desayuno y almuerzo. 
Victoria tiene una hija de 4 años de edad.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de sus comidas, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Victoria H. is a hard-working woman. She sells food in her house. She gets up at two in the morning to make the food. She does this because she has to send it to various people who take her food to work for breakfast and lunch. Victoria has a four year old daughter. She will use the loan to buy more materials for making her food. She needs the income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, vegetables, shortening, oil, salt, firewood, water, soft drinks, salsa, condiments, juice, sausages, beans, rice, and bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liliebeyi

texts.fr:
Cette dame a appris la couture, en 2002 elle a ouvert son propre atelier qu’elle a appelé « GRACE ETONNANTE », elle confectionne des habits qu’elle expose dans son atelier pour vendre aux clients les plus intéressés,  elle veut s’approvisionner en pagnes et tissus bazins, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers tissus de qualités WAX et des bazins.
Elle est mariée et mère de 1 enfant, avec son revenu elle contribue aux dépenses du ménage.
texts.en:
This lady learned how to sew, and in 2002 she opened her own workshop which she named "GRACE ETONNANTE". She makes up clothes which she displays in her workshop in order to sell them to the most interested customers. She would like to get supplies of "pagnes" (colourful West African fabric) and damask fabric . She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy various WAX and damask fabrics. She is married and has one child. With her income she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and damask fabric

loans.name: Patricia Beatriz

texts.es:
Patricia es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hija en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, considerado el distrito más poblado de la región, pero también el que tiene más altos índices de pobreza, la mayoría de su población se encuentra agrupada en zonas urbano – marginales, es aledaño a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de comida en su domicilio, ella ofrece diariamente menú y cebiche (plato típico del país hecho a base de pescado fresco) a los mecánicos que trabajan por la zona y a los mototaxistas que frecuentan el lugar. Este negocio le provee de ingresos necesarios para ayudar en el mantenimiento de su hogar, ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo como trabajador de un pequeño hotel no bastan para salir adelante.

Hace dos años Patricia y su esposo adquirieron una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con unos ahorros que habían estado reuniendo, con este vehículo se vienen generando algunos ingresos adicionales, el vehículo es manejado por un chofer particular y brinda servicios dentro del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz y la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso brindado a la unidad movil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para que pueda funcionar correctamente. Por ello Patricia se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo así como en la renovación de las licencias necesarias que permitan brindar su servicio dentro de la legalidad correspondiente.

Patricia es una mujer emprendedora y una madre muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la imagen aparece en su vehículo junto al chofer encargado de manejarlo.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 38 year old mother who lives with her husband and daughter in the José Leonardo Ortiz district. It is considered the most populated district in the region and it also has one of the highest indices of poverty. The majority of the population is in urban areas and is marginalized; she lives next to the city of Chiclayo.

Patricia has sold food in her home for many years, she has a menu and cebiche (typical dish made from fresh fish) sold to mechanics that work in the area and to the mototaxistas who frequent the place. This business gives her the necessary income to help the household since the income that her husband receives as a worker in a small hotel is not enough to get ahead.

Two years ago, Patricia and her husband got a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers) with some savings that they collected. They have gotten some extra income from this vehicle. It is driven by a hired driver and the mototaxi runs in the José Leonardo Ortiz district and in the city of Chiclayo.

The continual use of the vehicle has meant that it has had some problems and it is important to repair it so that it can work properly. Patricia is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) that she will use to repair and maintain and to renew the necessary licenses to operate the mototaxi legally.

Patricia is a very enterprising woman and a very dedicated mother. Her biggest with is to give her daughter a better quality of life. She has worked with our institution before and has shown to be punctual and responsible when making her payments. In the picture she is shown with her mototaxi and the driver in charge of driving it.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair, maintain, and renew the operational licenses of a mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more scrap iron

loans.name: Tassi

texts.fr:
Cette dame a commencé l’année passée le commerce de céréales et de divers autres produits alimentaires, ce commerce marche bien pour elle et ce en partie grâce à son dynamisme, elle réalise ainsi de bonnes recettes, son stock de marchandise a baissé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 6 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de soja et divers.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady began to sell cereals and other food products last year. This business is going well for her and this is partly the result of her dynamism. She thus achieves good revenues. Her stock of goods has however fallen and she would like to get fresh supplies; she is requesting a loan from WAGES for the purchase of six bags of corn, two bags of soya and various other products. She is married and is mother to two children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and soya

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung T. D. is 51 years old. She lives in Phu Man village, Cho Town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has three children. The first son has a job and has income. She not only grows rice, but also raises pigs to scratch out a living. In 2008, she joined SEDA's activities to gain access to financial resources. Her loans, which were used largely to buy food for chickens, have always been repaid punctually. In the next round, she would like to borrow 7.840.000 VND to invest in her livestock. Hopefully, that plan will turn a profit so that her family can afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: To invest in her livestock

loans.name: Médinatou

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis 2007 le commerce en détail des ustensiles de cuisine, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, elle fait face en ce  moment à une baisse de son stock de marchandises d’où la nécessité de se réapprovisionner, elle demande  un prêt à WAGES pour l’achat de divers ustensiles de cuisine, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, avec son revenu elle contribue financièrement aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady has been selling kitchenware retail since 2007. She does this on a door-to-door basis. At present she is experiencing a fall in her stock and thus needs to get fresh supplies. She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy various kitchen utensils. She is married and mother to one child. With her income she contributes financially to the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchenware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of haberdashery items

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a welcoming and hard-working businesswoman who sells groceries to her customers. She is thirty-nine years old, divorced, and the mother of five children from age 4 – 18 years. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and supporting her children in school. She loves selling and enjoys serving customers. She trades in groceries such as candies, mineral water, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish, vegetable cooking oil, macaroni, etc. She has operated her shop for the past 10 years in her neighborhood. 

Vida believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful traders in groceries. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of groceries to serve her customers. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits that she will be able to educate her children to at least the tertiary school level.

loans.use: To purchase groceries such as tinned tomatoes, mineral water, macaroni, etc.

loans.name: Wilmer Hulmester

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector Progresiva La Ciudad, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida en el norte por su movimiento comercial.

Se dedica desde hace mas de seis años al comercio de verduras, actualmente realiza su actividad en el mercado Los Pathos, un mercado relativamente nuevo: con tres años de antigüedad, ocupado por comerciantes que originalmente ofrecían sus productos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad) y que luego adquirieron el terreno que actualmente ocupan. El mercado es conocido por la venta de verduras en variedad a bajos precios, lo cual es apreciado por los comerciantes minoristas de verduras que recurren a este centro de abasto para realizar sus compras.

Wilmer desea realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su puesto ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado debido a las lluvias que se han presentado durante los meses de verano, para ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Wilmer es una persona que ha trabajado desde muy joven para salir adelante, su sueño es seguir creciendo como empresario para seguir progresando y ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 23 years old; he is single and lives in his parents’ house located in the Progresiva La Ciudad area, an urban area, close to the city of Chiclayo, a city well-known in the north for its business industry.

Wilmer has worked for over 6 years selling vegetables and now sells in the Los Pathos market, a relatively new market 3 years old, used by merchants that originally sold their products in the Moshoqueque market (a wholesale market in the city) and later each got grounds that now use to sell their products. The market is known for its variety of vegetables available for sale at low prices, which is valued by the vegetable retailers that go to the market to buy their goods.

Wilmer wishes to improve the infrastructure of his stall since it has deteriorated because of the rain that has occurred during the summer months. He is in need of a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva's field partner) that will help him achieve his goal.

Wilmer has worked from a very young age to get ahead; his dream is to keep growing as a businessman to keep making progress and to help his family to have a better quality of life. He has already worked with our institution and has shown to be punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his stall due to the damages caused by the rainfall.

loans.name: Alhadi Primary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the Alhadi Primary School in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 2002 by Sheik Hassan Mohamed K. to give both Arabic and Western education to the children of Magburaka town.  Presently, the school has 7 teachers and 233 pupils.  

This is the first loan this school is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

42-year-old Paul A. C. (right) is the deputy headmaster at the school. He has been a teacher for seven years now. He was born in Matunkara village about 12 miles away from Magburaka town. He is married with nine children – five in secondary school and four in primary school. Paul is currently doing a distance-learning course and he is in his third and final year. He will like to use his share of this loan to pay for his final year's course. 

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To pay college fees

loans.name: S.d.a. Primary School, Masanga Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA Primary School at the Masanga village in northern Sierra Leone. It was opened by the Seven Days Adventist Church Mission (SMD Mission) to give formal education to the children of Masanga village. Presently, this school is staffed with 12 teachers and 431 pupils. 

This is the first loan these teachers are requesting from SMT/Kiva Lenders.  School staff from this institution, like many other school's staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and paying SMT on their behalf.

James H. G., who is pictured on the right in the back, is the head teacher and leader of this group. Mr. G. has taught for 32 years now. The 56-year-old James was born in Koya village. He is married and has three children. One of his children is in secondary school, one is in college and the other is a school teacher. James is seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 in order to buy pieces of furniture like chairs, a bed, tables, a radio, etc.  

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy furniture like chairs, a bed, tables, a radio, etc.

loans.name: Augustine M.a.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured are teachers from a primary school in Malong village, which is located about five miles away from Magburaka town. This school was established by the Roman Catholics in 1966 to promote education in Sierra Leone. Currently, the school has 10 teachers on its payroll list and 2 unpaid teachers with 285 pupils.  

This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Sixty-two-year-old Augustine M.A. F. (pictured on the right) is the headmaster at the school, and has been a teacher for 43 years. He was born in Magburaka town, and is married with four children – two of his children are in secondary school and two are in college. Augustine will use his loan to buy house-building materials like bags of cement, stones and iron corrugated zinc. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house building materials

loans.name: Ndèye Sophie

texts.fr: Ndèye Sophie N. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter une dizaine de béliers de les engraisser afin de les revendre au bout de 5 mois. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye Sophie N. is a 48-year old woman, married and the mother of four dependent children. She has been a member of Dankh Sene Banc Villageois for seven and a half years. She raises sheep, and her new loan will allow her to purchase a dozen rams of in order to fatten them for resale in about five months. Her income allows her to help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and enlarging her sheep-raising business

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria Jadan es socia del banco Pauteñitas, ella vive en la comunidad de Jadan en el  cantón Paute ubicado al noreste de la provincia del Azuay en la ruta de unión natural entre la sierra y el oriente Ecuatoriano incrementando el acceso  al Amazonas por los Ríos del Perú, lo que convierte al turismo en un gran potencial para el desarrollo local, además de su clima templado y su gente siempre amable atractivos para el turista nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres esfuerzo de mucho trabajo a quienes ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Gloria se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos en su propia comunidad actividad que realiza hace un buen tiempo, cuenta con un puesto propio y trabaja de domingo a domingo de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m., para abastecer su negocio compra el pollo ya que su criadero es aún pequeño y no le abastece para su negocio.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo  trabajando con la fundación permitiéndole incrementar poco a poco su negocio, con el nuevo crédito va a comprar  pollos pelados y tambien unas crías y alimento para abastecer su negocio y su criadero.

Su sueño es poder ingresar a la universidad para seguir la carrera de Ingeniería de Alimentos.
texts.en:
Gloria Jadan is a member of the Pauteñitas Communal Bank. She lives in the Jadan community of Paute county, located northeast of the Azuay province. It is on the Union Natural route between the mountains and the Ecuadorian east, facilitating access to the Amazon by the rivers of Peru, which makes tourism a big potential for the local development. Furthermore, it has a mild climate, and its kind people are perfect for both national and international tourists.

Our client is 28 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who have worked hard to obtain their house. She helps them out with the household expenses. Gloria raises and sells chickens in her community, and she has been doing so for quite some time. She has her own stand and works 7 days a week from 8 am to 5pm. In order to stock up her business, she buys chickens because her poultry farm is still very small, and she does not have enough to satisfy demand.

She is now in her third loan cycle with this institute, which has allowed her to expand her business little by little. With this new loan, she will purchase some chicks, plucked chickens, and feed to restock her farm.

Her dream is to be able to enroll in university so that she can pursue a degree in Food Engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicks, plucked chickens, and feed

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 36 años de edad y es separado, tiene un hijo de diez años y vive junto a sus padres en el sector San Luis, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ciudad bastante conocida en el norte del país por su movimiento comercial.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cuatro años a brindar servicio de transporte público dentro de la ciudad de Chiclayo y alrededores en un auto Tico propio que utiliza como taxi. Esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta y gracias a ella puede solventar sus gastos personales, ayudar a su hijo y colaborar con la economía familiar.

Jorge Luis se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el empadronamiento de su unidad y otros trámites necesarios para renovar las licencias de funcionamiento que le permitan circular libremente por la ciudad dentro de la legalidad correspondiente, brindando un servicio seguro, de calidad y que no se vea interrumpido por operativos de control.

Jose Luis es un hombre trabajador que dedica la mayor parte del día a brindar su servicio, su mayor anhelo es salir adelante y poner un negocio más estable con el cual percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan brindar una mejor calidad de vida a las personas que quiere. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 36 years old and separated; he has one 10 year old son and lives with his parents in the San Luis area-close to the city of Chiclayo, a city well-known in the north for its business industry.

For more than 4 years, he has had a car that he uses as a taxi for public transport in the city of Chiclayo and surrounding areas. This is his only source of income and thanks to it, he has been able to meet his personal expenses and help his son as well as helping meet the household expenses.

Jorge Luis is asking for a loan of 1300 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) that he will use to pay taxes and other necessary procedures to renew his working license and be able to move around the city legally. By making the necessary paperwork, he will be able to give reliable and quality service so that his work won’t be interrupted by inspector officials.

Jose Luis is a hardworking man that spends most of his days working, his biggest wish is to get ahead and to have a more stable job so that he can have more income that will allow him a better quality of life for the people that he loves. He has worked with our institution before and has shown to be punctual and responsible when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renew licenses that will allow him to work legally.

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Jeanette de los Santos A. T., tiene la edad de 40 años, y trabaja como cocinera, es madre soltera de 2 hijos que sobreviven de manera independiente, ellos son mayores de edad.

Dentro de las necesidades que mas la apremian esta, la edificación de su vivienda, actualmente ella solicito un préstamo para terminar las compra de los materiales de construcción y concluir las construcciones de su hogar, en esta etapa ella construirá un muro en el costado oeste sur, debido a que no goza en la actualidad de privacidad y seguridad debido a las inseguridades del barrio en donde actualmente habita. El apoyo que se le otorgase le servirá de mucha ayuda a la mejora continua de la vida de toda su familia y a la protección de sus seres queridos que por las edades que poseen son vulnerables a las malas influencias, esta es  una razon de importancia para que ellos habitan en tranquilidad y eviten el contacto de las malas compañias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanette de los Santos A. T. is 40 years old and works as a cook. She is a single mother of two that are independent and grown up. One of the things that Mrs. Jeanette needs urgently is the building of her home. She needs the loan to finish buying the construction materials and to finish construction in her home. For now she will build a wall in the southwestern part of her home since she has no privacy or security since it is unsafe in her neighborhood. The support that she will receive will help her a lot and to improve her life and that of her family since it will protect her loved ones since due to their ages, they are vulnerable to bad influences and that it is important for them so that they can live in peace and prevent contact from bad company.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in her home.

loans.name: Odo Na Eye Tb Group

texts.en:
Yaw S. is a hard-working man, resourceful on behalf of his family. He is married to a trader who sells socks and together they have six children who range from age 2-15. Yaw is also a trader who sells used shoes and they want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

He purchases used shoes from wholesale outlets in big cities and retails them to his customers. Selling used shoes is a big market in Ghana because they are relatively affordable for the ordinary man. He sells to adult males and school children.

Yaw is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Oda na eye” (translated as 'Love is best'), made up of five members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as food selling, baking, grocery sales, used clothing sales, etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted used shoes

loans.name: Achiaa Ahemaa Tb Group

texts.en:
Afua K. is lovely and hard-working young lady. She is married to a commercial driver with two children. She is now thirty-eight years old. Afua lives together with her family in a family house at Goaso, where she also does her trading. She is able to provide support for her family’s financial needs through the sale of vegetables and spices: tomatoes, peppers, onions, garden eggs (small eggplants), etc. 

Selling for the past two years, she has retained quite a number of customers through good customer relations. 

Afua is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “A. Ahemaa” (named after one of the members), made up of six members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as foodstuff-selling, Kenkey-selling, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices for resale

loans.name: Liberia Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Liberia Silvia B., es comerciante, soltera tiene tres hijos uno de ellos  vive con ella habita en el barrio san Agustín, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación desde hace veinticuatro años. 
La señora Liberia Silvia B. tiene cinco años de trabajar con créditos ha cancelado veinticinco créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad, los créditos anteriores le han ayudado a mantener estables su negocio e ir evolucionando.
texts.en:
La señora Liberia Silvia B., es comerciante, soltera tiene tres hijos uno de ellos vive con ella habita en el barrio san Agustín, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación desde hace veinticuatro años. La señora Liberia Silvia B. tiene cinco años de trabajar con créditos ha cancelado veinticinco créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad, los créditos anteriores le han ayudado a mantener estables su negocio e ir evolucionando.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de  productos para la venta

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr: Soda N. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE depuis 7 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à faire de l'embouche de petits ruminants, son nouveau crédit lui permettra alors d'acheter cinq paires de béliers et de les engraisser pendant 5 mois pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Cette activité lui procure de profits qui lui permette de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Soda N. is a 36-year old woman who is married and mother to four children who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DANKH SENE for seven and a half years. Her activity is the fattening of small ruminants. Her new loan will allow her to buy five pairs of rams and to fatten them up for five months before reselling them at the weekly markets in her village. This activity will procure her sufficient profit to contribute to the improvement in her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase five pairs of rams

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Manuela del Socorro M. se dedica a la venta de comida en el sector del mercado el Bisne desde hace más de ocho años es acompañada y tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar y su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de electricidad por cuenta propia.

Doña Manuela M. lleva ya seis años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y le ha ayudado a superarse económicamente por que con el financiamiento logra comprar granos básicos y carnes para no estar comprando a  diario y así le sale más barato y obtiene mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
La señora Manuela del Socorro M. se dedica a la venta de comida en el sector del mercado el Bisne desde hace más de ocho años es acompañada y tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar y su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de electricidad por cuenta propia. Doña Manuela M. lleva ya seis años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y le ha ayudado a superarse económicamente por que con el financiamiento logra comprar granos básicos y carnes para no estar comprando a diario y así le sale más barato y obtiene mejores ganancias.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de granos básicos.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María Antonia M. C., es soltera tiene cinco hijos dos menores de edad viven con ella, habita en el barrio Pedro Joaquín chamorro, su negocio opera en su casa de habitación desde hace dos años. 
La señora María Antonia M. C. tiene un  años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, durante el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con ceprodel ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
La señora María Antonia M. C., es soltera tiene cinco hijos dos menores de edad viven con ella, habita en el barrio Pedro Joaquín chamorro, su negocio opera en su casa de habitación desde hace dos años. La señora María Antonia M. C. tiene un años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, durante el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con ceprodel ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de  productos para la venta

loans.name: Mario Omar

texts.es:
El Joven Mario Omar M. es soltero tiene tres hermanos vive junto a su familia en la colonia gracsa, es dueño de un triciclo para transportar gente, el cual es su medio de trabajo y fuente de ingresos

El Joven Mario Omar M. ha cancelado nueve créditos demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en lo que a obligación respecta, todos estos crédito los ha utilizado para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos de la familia e ir mejorando su medio de transporte
texts.en:
El Joven Mario Omar M. es soltero tiene tres hermanos vive junto a su familia en la colonia gracsa, es dueño de un triciclo para transportar gente, el cual es su medio de trabajo y fuente de ingresos El Joven Mario Omar M. ha cancelado nueve créditos demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad en lo que a obligación respecta, todos estos crédito los ha utilizado para ayudar a sus padres en los gastos de la familia e ir mejorando su medio de transporte

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para la familia

loans.name: Som Yie Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Rita describes herself as a serious and hard-working woman. She has been operating her retail food business for the past six months, specializing in rice and stew. She sells meals such as these to day-laborers and individuals in her neighborhood. Currently, Rita operates her business from a kiosk on the side of the road. She is excited to be taking out this loan so that she can purchase cooking materials that will help her meet customer demand: bags of rice, cooking oil, tomatoes, and seasonings. Rita dreams of generating enough profits to one day open a restaurant. 

In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Rita is also married and the mother of six children ranging in age from 6-24 years old. Rita’s husband is a cocoa farmer, and together their goal is to provide education for all six children to the tertiary level.  

Rita is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Som Yie’ which means ‘handle with care ‘in Twi, the most commonly spoken language in Ghana. Rita says that she was chosen to be the group’s leader because she is a “good and strong organizer.” The group has five female members, and Rita is tasked with ensuring that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments on time. The other group members are engaged in trades such as food selling, hair dressing, and grocery sales. Their common dream is to be financially sustainable, independent and to be able to support their children through quality education. 


* Not pictured: Rabiatu M.

loans.use: Bags of rice, cooking oil, tins of tomatoes and other foods for production of rice and stew

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly T. N. is 26 years old. She lives in the village of N. Xa. She is married and has three children. She grows rice and raises pigs to earn a living. Her family also has a mechanic shop. She and her husband usually work with each other. They have a monthly income of about 4,300,000 VND. Ly is the leader of a six–member group loan. Ly joined SEDA in 2009, and since joining she has re-payed all of her loans on time. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy iron for her shop.

About the other members in the group:

  • Binh T. N. is 34 years old. She is a carpenter and wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy wood.
  • Lan T. N. is 55 years old, and she wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to breed pigs and chickens.
  • Thuy T. N. is 31 years old, and she wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to breed pigs as well.
  • Lan T. D. is 27 years old, and she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy wood.
  • Chanh T. N. is 28 years old, and she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: To buy iron.

loans.name: Cau's Group

texts.en:
Cau T. N. is 54 years old. She lives in the village of N. Xa, Cho Town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has three children, and they all have jobs. Cau grows rice and breeds pigs and cows. She has been in this line of work for many years, and she earns a total monthly income of about 2,300,000 VND. She is the leader of a five–member group loan. She has been with SEDA for two years and always repays her loans on time. In this credit cycle, she is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes her investment will turn a profit so that her family will be able to afford more household appliances.

About the other members in the group:

  • Mai T. N. is 34 years old, and she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.
  • Gam T. P. is 28 years old, and she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy wood to make furniture.
  • Huy T. N. is 20 years old, and she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to expand her business.
  • Mien T. N. is 36 years old, and she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy scrap iron to resell.

loans.use: To buy more .

loans.name: Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
“Carmelitas” es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Villa Tejada”,  este es su noveno ciclo. Se agruparon por la necesidad de mejorar y ampliar sus negocios y de esta manera acceder al préstamo y beneficiarse todas. 
Un ejemplo claro es Marcela R. de 34 años casada y madre de dos niños, con el pasar del tiempo logró estabilizar y mejorar su taller de mecánica, que juntamente con su esposo logró encaminar este negocio y generar fuentes de empleo, así como diversificar sus productos ya que actualmente ofrece a sus clientes grasas para lubricar a las movilidades. Entonces el préstamo de Bs.- 3000 lo invertira en la compra de grasas. 
A Marcela le gusta el ahorro y el compartir con sus amigas de su Asociación.
Las demás integrantes tienen diversos negocios que se dedican a comercio, producción y servicio. Todas desean el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
“Carmelitas” is a group of 7 women and a man, they go to meetings in the hub of “Villa Tejada,” this will be their ninth loan. They became a group due to the need to improve and increase their businesses and to get a loan to benefit them all.

A clear example is Marcela R., who is 34 years old, married and a mother to 2 children. With some time she was able to establish and improve her mechanic shop that she was able to establish with her husband. The business is a source of work and they were able to diversify their products and serve their customers, currently she offers oil to lubricate the vehicles. The loan is of Bs.- 3000 and will be used to buy oil.

Marcela enjoys saving and sharing with her friends in her group.

The other members have different businesses; they sell merchandize, produce goods and services. They all want the loan to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 24498 	No. de Foto: 214

Francisco P. S. tiene 57 años, es casado, y  tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 
Francisco trabaja en la agricultura y la albañeria para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, fréjol en menos proporción, algo de papas y también a la cría de chanchos.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves y en su casa.
En los tiempos libres se va de paseo con su familia, además le gusta las fiestas del carnaval celebrar con la familia y los vecinos.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos y la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Francisco P. S. is 57 years old, is married and has 6 children. He lives near San Miguel in the Bolívar province.

The member is a part of La Palmera communal bank it is in a rural area, and it is an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel. There are 16 members in total, it is an agricultural community and a few are cattle-dealers.

Francisco works in agriculture and as a mason to improve his family’s finances. The crops that stand out in his production are corn and beans in a lower rate, some potatoes and he also raises pigs. He sells his products in the San Miguel market in Thursday’s fair and in his home.

In his free time, he enjoys outings with his family; he also enjoys carnival parties to celebrate with family and neighbors.

The member needs the loan to buy goods for his field work and above all for fertilizers and manure. Francisco’s goal is to have a good economic activity for the family and to buy a car for work. The challenges that he faces are due to climate, the diseases that hurt his crops and the lack of money to buy goods for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds for production.

loans.name: Bertha Marcela

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 31514 	No. de Foto: 212

Bertha Marcela T. P. tiene 38 años, vive en Unión Libre, y  tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

La socia es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 

Bertha trabaja en la agricultura y en los que aceres domésticos,  para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, fréjol, algo de papas.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

La familia tiene la costumbre de cada Diciembre realizar una misa del Divino Niño en la comunidad, y cuando no tiene trabajo salen de paseo por el centro del Catón San Miguel.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos y la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Bertha Marcela T. P. is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has six children. They live in the canton of San Miguel en in the Bolívar province. This member belongs to the communal bank “La Palmera” which is located an hour and a half from San Miguel. There are 16 members all together. This is primarily an agricultural community but some also raise cattle. Bertha works in agriculture, as well as doing her household chores, to increase her family’s income. The biggest crops are: corn, beans, and some potatoes. She sells her products in San Miguel‘s market at the Thursday fair. Every December, her family puts on a mass in the community for the Divine Child. When they don’t have work, they visit downtown San Miguel This member is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her farm work, in particular for fertilizers. Her goal is to earn a good income for her family and to buy a car for work. The challenges she faces are climate, diseases that affect the crops, and lack of money to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and seedss so their lands produce

loans.name: Jose Abdon

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 31506 	No. de Foto: 213

Josè Abdón G. S. tiene 42 años, es viudo, y  tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El  socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 
Josè trabaja en la agricultura,  para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz  ademas se dedica a la cría de animales como: vacuno, porcino y ovino.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

La familia tiene la costumbre de compartir con los vecinos de la comunidad los días festivos, además le gusta los juegos deportivos como es  dolí y fútbol.

 El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos y la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Josè Abdón G. S. is 42 years old, is widowed and has 3 children. He lives near San Miguel in the Bolívar province.

The member is a part of La Palmera communal bank it is in a rural area, and it is an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel. There are 16 members in total, it is an agricultural community and a few are cattle-dealers.

Josè works in agriculture to increase his families’ finances. The crop that stands out in production is corn; he also raises animals like cattle, pigs and sheep.

The family has the habit of sharing the holidays with their neighbors and he enjoys sports like dolí and football (soccer).

Josè needs the loan to buy goods for field work and above all for fertilizers and manure. His goal is to have a good economic activity for the family and to buy a car for work. The challenges that he faces are due to climate, the diseases that hurt his crops and the lack of money to buy goods for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds for production.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 31569 	No. de Foto: 211

Inés G. S. tiene 38 años, es casada, y  tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

La socia es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 
Inés trabaja en la agricultura y en los que aceres domésticos,  para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, morocho, choclo, fréjol, habas.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

En los momentos que no hay trabajo le gusta pasar con los hijos y compartir las fiestas con los vecinos como es la navidad y el carnaval.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos y la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Inés G. S. is 38 years old, is married and has six children. She lives near San Miguel in the province of Bolívar.

The member is a part of La Palmera communal bank, it is in a rural area, and it is an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel. There are 16 members in total, it is an agricultural community and a few are cattle-dealers.

Inés works in agriculture and in her home to improve her families’ financial state. The crops that stand out in production are corn, morocho (dry cracked corn used in beverages and food), choclo (green ear of corn), beans, and habas (broad beans). She sells her products in the San Miguel market in Thursday’s fair.

When there is no work, she likes to spend time with her children and to share parties with her neighbors like Christmas and carnival.

Inés needs the loan to buy merchandize for her work in the field and for fertilizer and manure. Her goal is to have a good economic activity for the family and to buy a car for work. The challenges that she faces are due to climate, the diseases that hurt her crops and the lack of money to buy goods for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and supplies for production.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 36448 	No. de Foto: 210

Carlos P. T. tiene 23 años, es soltero, y  no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El  socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 
Carlos trabaja en la agricultura,  para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz,  además se dedica a la cría de animales porcino.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear con la familia y compartir un momento de juegos  y hacer deporte como fútbol.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Carlos P. T., age 23, is single and does not have children. He lives in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. He is a member of the La Palmera Communal Bank. It is in an area found an hour and a half from the San Miguel canton. There are 16 members in all. It is a farming community with some livestock. Carlos works in agriculture to increase the family’s economy. His best crop is corn. He also raises pigs. He sells his products at the San Miguel Thursday fair. In his free time he likes to go on walks with his family. He also likes to share time playing games and participating in sports like soccer. He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for field work. Above all he will buy natural and chemical fertilizers. His goal is to have a good economic activity for his family and to buy a car for work. The challenges he faces are the climate problems and the diseases that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and seeds for his fields

loans.name: Suma Chuyma Group

texts.es:
“Suma Chuyma” es un grupo de 10 señoras  que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “German Busch”,  este es su segundo ciclo. Se agruparon por la necesidad de mejorar y ampliar sus negocios y acceder al préstamo y beneficiarse todas. 
Rosmery M. de 21 años casada y madre de un niño, cuenta que desde sus 15 años teje mantas a mano (macramé), al principio le pareció dificultoso, pero con el pasar del tiempo logró perfeccionar su habilidad, tiene planes de invertir el préstamo en su negocio comprando lana y seguir produciendo a mayor cantidad e involucrar a sus hermanos menores en esta actividad para que ellos también aprendan.
Las demás integrantes tienen diversos negocios que se dedican a comercio, producción y servicio. Todas desean el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
“Suma Chuyma” is a group of 10 women who attend their meetings at the "German Busch" center and are on their second loan cycle. They came together as a group because they needed to improve and expand their business, to access a loan, and for everyone's benefit.

Rosmery M. has been married 21 years, is the mother to one sun, and has been weaving blankets by hand (macramé) for the past fifteen years. At first it was difficult but after time she honed her skills. She has plans to invest this loan in her business buying wool, producing more blankets, and involving her younger siblings in the activity so that they can learn.

The rest have a variety of business, involved in trade, production, and services. All want to use the loan to better their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying raw material

loans.name: Melvin Leonel

texts.es:
El señor Melvin Leonel C. V., es propietario de una panadería ubicada en el barrio la Florida, tiene dos trabajadores los cuales le elaboran el pan y el se encarga de la entrega del pan en las diferentes pulperías en una camionetita de su propiedad.

El señor Melvin C. es casado con cuatro hijos de los cuales solo dos dependen de él, los otros dos ya son independientes.
texts.en:
El señor Melvin Leonel C. V., es propietario de una panadería ubicada en el barrio la Florida, tiene dos trabajadores los cuales le elaboran el pan y el se encarga de la entrega del pan en las diferentes pulperías en una camionetita de su propiedad. El señor Melvin C. es casado con cuatro hijos de los cuales solo dos dependen de él, los otros dos ya son independientes.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de materia para la elaboración del pan

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y tiene ocho hijos mayores. Vive en su casa propia, ubicada en un poblado de la selva ayacuchana. Para Alejandro el amor y el compromiso son la clave del éxito, es por eso, que en el presente tiene una tienda de abarrotes, así como cultivos de Café y Cacao. Usualmente estos productos los vende en su propio negocio, pero en ocasiones los vende en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad, resultándole muy satisfactoria las ganancias que obtiene, por lo que le da mucha tranquilidad económica y emocional. A menudo trabaja con su esposa y ya llevan casi 35 años realizando esta actividad juntos. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio de abarrotes, para que así pueda traer sus productos de Cacao y Café, con la consigna de que lo exponga hacia el público en general. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos en fechas determinadas, además hace hincapié en el buen manejo de grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, servirá para que compre productos para su tienda de abarrotes, además para poder darle mantenimiento a su chacra.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 60, married, and has eight grown children. He lives in his own house, located in a village in the Ayacuchana jungle. For Alejandro, love and commitment are the keys to success. That is why he currently has a grocery store, as well as coffee and cacao crops. Usually he sells these products in his own store, but occasionally he sells them in the market supply centers of his community. This has been very satisfactory since the earnings that he gets has brought him economic and emotional peace of mind. He often works with his wife and they have been in this business together almost 35 years. In the future he would like to expand his grocery business, so that he can sell his coffee and chocolate to the general public. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he has promised to make all the payments by the set dates. He stresses the good management of his communal group. With the loan that he is asking for he will buy merchandise for his grocery store and also so that he can fix up his farmhouse.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his grocery store and to fix up his farmhouse

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
C. C. Enrique  tiene 58 años, es casado, y  tiene dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El  socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola  y pocos se dedican a la Ganadera. 

Enrique trabaja en la agricultura,  y solicita el crédito para compra de insumos.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz,  además se dedica a la cría de animales porcino.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar con la familia, también disfruta mucho cuando los vecinos se reúnen para alguna fiesta o para hacer deporte.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Enrique C. C. is 58 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. He is a member of La Palmera (The Palm Tree) communal bank which is an hour and a half from San Miguel canton. There are 16 members in total. It is a farming community with a few who raise livestock. Enrique works in farming to increase the family income. His main crop is corn, and he also raises pigs. He sells his produce at the San Miguel market on Thursdays. In his free time he likes to go walking with his family, he also really enjoys it when the neighbors get together for a party or to play sport. The member is asking for a loan to buy farm supplies, for fertilizers and manure above all. His goal is to have a good economic business for the family and to purchase a car for work. The challenges that he faces are climate problems and diseases that affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy farm supplies

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 31527      		No. de Foto: 208

Sánchez A. Ezequiel tiene 70 años, es viudo, y  tiene diez hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El  socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 

Ezequiel trabaja en la agricultura,  para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz,  además se dedica a la cría de animales chanchos, gallinas.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

Le gusta criar animales, y cuando no trabaja le gusta caminar por los alrededores de la comunidad.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Member Number: 31527 Photo Number: 208 Ezequiel Sánchez A., 70, is a widower; he has 10 children and lives in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province. He is a member of the La Palmera (The Palm Tree) communal bank which is an hour and a half from San Miguel canton; it has 16 members most of whom are farmers, a few raise cattle. Ezequiel works as a farmer to increase family income. His main crop is corn. He also raises pigs and chickens. He sells his products every Thursday at San Miguel’s farmer’s market. He enjoys raising animals and in his time off he enjoys walking around his community. He needs funding to buy farm supplies, mostly fertilizers and manure. His goal is to have successful sales for the family and to buy a car for work. The biggest challenge he faces is the weather and plant diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Meyling Audely

texts.es:
La joven, Meyling Audely E. P. soltera no tiene hijos vive con sus padres y hermanos en el barrio el calvario, es de profesión contador público.
Hace cuatro años trabaja en la alcaldía municipal como asistente del consejo municipal.
La joven, Meyling Audely E. P. ha tenido seis créditos los que ha utilizado para gastos personales y ayudar a mejorar la vivienda de su familia para brindar seguridad.
texts.en:
La joven, Meyling Audely E. P. soltera no tiene hijos vive con sus padres y hermanos en el barrio el calvario, es de profesión contador público. Hace cuatro años trabaja en la alcaldía municipal como asistente del consejo municipal. La joven, Meyling Audely E. P. ha tenido seis créditos los que ha utilizado para gastos personales y ayudar a mejorar la vivienda de su familia para brindar seguridad.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de  materiales de construcción( perlines y zinc)

loans.name: Maritza Norma

texts.es: Maritza Norma tiene 61 años de edad, está casada si bien tiene hijos los mismos ya son independientes y ya no viven con ella, el domicilio donde vive la familia es propio. Maritza Norma se dedica a la venta de comida en la parada de un taxi-trufi de la ciudad que es bastante demandado por la ruta que tiene en la ciudad paralelamente también percibe ingresos por su renta de vejez. Maritza Norma no presenta mucha competencia en la zona ya que es una de las únicas que vende en la zona, además que cuenta con bastantes años de experiencia en el rubro. Maritza Norma destino del crédito para capital de operaciones, con el desembolso adquirirá un refrigerador. Maritza Norma tiene varias secuencias en Agrocapital que las pago de manera puntual, tiene muy buenos antecedentes crediticios.
texts.en:
Maritza Norma, 61, is married and her children are all adults and live independently; she owns her family home. Maritza Norma sells prepared food at a busy taxi-trufi (collective vans) stop in the city; she also receives an old-age pension. She doesn’t have much competition in the area because she’s one of the only vendors there. Besides, she has a lot of years of experience in this line of work. She earmarked the funds for operational capital and will use them to buy a refrigerator. Maritza Norma has been involved in several loan cycles with Agrocapital; she repaid all of them in a timely fashion. She has very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 24 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad respectivamente, el domicilio donde Daniel es en la casa de su madre. Daniel realiza los servicios de transporte de pasajeros en un taxi, tiene su recorrido por las zonas urbanas de la ciudad donde vive y debido a que la misma no es muy grande prácticamente abarca hasta zonas periurbanas. Daniel tiene bastante experiencia como taxista y por ello es que también pertenece a una asociación o línea de transporte que tiene muy buena acogida en la cuidad por los servicios que prestan. Respecto a la competencia la misma es elevada ya que hay varias líneas o sindicatos privados y por otra parte también están los independientes que ofrecen estos servicios y en la misma ruta, la diferenciación hace la seguridad del transporte que ofrece la línea donde trabaja Daniel y sobretodo la puntualidad y responsabilidad. Daniel destino el crédito para comprar diversos activos del hogar. Daniel tiene un buen comportamiento crediticio en nuestra institución ya que este es su tercer crédito al que accede con Agrocapital, Daniel no presenta problemas de pago ni tampoco deudas con otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
Daniel, 24, is single, lives with his mother and has a two-year-old son. He provides passenger taxi services; his route is in his city of residence but, because it’s quite small, he extends to periurban areas too. Daniel has quite a bit of experience as a taxi driver and he is a member of a transportation association or route that is very well-received in the city thanks to the services they provide. Competition is high because there are several routes or private unions as well as independent ones that offer the same services along the same routes. What makes Daniel’s route stand out is its reliability, primarily its punctuality and responsibility. Daniel earmarked the loan to buy items for the home. He has good credit history with our institution since this is his 3rd loan with Agrocapital. Daniel has no problems with repayments or debts with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items for his home.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: Juan Luis tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos pequeños los cuales dependen de él, actualmente la familia vive en una vivienda pagando alquiler. Juan Luis se dedica a prestar sus servicios en el área de la construcción, es maestro albañil. Juan Luis se dedica a estas actividades hace mucho tiempo atrás porque tiene bastante experiencia y es muy requerido por las personas que conocen su trabajo. El nivel de competencia para Juan Luis es alto, ya que existen muchas personas que se dedican  a estas actividades, pero la demanda por dichos servicios es alta también. Juan Luis destinó el crédito para comprar una máquina mezcladora, este artefacto le ayudará a ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El presente crédito es el cuarto crédito individual al que accede Juan Luis. Por otra parte Juan Luis no presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero ni en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Juan Luis, 40, is single and has two children that depend on him; they live in a rented house. Juan Luis works in construction, he is a master bricklayer. He has been in this line of work for a long time and, because he has a great deal of experience, is sought-after by people who know his work. Competition for Juan Luis is high because many people are in this same occupation but demand is also high. Juan Luis earmarked the loan to buy a cement mixer which will make it possible for him to offer better service to his customers. This loan is his 4th individual loan. Juan Luis has no negative marks anywhere in the financial system or with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La señora  María Teresa  Fernández es socia del banco Pauteñitas, vive en el cantón Paute lugar reconocido por su clima templado favoreciendo el cultivo de flores, su gente amable y acogedora al turista y su comida típica son los atractivos que ofrece esta localidad.

María Teresa  tiene 44 años de edad divorciada hace 3 años por  la falta de compresión y problemas con su esposo, en su unión marital concibió tres hijos quienes se encuentran de 25, 23, 17 años,  sólo vive con su último hijo ya que el   mayor migró al exterior  en busca de un mejor futuro y es quien le ayuda económicamente, su hija es casada y vive independiente,  fruto de su trabajo goza ahora de su casa propia.

Ella es dueña de una  tienda de abarrotes hace 25 años el local  donde funciona  su negocio  es arrendado y  trabaja solo los días domingo y miércoles, los demás de días se dedica a colocar tierra en fundas para plantas, y en sus tiempos libre lava  ropa ajena, estos trabajos le están permitiendo salir adelante.

Lleva tres ciclos trabajando con su banco comunal y los créditos recibidos le han beneficiado para arreglar un poco su casa, con el nuevo crédito va a adquirir arroz,  azúcar, aceite, sal, artículos de limpieza y aseo personal para abastecer su tienda.

Su meta es terminar los arreglos en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is a member of the communal bank called Pautenitas. She lives in Paute, a place known for its pleasant climate, flower cultivation, friendly people and local cuisine. Maria Teresa is 44 years old and has been divorced for 3 years. She has 3 children from her marriage, ages 25, 23 and 17 years old. Only the youngest lives with Maria Teresa. The eldest has moved away to find better work and now helps his mother financially. Her daughter has married and lives independently with her family in their own house.

Maria Teresa has owned a small general store for 25 years where she works on Sundays and Wednesdays. The other days she works cultivating plants. In her extra time she washes clothes. This additional work has enabled her to improve her quality of life. She has 3 cycles now working with the communcal bank, and the loans have helped her to make necessary repairs to her house. With the new loan, she wil purchase rice, sugar, oil, salt, cleaning supplies and other items to fix up her store. She would like to finish the repairs on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, oil, cleaning supplies and other items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Completing construction of a home and paying off capital expenses

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. es soltera tiene cuatro hijos dos en edad escolar vive en el barrio san Agustín trabaja en la alcaldía municipal desde hace cinco años como secretaria de vice-alcalde
La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. tiene cinco años de  trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha cancelado cinco créditos demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones, los desembolsos anteriores los utilizo para construir su vivienda y brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. es soltera tiene cuatro hijos dos en edad escolar vive en el barrio san Agustín trabaja en la alcaldía municipal desde hace cinco años como secretaria de vice-alcalde La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. tiene cinco años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha cancelado cinco créditos demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones, los desembolsos anteriores los utilizo para construir su vivienda y brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción (perlines, puertas, clavos, mano de obra)

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo y cuenta con casa propia. Angela se dedica a la venta de abarrotes los fines de semana, ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja como agente de cobranzas en dos empresas distribuidoras de libros. Además es propietaria de un vehiculo que lo hace trabajar de taxi, dicho vehiculo lo maneja su esposo. Angela se dedica a estas actividades hace mucho tiempo atrás por lo que tiene amplia experiencia en todos los rubros. El nivel de competencia es alto, pero la demanda por dichos productos y servicios es alta también. El destino es para capital de operación, compra de mercadería (compra de abarrotes). Es el tercer crédito individual al que accede Angela en nuestra institución, ya que además es socia de un grupo de Banca Comunal. No presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero ni en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Angela is 29 years old. She is married with a son. Angela works selling groceries on the weekend and during the week she works as a collection agent for two book distributors. Also, she owns a vehicle which he husband uses to work as a taxi driver. Angela has worked in this different areas for a long time and has a lot of experience in all of these areas. While she does face a competition there is also a high level of demand. The loan will be used for operating expenses and the purchase of merchandise (groceries). This is the third loan which Angela has applied for through our institution, and she is a partner in the Community Bank group as well. She has a good credit record and has had no problems with our institution or any others.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a minibus to transport produce

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco H. Rivera tiene 41 años el vive en la comunidad de Viloma de la provincia de Sipe Sipe de la ciudad de Cochabamba a 20 kilómetros de la ciudad él se dedica a la agricultura como y su esposa a la producción de leche al modulo de Viloma.

El trabaja desde muy jovencito está acostumbrado al trabajo de campo él fue abandonado no se crio con sus padres solo con su abuela quien estuvo con él hace tres años que murió y el siente todavía el dolor y la falta de su abuela que era su  madre ya que gracias a ella es un hombre responsable trabajador y dedicado a su familia está casado tiene tres hijos pequeños a los cuales le enseña a ser personas de bien el dice que jamás abandonaría sus hijos ni a su esposa él trabaja de lo que pueda para no hacer faltar ni un pan a sus hijos el empieza en la mañana a la colaboración del ordeño de las vacas porque tiene que entregar en la mañana y en la tarde después va a cortar alfa y después se va al trabajo de sus terrenos o bien va a trabajar como albañil.

El requiere el crédito para la adquisición de una moto cultora para poder realizar su trabajo más liviano para traer el forraje  para las vacas y hacerlo en el menor tiempo posible y de esa manera poder dedicarle un tiempito a sus hijos y con su esposa ya que empiezan a trabajar muy temprano y el nos lo ve a sus hijos pero él trabaja para que tengan un futuro mejor el sueña con que sus hijos terminen la universidad  que tengan una profesión y sean mejor que él y el dice que siente rabia por el abandono de sus padres pero da gracias a Dios por haberse criado con su abuela que era la mejor esa es la historia de Francisco.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco H. Rivera is 41 years old and lives in the community of Viloma in the province of Sipe Sipe within the city of Cochabamba. It is about 20 kilometers to the city. He works as a farmer, and his wife works in milk production. He has worked in the field since he was very young. He grew up without his parents and was raised by his grandmother, who passed away three years ago. He still misses her because she was like his mother and thanks to her he learned how to be a responsible, hard-working man. He is dedicated to his family; he is married with three small children, who he teaches to be good people. He would never leave his children or his wife. He works as hard as he can so that they do not lack for food. He starts his day in the morning helping his wife milk the cows and after that he cuts alfalfa and works his land. Occasionally he works as a mason too. He needs a the loan to purchase farm machinery which will make his work much easier. He will be able to deliver feed for the cows in much less time and thus have more time to spend with his children and wife because he has to start work very early. He works so that his children can have a better future and he dreams of seeing his children finishing university, working as professionals, and having a better life than he has. His abandonment by his parents still bothers him, but he thanks God for his grandmother because she was the best thing that happened in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farm machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a sealing machine

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria R. se dedica a la venta de repostería ambulante ella compra el pan en una panadería  por cantidades y luego sale a las calles a vender, es acompañada y  tiene dos hijos ambos dependen de ella y están estudiando, habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega.

Ella lucha a diario vendiendo en las calles para llevar a su casa el sustento de sus hijos.
texts.en:
La señora Rosa Maria R. se dedica a la venta de repostería ambulante ella compra el pan en una panadería por cantidades y luego sale a las calles a vender, es acompañada y tiene dos hijos ambos dependen de ella y están estudiando, habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega. Ella lucha a diario vendiendo en las calles para llevar a su casa el sustento de sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Venta de reposteria

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una señora de 44 años de edad, Maria es soltera y tiene su vivienda propia. Maria se dedica a la venta de comidas, refrescos y otros frente de la plaza principal de la cuidad donde vive. Maria tiene bastantes años de experiencia en este rubro y su competencia es baja  ya que por la zona no hay muchos lugares de venta de comidas y otros alimentos que ella ofrece, además que ya cuenta con clientela fija que la busca por su calidad y buen servicio. Maria destinó el crédito para comprar una heladera, precisamente para guardar verduras  y carnes, productos que los requiere en buen estado para elaborar los alimentos de una manera más fresca y sana. Maria ha pagado puntualmente en Agrocapital, y además tiene una deuda que está vigente en otra entidad financiera mismas que también las paga de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Maria is a 44 year old woman; she is single and lives in her own home. Maria sells food, refreshments and other goods in the central city square where she lives. Maria has many years of experience in her work and has little competition since there aren’t many places that sell food and other items that she sells in her area. She also has a steady customer base that seeks her services for the quality and service that she offers.
