loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, maize flour, and sugar for her retail shop.

loans.name: Koffi Sénam

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a 34 ans, il vit dans le quartier d’agoé téléssou qui est un quartier périphérique de Lomé avec sa femme et son enfant. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de produits d’entretien et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé,il fait son commerce de façon ambulante. sa clientèle est composée de toutes personnes. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 2005. Son stock est en baisse, il veut se réapprovisionne et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’entretien.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 34 years old and lives with his wife and child in the Agoé Téléssou neighborhood, which lies in the outskirts of Lomé. He has a revenue generating activity retailing cleaning products and gets his supplies at the large market in Lomé. He sells his products on a door-to-door basis. His customer base is made up of all sorts of people. He has been carrying out this activity since 2005. His stock is declining and he would like to get fresh supplies; he is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES for the purchase of various cleaning products.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Fama S. est âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a une expérience de 7 ans et demi dans le domaine de l'embouche et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter une dizaine de moutons qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fama S. is 47 years old, married and mother to four children who are in her care. She has seven and a half years' experience in the animal fattening business and her new loan will allow her to buy ten sheep, which she will fatten up and resell in five months' time. She helps her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her sheep fattening activity

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Cette femme est âgée de 32 ans, elle est très dynamique, en 2005 elle a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois, ce commerce marche bien pour elle, elle exerce son activité dans le marché local de Gbossimé. Elle souhaite rehausser son stock, pour le réaliser elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander un prêt avec lequel elle achètera une vingtaine de sacs de charbons de bois et une  dizaine de sacs de maïs.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, avec les bénéfices de son commerce, elle participe aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady is 32 years old and is very dynamic. In 2005 she began selling charcoal and this business is going well for her. She carries it out in the local market in Gbossimé. She would like to increase her stock, and in order to do this she has contacted WAGES to request a loan, with which she will buy 20 sacks of charcoal and ten bags of corn. She is married and mother to two children. With the profits from her business she contributes to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal and bags of corn

loans.name: Perpetuah

texts.en:
Perpetuah W. is a 30-year-old single mother of two children. Perpetuah sells motorbike spare parts in Shanzu, Mombasa, an area where motorbikes are in high demand for transportation purposes. Perpetuah has been selling spare parts for three years and her business is a success. 

This is Perpetuah's first loan from KADET. With the money, she plans to purchase motorbike spare parts for her store in Shanzu. Her main customers are area residents and motorbike operators in Shanzu. She hopes to become a prosperous businesswoman in Mombasa.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spares parts

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 32 years old and is married to Purity Wanjiku. They have no children yet.
 
Kenneth has a computer services business where he does printing and photocopying and he offers internet services. He has been doing this for the past  year. His business is located near Kenyatta University and his customers are mainly students.

He had no previous credit history before joining KADET and this is his second loan from KADET. He plans to use the loan to buy another computer so that he is able to serve his customers well.

Kenneth hopes to venture into a real estate business in the future.

loans.use: He plans to purchase a computer worth Kshs 30,000

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has been a retailer in Naivasha Town for the past 33 years. He sells domestic products like plastic cups, plates etc. He now wants to stock cereals to sell in his shop because they are in demand. He is 50 years old, married to Beatrice Wanjiku, and they have five school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. With the proceeds from this loan, he plans to buy 10 bags of rice, 5 bags of maize and 5 bags of beans in bulk to sell.  

He plans to expand his shop so that clients can walk in and select different products for themselves in the near future.

loans.use: To stock his shop with cereals

loans.name: Nkenih

texts.en:
H. Nkenih is a married mother of eight currently living in Belo, Cameroon. H. is currently requesting her third loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2007 and has demonstrated a credit-worthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance of meetings, and support of her borrowing group. 

With this latest loan, H. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans. She has requested 170,000 CFA to purchase one bag of rice, one bag of flour, two tins of oil, and two bags of corn. The rest will be used to purchase sugar, spices and maggi (flavoring cubes for soup, like boullion). She believes her business will succeed because of her prior success, ample client base, and increasing demand for her products. She hopes to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s school fees, pay salaries to individuals who manage her farm, purchase seeds for her farm, and reinvest in her business. She will use this loan to manage current afflictions in her life, such as the theft of a significant amount of money, and to build a house for her and her children.

H.’s loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Rice, flour, oil, corn, sugar, fuel wood, maggi

loans.name: Nain

texts.en:
M. Nain is a mother of five children. She is currently living in Kitchu, Cameroon. M. is currently requesting her third loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2007 and has demonstrated a credit-worthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance at meetings, and support of her borrowing group. 

With this latest loan, M. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans. She has requested 135,000 CFA to purchase one bag of corn and one bag of groundnuts. The rest will be put towards the purchase of farmland, firewood and the processing of the corn. She believes her business will succeed because of her prior success, a consistent presence at her location without fail, and multiple orders from her customers. She hopes to use the profits from her business to purchase a piece of land on which she will build a house for her and her children, pay for her children’s school fees, food for her family to eat, medications for her family and reinvest in her business. Her biggest struggle is to take care of her children and she hopes to leverage her relationship with GHAPE to overcome the burden. 

M.’s loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Corn, groundnuts, firewood and rice

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine R. is a single mother with three children: Godias Kipsaina and Brian Kiptoo, who are in secondary school, and Kiprono Godwin who is in primary school. She lives in Sarura about 8 km from Kaiboi Centre. She does dairy farming, sheep rearing and maize and bean farming. She sells her produce during market days in various places.  

Valentine was introduced to Kadet during a church forum for single mothers at the Kaiboi Catholic Church where staff members from Kadet were in attendance and marketed themselves. She has applied for a loan that she will use to buy four sheep for rearing, to prepare her five acres of land for maize planting, and improve her dairy farming in order to get high milk yields. She will save the rest for any emergencies.
 
Valentine is determined to open a retail shop selling fast-moving goods to support her children. The profit she anticipates to generate from this business will be channeled to her children’s education account. She is very optimistic that when she educates her children, they will be able to support her and improve their current status.

loans.use: To buy four sheep for rearing and to prepare her five acres of land for maize planting

loans.name: Tomukum

texts.en:
Tomukum N. S. is a married man who has eight children. He currently lives in Kikfuini, Cameroon. S. is requesting his second loan from GHAPE. He has been with GHAPE since 2008 and has demonstrated a credit-worthy character exemplified by his repayments, consistent attendance at meetings and support of his borrowing group. 

With this latest loan, S. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by is prior loans. He has requested 100,000 CFA in order to purchase plantain suckers for cultivation and coffee for resale. He believes his business will succeed because the demand for plantains and coffee is very high. He hopes to use the profits from his business to feed his family, pay for his children’s school fees, and reinvest in his farm. His biggest struggle is living in impoverished conditions and not always having enough to feed his family, but he hopes to find a way out through his partnership with GHAPE.   

S.'s loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Fertilizer and plantain suckers

loans.name: Nain

texts.en:
Nain Christina is a married mother of eight who currently lives in Kikfuini, Cameroon. Christina is requesting her second loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2008 and has demonstrated a credit-worthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance at meetings, and support of her borrowing group. 

With this latest loan, Christina is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans. She has requested 110,000 CFA in order to purchase two goats, two piglets, and bags of feed. The rest will be put towards clearing and hoeing of her farm. She believes her business will succeed because of her prior experience. She has been in this business for over ten years. She hopes to use the profits from her business to continue reinvesting in her business, purchase kitchen utensils, pay for her children’s textbooks and meet her GHAPE obligations. Her biggest struggle has been the passing of her two sisters within a year. It is a burden she lives with everyday and will do what is necessary to ensure her children stay healthy and safe.   

Christina’s loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy goats, piglets and seedlings

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
Elkana B. is a married father of four. His wife is Tecla B.. He lives and farms in Kapkoros where he sells his farm produce to others for income. He had been in this business for the last 20 years. He normally targets wholesalers in Eldoret town. 

Elkana was introduced to KADET by other existing customers. Before joining Kadet, Elkana used to plant on a one-acre piece of land, but after getting some loans from Kadet, he has grown and he now plants maize on four acres. He has also been able to buy three dairy cows and he sells milk and gets an income from this, as well.

Elikana has applied for another loan which he will use to prepare his land, buy seeds and fertilizers, and buy more feed for his dairy cows. He believes he is a hard-worker and that he will soon be financially stable.

loans.use: To prepare his four acres of land, buy seeds and fertilizers and to improve his dairy farming

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 27-year-old married man and the father of two children. His lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Three years ago, he decided to open his barber shop because he learned the hairdressing occupation from his previous job. He became a talented hairdresser and decided to work for himself. He opened his own barber shop and receives clients from his region and its surroundings.
 
Amir is asking for his first loan to buy additional supplies that he needs, such as hair gels, shaving soap, etc., to expand his client base and increase his business productivity and income. He also plans to redecorate his shop so that he can attract more clients. In the future, he plans to open a second barber shop.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick K. is 25 years old, married to Mercy K., and they both have one child. Erick is a farmer who plants maize, potatoes and tea and this he has done for the last three years. He learned about KADET from another farmer who was already a KADET client. He joined an existing group and was trained on modalities to transform his five acres of idle land into an income-generating project through farming, which he did. He used the previous funding to buy a motorbike and this has generated extra income for him and his family. 

Erick has currently applied for another loan which he will use to prepare his land and buy seeds and fertilizers for the next planting season. Erick intends to open a shop for his wife to enable them to get more income to build a modern house and, thereafter, to take his daughter to a good school.

loans.use: To prepare his five acres of land, buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Hardworking A. Moses started his retail shop business five years ago. Being strategically located in Rukungiri town, he gets many customers, earning him a monthly profit of 150,000 Ugandan shillings. His main drawback is having a small amount of stock that cannot match the demand of his customers.

With this loan, Moses hopes to buy more stock for his business. This will help him expand his business market and also earn more sales revenue. It will enable him to cater for the family requirements of his three children, who are still undergoing school, and also be able to progress economically.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 44-year-old married woman living in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. She has been in the business of selling clothing and women's accessories like bags, belts and jewelry since 1997, in order to help her family improve their financial situation. She doesn’t own a shop; she sells from home. For the ninth time, Amal has requested a loan to purchase merchandise. She has always reimbursed on time. This loan will be used to buy clothing for the new summer season. Her earnings will be used to pay for basic expenses and to acquire other items, such as clothes and accessories that her customers request. In addition, she will use some of the loan to repair her car. Thanks to her previous loans, she has always been able to diversify her merchandise, improve her business and her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 52-year-old married man living with his wife and their four children in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has had a men's clothing shop since 1993 and has many years of experience in this occupation. He has been very reliable with his repayments to Al Majmoua and has repaid his entire loan on time. 

Therefore, for the third time, Moustafa is asking for a new loan to purchase more merchandise for his business, specifically to increase his selection of new collections and to offer a bigger choice of clothes to his clients for the summer season. He's confident that the loan will allow him to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 37-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has been working as a home painter. He works on a freelance basis, upon the request of the clients. He works hard to satisfy the demands of his job in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better life for his family. His previous loans allowed him to purchase new and better tools to improve his work. For the third time, he is requesting a loan to purchase paint tools. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase new and better tools

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 39-year-old married man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He runs a barbershop, where he offers his services cutting hair and giving facial treatments. He has been in this profession for the past nine years. 

Today, for the third time, he is applying for a loan to buy items (chairs, scissors and shaving blades) to increase the income of his barbershop. He always repaid his previous loans on time. These loans allowed him to improve his work by purchasing the necessary tools for his work because when he first opened his business, he had difficulty buying these necessary items.

loans.use: To buy chairs, scissors and shaving blades

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 38-year-old married man and a father of five children. He and his family live together in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He is in charge of an 18-year-old butchery business; he also sells chicken. He was recently approved for his fourth loan, as he needs to increase his working capital and purchase meat and chicken. He has repaid his previous loans on time; these helped him increase his sales by offering a bigger variety of products to his clients. Youssef is known for the good quality of his meat, as well as his competitive prices.

loans.use: To purchase meat and chicken.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa lives in the Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He is a 25-year-old single man. He is involved in retail sales. Moustafa has a mobile shop, where he sells phone accessories like covers, chargers, used mobile phones, phone recharge cards and more. He has been in this business since 2006. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase phones and their accessories. He wants to expand his business. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to purchase merchandise and improve his sales, as well as his income.

loans.use: To purchase phones and accessories

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 49 years old and married with three children. He and his family live in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has been selling car spare parts. He also sells used car spare parts. Ali asked for a loan to purchase more car spare parts to sell. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. Thanks to his previous loans, he was able to diversify his merchandise and expand his stock so that he can meet his clients’ demands. His clients can be anyone from his region. He decided to open his business because of his experience. His plans for the future are to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 32-year-old single man living in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He owns a car-cleaning garage. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a water pump machine for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and is confident that this loan will improve his work. He is special in his work because he does clean work and knows how to take care of cars. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump machine for his work.

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Maireny is the coordinator of her group Union Con Esperanza (Union with Esperanza), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the DR, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outsiD. of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with husband and two children.

Maireny is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes by traveling to the main markets in Santiago and purchasing to sell to her neighbors in her community. She will use the profits to invest in her university education as well as saving towards the education of her children. She also plans to save toward her goal of purchasing a plot of land on which to build her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married, and the father of one daughter who is six years old. He sells second hand clothes at Githurai trading center. This is his primary business, and he has been doing it for a number of years now. Githurai is relatively busy in terms of business and has a high population. This is favorable for his business.

He got to know about KADET through a friend. This is his third loan with KADET. He had no previous credit history. With this loan, John plans to buy more bales of second hand clothes so that he can add to his stock and get better returns. 

He hopes and desires to venture into photography in the long run. He plans to open a photo studio of his own.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes vive en anticrético, con sus dos hijos; está separada del esposo hace mas de 5 años. Trabaja como investigadora social donde percibe un sueldo que no es muy alto, pero además se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates junto con dos amigas, con las cuales creó una pequeña microempresa; actualmente obtuvieron un contrato para elaborar chocolates por el día de la madre y el crédito que solicita es para comprar material (chocolate, azúcar, esencias, y otros)  y de esta manera mantener el negocio estable y seguir generando su ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro; el carácter social del crédito hace que se lo canalize a través de Kiva y pueda acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives under the anticrético modality (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) with her two children; she’s been separated from her husband for over 5 years. She’s employed as a social worker but her salary is not very high. She also manufactures chocolates with two girl friends with whom she set up a micro business. They have a pending order to make chocolates for Mother’s Day and they need funds to buy ingredients (chocolate, sugar, aromatic oils, etc.) so that they can sustain the business and continue to generate earnings. This is her first loan request from Impro. The social nature of the loan makes it eligible for transfer to Kiva for access to funds.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients: chocolate, sugar, aromatic oils, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en casa propia con su esposo en la zona de alto san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es jubilada rentista.

El crédito que solicita es para cambiar todo el sistema eléctrico de su casa, ya que como es casa antigua la humedad fue deteriorando los cables.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her own home with her husband in La Paz’s San Pedro neighborhood; she’s a retired dentist. She needs funds to replace the entire electrical wiring system in her house because, since her house is very old, humidity has damaged the electrical cables. She has been an Impro client since 2008 and always repays on time so she is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay to replace electrical wiring in her home because it’s very old and the cables are in poor condition due to humidity and weather.

loans.name: Joseph Kiptogom

texts.en:
Joseph Kiptogom C. is a fifty-three year old man, married and blessed with six children. He lives in Kapsaos in Eldoret and he is a farmer who plants vegetables for resale. After the harvest he walks around different markets selling his produce and also has a shop in Kapsaos market. He also does dairy farming as a secondary business which increases his income. Joseph has been in this business for four years now.

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. He has applied for a loan which he will use to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

His dream is to own a pick-up car for carrying vegetables and hence making his distribution work easier and faster.

loans.use: For buying farm inputs like fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa De Saron 5 Group

texts.en:
Mimose is the coordinator of her group Rosa de Saron (Rose of Saron). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry. In this area, running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable (outside of the all-inclusive resorts). Mimose makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Mimose is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing in the main markets of her community. She plans to purchase shoes, pants and underwear to sell. She will use the profits to invest in completing construction of her home, as well as saving towards buying a small motorcycle to help her with her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, pants, and underwear to sell

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
A  39 ans, cette dame reste aussi dynamique qu’elle a toujours été, elle exerce comme activité génératrice la vente en détail de savons qu’elle fabrique à l’aide de l’huile rouge et du soda qui sont des entrants dans la fabrication de soda. Ne disposant pas suffisamment d’entrants, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour se réapprovisionner en soda et en huile rouge. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, avec son revenu elle contribue aux dépenses du foyer
texts.en:
At 39 years of age, this woman remains as energetic as she has always been. Her income-generating work involves retail sales of soaps, which she makes with red oil and soda. These are ingredients for making soap. Lacking sufficient ingredients, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to resupply herself with soda and red oil. She is married and the mother of four children. With her income, she takes part in covering household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soda and red oil

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina tiene 33 años, casada y tiene seis hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva ayacuchana. Faustina pasa por una crisis económica, pero asegura que existe un futuro promisorio, tiene secundaria incompleta, por lo que no pudo concretarlo por cosas del destino, dejando sus estudios para integrarse a la actividad agrícola en donde cultiva cacao y plantas frutales. Pese a los obstáculos, no la desanima en su objetivo de sobresalir. A través del sembrío tradicional, ella está preservando parte de la agricultura de sus antepasados y del medio ambiente. En tiempo de sembrío y cosecha, contrata a peones para que le ayuden en esta labor, pero hay oportunidades en que recibe la ayuda de sus familiares, al final sus productos son vendidos al por mayor y menor, en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad, logrando mejorar paulatinamente su economía. Generalmente su tiempo de trabajo es, de lunes a sábado desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM. En el futuro piensa tener una fuente de soda y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos, ya que en sus comunidades hay escasos tiendas de fuente de soda. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece a su grupo comunal por la eficiencia y el buen trato entre compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará terrenos, para así producir a gran escala y de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Faustina, 33, is married and has 6 school-age children. They all live together in their own house in the Ayacucho jungle. Faustina is undergoing an economic crisis but assures us that the future is promising. She did not complete secondary school for destiny prevented her from doing so; she left her schooling in order to incorporate herself into farming where she grows cocoa and fruit trees. Despite obstacles, she is not discouraged of reaching her goals. Through traditional farming methods she is preserving farming techniques of her ancestors and helping to protect the environment. During planting and harvest seasons she hires farmhands to help her with these chores and sometimes her relatives help her out too. She sells her products both at wholesale and retail in her community’s food gathering centers thereby gradually improving her economic conditions. Her usual work routine is 7am to 6pm, Monday-Saturday. In the future she would like to have a soda fountain in order to improve her income because there are just a few soda fountains in her community. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She also expresses her gratitude to her communal group for their efficiency and the nice way they all treat each other. She will use the requested funds to buy farm land to produce good quality products on a larger scale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farmland.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria H. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su hijito de tres meses de edad.
La señora Maria es empleada en un restaurante de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia. 
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda, la misma cedida en obra gruesa por sus padres.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
María H. and her three-month-old son share her parents’ house in the Pasankeri neighborhood of La Paz. She uses her earnings as a restaurant employee to support her family. She is asking for funds to complete a room on her dwelling that her parents have given her still in rough state. This is her 4th loan and the socioeconomic evaluation she underwent indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room for more comfort for herself and her son.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz O. vive en casa propia en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Con sus dos hijos. 
La señora Beatriz es empleada en un centro de salud de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones ( actualmente solo viven en una) ya que sus hijos crecen y necesitan espacio para su normal desenvolvimiento.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Beatriz O. lives in her own home with her two children in the Tembladerani neighborhood of La Paz. She uses her earnings working at a health center in the city to support her family. She will use the requested funds to build two bedrooms (they currently live in just one) because her children are growing and need their own space to develop properly. This is her 2nd loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation done indicate that she qualifies for it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two bedrooms for her children's comfort.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette  femme âgée de 39 ans est mariée et mère de  2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè logopé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, avec ce qu’elle gagne elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays  dans la ville de blitta. Elle fait face en ce moment en une baisse de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  35  sacs de charbons de bois. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
texts.en:
This 39-year old woman is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Agoè Logopé district. She has an income-generating activity selling charcoal, and with the money she earns she contributes to the family's expenses. She gets her supplies inland in the town of Blitta. She is experiencing a decline in her stock at the moment, and since she would like to get fresh supplies she is requesting a loan from WAGES, in order to buy 35 sacks of charcoal. Her customer base is made up of all sorts of people.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Muejres Valientes 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Shely is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Valientes (Valiant Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the DR, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and seven children.

Shely is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing by purchasing large packages of used clothing that come from places like the Salvation Army in the US and then selling them in her community. She will use the profits for completing the construction of her home and buying a sewing machine for both business and personal use. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor Ricardo trabaja como albañil en construcciones privadas, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de la obra fina de dos habitaciones y así concluir su vivienda.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ricardo A. lives in his own home with his wife and three children in La Paz’s Pasankeri neighborhood. He works as a bricklayer at private construction sites; he uses his earnings to support his family. He will use the requested funds to finish work on two bedrooms thus completing building his home. This is his first loan request and the socioeconomic evaluation done indicates that he qualifies for it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building two rooms.

loans.name: Roukéya

texts.fr:
En 2003, cette dame a commencé le commerce de pagnes, elle exerce son commerce  dans une boutique  à  la devanture de sa maison, elle a déjà obtenu du crédit de chez WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé, sa clientèle grandit tous les jours, pour  les satisfaire convenablement elle doit rehausser son stock, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour l’achat de 2 pagnes hollandais,  3 pagnes de  qualité GTP et 10 pagnes de qualité Hi-Target.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
In 2003, this woman began her business of selling pagnes (printed cloth used for wrap clothing). She makes her sales at her home boutique through a walk-up window. She has already received a loan through WAGES that she has properly repaid. Her clientele is growing daily, and to better meet their demands she needs to increase her stock. She is therefore requesting from WAGES a second loan to buy two Dutch pagnes, three high quality GTP brand pagnes, and 10 high quality Hi-Target brand pagnes. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lenghts of cloth

loans.name: Ndere Byara Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
A determined and very ambitious K. Jovia, aged 54 years, is married with four children and two helpless dependents.

Jovia has operated a retail shop business for five years from Rwoya trading centre, Rukungiri District, and at the end of every month is able to fetch a profit of 120,000 Ugandan shillings. Her main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in her business that cannot match the consumption rate of her customers.

Therefore, Jovia is seeking a loan that can help her to stock more goods to satisfy her customers’ high demand and also to transform it into a wholesale business.

Being very committed to her business, with good customer care, Jovia hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a fundamental change in her business and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for her family’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Contra La Pobreza 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Severina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Luchando Contra la Pobreza (Women Fighting Against Poverty), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the DR, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure as a single mother with her four children.

Severina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling gasoline (a common business in the countryside where there may not be a gas station for miles) by purchasing more gasoline as well as adding a small fruit selling business. Severina recognized that she could easily sell fruit to her customers while they filled up on gasoline and has decided to diversify her business (sound like any gas stations you know?).  She will use the profits to invest in a plot of land on which she would like to eventually build her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline, glass containers, oranges, papayas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic plates and bowls

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 44 años, es casada, de los cuales tiene 3 hijos, siendo los 2 últimos que se encuentra en etapa escolar, y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un centro poblado de Ayacucho. Para Irene su naturaleza fue más fuerte, no en vano desde niña ha vendido todo lo que producían sus padres. Desde entonces ha continuado con esta actividad, que es la agricultura, especialmente la producción y comercialización de Plátano y Cacao. Durante la etapa de siembra y cosecha necesita de peones para ayudarla en su labor, abarcando entonces casi toda la semana, de Lunes a Sábado, desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, trabajando en sus campos con esmero y dedicación. Al final los productos que cosecha son vendidos en su comunidad a un precio accesible para el consumidor. En el futuro espera cumplir su sueño de construir su casa a base de material noble, para que así mejO. la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y asegura cumplir fielmente con todas sus cuotas establecidas, además agradece la transparencia y veracidad de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de verduras, para aumentar y variar la mercadería que vende, de esa manera mejorará sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Irene, 44, is married and has three children; the youngest two are still school-age. They live together in their own home located in a populous section of Ayacucho. Irene has always been of strong character and has always sold everything her parents produced. Since then, she has continued with farming, especially bananas and cocoa. During planting and harvest seasons she requires farmhands to help her with chores taking almost the entire week, from Monday through Saturday, from 7am to 6pm, to work the fields with dedication and great care. At the end, her products are sold in her community at an accessible price for the consumer. In the future she wants to reach her dream of having her house built with substantial materials so that her family’s quality of life will improve. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she assures that she will continue to repay in a timely fashion. She is also grateful for the transparency and honesty of her communal group. She will use the requested funds to buy vegetables so that her stock will be mO. varied thereby improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic plates and bowls

loans.name: Monica Maria

texts.es: La Sra. C. G. Monica Maria, vive en el Caserío de la Joya perteneciente al distrito de Santiago,  junto a sus dos  hijos. Trabaja como obrera de campo en el fundo del Sr. Miguel Ascuna desde hace 3 años. Su casa es de adobe revestido. Solicita financiamiento para terminar la construcción de su vivienda ya que esta fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es poder terminar su casa para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra. Monica agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a traves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mónica María C. G. lives in the La Joya settlement, Santiago district, with her two children. She has worked as a field hand on Mr. Miguel Ascuna’s farm estate for the last three years. Her house is made of coated adobe and she needs funding to finish building it because it was damaged by the 2007 earthquake. Her dream is to finish building her house in order to provide her family with improved quality of life. Mónica is grateful for whatever help we might be able to offer through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Arturo De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Arturo de Jesús R. D., tiene la edad de 39 años, vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino con su compañera de vida la cual trabaja como domestica, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad casados e independientes, ellos son agricultores desde hace 8 años, gracias al papa quien le enseño los menesteres del cultivo de la piña.

Dentro de los planes que tienen a futuro está la apertura de un negocio en la vivienda para que sea su esposa quien la administre y así mismo cuide del hogar debido a que el lugar donde habitan se ha registrado varios robos,  ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, fungicidas, semillas, e insumos vegetativos que brinden un mejor mantenimiento a las tierras para una producción de mayor calidad y su posterior venta, este apoyo que se le brinde a la familia R. lo beneficiara para planificarse a futuro a nuevos proyectos que deseen emprender como familia.
texts.en:
Arturo de Jesús R. D., 39, lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood with his life partner, who is a domestic employee. They have three adult, married, independent children. They have been farmers for the past 8 years thanks to his father who taught him how to grow pineapple. Among their future plans is to set up a business in their home that the wife can tend to while watching over their home because the area they live in has had several robberies. They are requesting funds to buy farming supplies like, fertilizers, fungicides, seed and other supplies that will allow for better field maintenance and improved crop quality for better post-harvest sales. This help will help the R. family for their future family projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fungicides, seed and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.en: Ivonne T. is 50 years old, lovely and happily married with two children,all girls.The first child is married and the last is still in school. Her husband worK as a surveyor and they live in Circular road,where she sells her goods of gara clothing (indigo dyed clothing using the local gara plant),shirts, African wears,and pig meat. Ivonne has been a LAPO,SL client for more than a year now,and she has taken three previous loans.With her past loans,she helped to train her daughter in school,and expand her business.She is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Leones from Kiva lenders with the help of LAPO,SL to enable her buy more of her goods for sale.

loans.use: To purchase gara clothing, shirts, African wear and pig meat.

loans.name: Mariattu

texts.en: Mariattu B. is 27 years old and married with a baby girl who is in nursery school. Her husband is a lecturer in one of the schools in Freetown. She sells gara clothes (indigo dyed clothing) very close to Circular Road where she lives with her family. Mariattu has taken three previous loans from LAPO SL to purchase the same type of goods for sale and used the profit for her daughter's school fees. She is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to buy more goods like potatoes, pig meat, and different types of female wear to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, pig meat, and different types of female wear to sell

loans.name: Yeama

texts.en: Yeama Y. is a trader who has a provisions shop along the Old Railway Line in Bo. She is married to a surveyor and has two children. Both children are in secondary school. Her husband assists her greatly in terms of sales and even monitors to see that her business does well. She is seeking a loan to buy more items to stock her shop in order to meet her customers' needs. She is very committed to her business and hopes to use the proceeds from the business to start building her house and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Jacinto tiene 39 años, convive con la madre de sus cuatro hijos, que se encuentra en etapa escolar y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un centro poblado de Ayacucho. Lo suyo es el campo, desde que tenía 12 años. Es así que cada mañana parte a su chacra, por lo que se siente feliz ejerciendo este oficio, de agricultor, siendo el cultivo de cacao lo que realiza. Jacinto sintió que tenía que entrar en acción, es por ello que está rescatando un patrimonio, de los que sus padres lo hicieron de la misma manera. Desde luego que en época de sembrío y cosecha necesita de sus peones, pero en tiempo de vacaciones escolares, entre Enero a Marzo, recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Generalmente  sus productos los vende en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad, resultándole rentable esta venta, ayudándolo a sostener a su familia. En el futuro espera ampliar su terreno de cultivo, para que así pueda cultivar Café y Frutas cítricas. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, del cual se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos respectivos, además no tiene ninguna dificultad con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su chacra, para que pueda en menor tiempo producir en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 39 years old. He lives with the mother of his four children, who are of school age. They live together in their own house, located in the city of Ayacucho. The field has been his since he was 12. Thus every morning he leaves for his farm, and for this he feels happy, doing the work of a farmer, raising cacao. Jacinto felt that he had to take action; it is for that reason that he is redeeming a patrimony, just as his parents did. Since then, in the planting and harvest seasons he needs workers, but during the school vacations, between January and March, he receives the help of his children. He generally sells his products in the Collection Center of his community, which results in a profitable sale, helping him to support his family.

In the future, he hopes to extend the land he cultivates, so that he can also raise coffee and citrus fruits. This is his fourth loan from MFP, and he promises to make all the payments. Furthermore, he has no difficulties with the members of his community bank. With the loan he is applying for, he will invest in the maintenance of his farm, so that he can produce greater quantities in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his farm

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Luisa C. le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto en el patio trasero y la barda. 
Solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material que necesita ya que su esposo el señor Ángel Martinez quien se dedica a la construcción y el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Planean pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo, como empleada de limpieza. Desea la seguridad y el bien estar de su familia. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Ángel Martinez, esposo del la señora Maria Luisa C., ya que ella se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
The home of Señora Maria Luisa C. lacks a concrete floor and a wall for the rear patiol. She is applying for a loan because she does not have the money necessary to be able to buy the material that she needs. Her husband, Señor Ángel Martinez, works in construction, and he will take charge of completing the improvements in his time after work.

They plan to pay back the loan with the salary that she receives from her work as a cleaning woman. Her desire is the security and well being of her family. The person in the photo is Señor Ángel Martinez, the husband of Señora Maria Luisa C., since she was at work on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Laying a concrete floor and building a wall

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 70 años, es casado y tiene siete hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el centro poblado de Rosario, ubicada en Ayacucho. Para Juan su trabajo ha estado ligado desde siempre a la actividad agrícola y se ha venido desarrollando en esta actividad desde hace 50 años aproximadamente. Él se dedica a cultivar cacao, café y frutas cítricas; en tiempos de cultivo y cosecha necesita de sus peones para que lo realicen en un menor tiempo y costo, pero usualmente él está en su chacra cuidando de sus cultivos ante cualquier plaga de insectos que afectase sus productos. Normalmente sus productos los vende en los Centros de Acopio de sus comunidad, pero sus frutas los vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Pese a la crisis social que atravesaron hace dos décadas, están tratando de recuperarse de a poco, es por ello que en el futuro espera ampliar su terreno de cultivo para que pueda cumplir con sus compromisos hacia sus clientes potenciales. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, del cual se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas en las fechas determinadas, además se siente conforme con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, espera cumplir con los pagos a sus peones, además desea aplicar  abono a su terreno de cultivo.
texts.en:
Juan is 70 years old. He is married and has seven children. They live together in their own home located in the town of Rosario, in the Ayacucho district. For Juan, his work has always been tied to agricultural activity, and he has been expanding in this activity for approximately 50 years. He cultivates cacao, coffee, and citrus fruits. During the growing and harvest seasons, he needs workers to complete these tasks with less time and cost, but usually he is at his farm caring for his crops in the face of any plague of insects that might affect his products. Normally he sells his products in the Collection Centers of his community, but he sells his fruit in the city of Ayacucho. In spite of the social crisis that they went through two decades ago, they are trying to recover little by little. It is for that reason that in the future he hopes to expand the land that he cultivates so that he can fill his obligations to his potential clients.

This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he promises to make the established payments on time, and in addition, he is complying with his community bank. With the loan that he is applying for, he will pay his workers, and he also wants to apply fertilizer to the land he cultivates.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay his workers and buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Miguel S. le está haciendo falta la construcción de un cuarto, ya solo tiene una recamara y desea construir el cuarto que será para sus hijos.
El solicita el préstamo porque no cuenta con el dinero necesario para empezar a realizar la mejora, lo más pronto posible ya que sus niños quieren su propio espacio en la casa. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con el sueldo que percibe de su trabajo como empleado de una fabrica en el departamento de producción, ya que su esposa la señora Jovita Acosta se encargara de los gastos familiares en el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo como supervisora de cocina de un centro comercial. 
Don Miguel quiere que su familia tenga un mejor lugar donde vivir y que estén seguros.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel S. needs to add a room to his house. He only has one bedroom and wishes to build a room for his children.

He is applying for a loan because he doesn’t have the money necessary to carry out the improvement. He wants to add the room as soon as possible since his children want their own space.

He plans to pay off the loan from the salary he receives from his job in the production department of a factory. His wife, Señora Jovita Acosta, will take care of the household expenses from the income she obtains from her job as the supervisor in a restaurant kitchen in a shopping center. Don Miguel wants his family to have a better place to live and wants them to be secure.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin construction of a room.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “SARITA COLONIA”, está conformado por 8 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en la zona de Chosica, departamento de Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desde hace 1 año y 2 meses.
Rigoberto quien es socio del grupo, tiene 51 años, es casado, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y uno Rigoberto asume el cargo de presidente desde hace 5 meses. Desde hace 3 años se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de internet, se inicio primero con video juegos y además su esposa administra una cafetería en un colegio. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado mejorar y construir su vivienda, ha ido creciendo como microempresario ya que ha comprado mas maquinas (computadoras). El gran sueño de Rigoberto es seguir creciendo y más adelante poner un locutorio (alquiler de líneas telefónicas).
El préstamo otorgado será utilizado para invertir en su negocio comprando máquinas (computadoras). Agradecen el apoyo brindado e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The “Sarita Colonia” Communal Bank consists of eight enterprising members who live in the Chosica area of the Department of Lima. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for a year and two months.

Rigoberto is a member of the group. He is 51 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are adults and one still lives with him. Rigoberto was elected the group president five months ago. Three years ago, he decided to provide Internet booths for rent. He originally started a video game center and his wife manages a high school cafeteria. Through his hard work, Rigoberto was able to build and improve his home. He has already grown as a micro-entrepreneur by acquiring more computers. Rigoberto’s greatest wish is to continue growing and eventually open a call center (where he offers phones lines for rent). His loan will be invested in his business by purchasing additional computers. He appreciates the support and initiative of his Communal Bank and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computers

loans.name: Mujeres Inteligentes 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Inteligentes (Intelligent Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the DR, an area famous for natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her mother and two children.

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and excited at the opportunity to take loans at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado or small general store by purchasing sugar, rice, cooking oil and sauces to stock her store. She will use the profits to provide for the basic daily needs of her children and her mother. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil and sauces

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  es una persona proactiva y emprendedora a sus 68 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos todos ellos independientes, trabaja con EDAPROSPO prosperidad desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares (cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, etc.),  además realiza filmaciones y fotos en eventos, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado dar una mejor educación a sus hijos, mejorar su calidad de vida y el acabado de su vivienda. 
El gran sueño de Francisco, es seguir creciendo con su negocio y apoyar a su familia. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra mercadería (útiles escolares). Francisco se encuentra muy agradecido por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a salir adelante y a prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is a proactive and enterprising 68-year-old married father of 4 grown children. He has been working with EDAPROSPO Prosperidad for 5 years. He sells school supplies (notebooks, books, pencils, etc.) for a living. Additionally, he provides video and photography services at special events. With his daily efforts, he has managed to provide his children with an education, improve his quality of life, and complete his home.

Francisco's biggest dream is to keep expanding his business and to support his family. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise: school supplies. Francisco is very grateful for all the support that he has been given because it has helped him and his family get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 34 años, casada y madre de cuatro hijos, siendo los tres primeros mayores y el último menor de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia en el centro poblado de Rosario, ubicada en Ayacucho. Lidia se caracteriza por su tesón y poder de convencimiento hacia sus clientes, es una mujer que tiene presente la revaloración de la cultura peruana, además alude, de ser perseverantes en las metas propuestas. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo, negocio que le da buenos resultados; usualmente su trabajo empieza desde las 5:00 AM hasta las 5:00 PM y de vez en cuando recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos. En el futuro piensa vendar verduras de toda clase de variedad, para que así su negocio sea variable. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete fielmente a cumplir con sus pagos establecidos, además hace referencia al buen manejo de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una determinada cantidad de pollos para su respectiva venta.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 34-year-old married mother with four children, the three eldest being adults and the youngest a minor. They live in their home in the town of Rosario, located in Ayacucho. Lidia is known for her tenacity and persuasive skills that she directs towards her customers. She values Peruvian culture, and she alludes that she perseveres when it comes to her goals. She sells chicken for a living, which has been very beneficial for her. She starts working from 5:00 am to 5:00 pm, and every once in a while, she gets help from her husband and children. In the future, she would like to sell all types of vegetables so that her business can be more diverse. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to repaying the loan faithfully. With the loan that she is requesting, she will purchase a pre-determined amount of chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario De San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”, actualmente se encuentra en el XIII ciclo y está conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por los socios; Guido es el presidente,  Marisol es la secretaria, Hilda es la tesorera y Dedicación es la fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa sede Cusco.        

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo,  venta de lubricantes, venta de joyería, venta de accesorios de computadoras, venta de repuestos de carros y venta de quesos. Otros socios brindan servicios como por ejemplo carpintería, mecánica, empleadas de hostales y uno es chofer la municipalidad de Anta.

Frine se dedica a varias actividades como por ejemplo a la venta de lubricantes y a la venta de comida, ella tiene una tienda alquilada donde vende sus lubricantes y su comida, ella vende lubricantes de lunes a sábados de 7 am hasta 8pm. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar comida y luego lo vende. Su esposo tiene un taller de reparación  de automóviles y así esta forma ayuda al ingreso económico del hogar. Ya son 4 años que Frine participa en el banco comunal y le ha va muy bien gracias a su puntualidad y responsabilidad con los pagos de las cuotas, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo filtros  y aceites. El sueño de Frine es abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos de carros.              
 	
Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

(En la foto pequeña a mano izquierda sale la señora Hilda, quien no pudo asistir a la reunion de desembolso por tener otra obligación, su esposo estaba siendo evacuado a la ciudad de Lima porque se encontraba mal de salud).
texts.en:
The Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian Group, which is currently in its thirteenth loan cycle, is comprised of 14 hard-working and enterprising people who are always looking for the opportunity to get ahead in life. They make great efforts to provide their children with a better future. This communal bank is represented by Guido, the group president; Marisol, the secretary; Hilda, the treasurer; and Dedicación, the advisor. The members get together once a month in the microfinance offices of the Asociación Arariwa, Cusco headquarters. Some of the members have businesses in which they sell merchandise such as motor oil, jewelry, computers and accessories, auto parts, and cheese. Other members provide carpentry, automotive, or cleaning services. One of the members is a driver in the municipality of Anta. Frine sells motor oil and fast food. She rents a shop in which she sells her merchandise. She sells motor oil from Monday to Saturday, 7am to 8pm. She gets up very early in the morning to prepare the food that she sells. Her husband has an auto repair shop, and they both help with the household expenses. Frine has been working with the communal bank for 4 years, and she has prospered because she is punctual and responsible with her payments. She needs this loan in order to purchase merchandise, such as filters and motor oil. Frine's dream is to open up her own auto part shop. Cusco is a city that is well-known for its archaeological centers, its history, and its landscapes, which makes it an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. (Hilda is pictured in the small photo in the bottom lefthand corner. She was unable to attend the loan disbursement meeting due to other obligations - her husband was in poor health and had to be brought to Lima).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase filters and motor oil

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: A  41 ans cette femme reste une dame très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. le revenu de son commerce lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Son stock de marchandises a diminué, pour se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’une trentaine de pagnes. Elle est mariée
texts.en:
At the age of 41 Kokoè is still a very dynamic lady. Her income generating activity is selling pagnes (colorful West African wax cloths), which she has done since 2004. She gets her supply from the Great Market in Lomé. The income from her business enables her to provide for her family. Kokoè's inventory is now depleted, which is why she applied to WAGES for a loan to restock with 30 pagnes. She is married.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes

loans.name: M.c.a Primary School, Bendugu Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the M.C.A. primary school, in Bendugu village, in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1955 by the M.C.A. Mission. Currently, the school is staffed with 8 teachers and 395 pupils. This will be the second loan this school is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. The first loan this school accessed from Kiva was in April 2009. That loan made significant improvements in the lives of these borrowers. 

School staff from this institution, like many other school's staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would not otherwise be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Kabba K. J. (pictured on the left) is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group of teachers. The 59-year-old man was born in Bendugu village, which is about 60 miles away from Magburaka town.  He is married to a teacher and they have seven children.  Kabba, who has been a teacher for 34 years, is requesting a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, nails, boards, etc. in order to complete building a five bedroom-and-parlor house he started building with the help of the first Kiva loan he received.   

(Attached to this photo are some snapshots of borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house-building materials

loans.name: Koffi A

texts.fr: ajoute
texts.en:
ajoute

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing coffee and cacao

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar P. se dedica a la construcción desde hace ya más de diez años.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto de que será para sus dos hija que ya están en la adolescencia y quieren su privacidad, ya que comparten el una habitación con sus hermanos menores. Solo le esta haciendo falta el material ya que le se encargara de la construcción en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
El se encargara de pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que obtiene de sus trabajos, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Elena Zavala se encargara de los gastos familiares, en el sueldo que recibe como empleada de una fabrica.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar P. has been working in construction for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan in order to start building a room for his two adolescent daughters, who want some privacy at this stage as they currently share a room with their younger siblings. The only things he needs are building materials since he will build the room himself in his spare time. He will repay the loan with the income he obtains from work since his wife, Maria Elena Zavala, takes care of the family expenses with the money she receives as a factory worker.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an additional room

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme est une femme qui est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de LOMNAVA qui est un quartier périphérique de ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, plus tard elle a associée à son activité le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle fait face en une diminution de son stock, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  divers pagnes de qualité Wax et hi Target et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This is a married woman who is the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Lomnava district on the outskirts of the town of Lomé. Her business is selling “pagnes” (traditional fabrics for food clothing). She later added selling groceries to her business. Her stock is being depleted. She would like to restock her goods, which is why she is seeking a WAGES credit to purchase different high-quality was and Hi-Target pagnes as well as various grocery products.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing "pagnes" fabrics and grocery products (for resale)

loans.name: Penda Satou

texts.fr: Penda Satou S. est une femme de 71 ans, elle est marie et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DANKH S. depuis 7 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Son activité principale est l'embouche ovine, mais parallèlement elle fait un petit commerce de tissu au niveau de son quartier. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Penda Satou S. is a 71-year old woman, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Dankh S. Banc Villageois for seven and a half years and had already obtained 15 loans, all of which she had always managed well and paid back on time. Her main business activity is raising sheep, but in addition she sells fabrics in her neighborhood. Her income allows her to contribute to the improvement of her family’s life conditions

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing and strengthening her business

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de vêtements spécialement des costumes vestes, elle s’approvisionne à l’étranger. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante, elle approche les gens  dans les entreprises, sa clientèle est composée en majorité de personnes qui travail dans les banques et sociétés privées. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire les commandes de ses clients. Elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour l’achat de 10 boubous et 03 boubous.
texts.en:
Kokoè's income generating activity is the sale of clothes, in particular suits and jackets. She gets her supply from abroad. She is a door-to-door saleswoman and approaches people at their workplace. Most of her customers work in banks and privately hold companies. Kokoè's inventory is too low to meet her customers' demand. She came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy two batches of bubus (African dresses for both women and men), consisting of 10 and 3 items respectively.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Mirian Oneida

texts.es:
la sra. Mirian Oneida O. E. se dedica a su negocio que es una pulpería y venta de frutas la cual esta ubicada frente al estacionamiento de buses de la Terminal de transportes de Jutiapa Jamastran; actividad en la cual cuenta con 4 ½ años de experiencia.
El crecimiento de su negocio es notable y esto debido a la buena atención que le brinda sus clientes y por la administración que le da al mismo.
Doña Miriam, es casada y su esposo emigro para USA hace 3 ½ años, con la visión de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y tener su propia vivienda, sueño que hasta el momento casi lo logra en su totalidad, ya que doña Miriam tiene 4 meses da vivir en la casa que tanto soñaron juntos, aunque todavía le faltan muchos detalles, pero ella se siente feliz de vivir en su propia vivienda, para la construcción de la vivienda su esposo le mandaba el dinero en remesas pero muchas veces se pasaba del presupuesto y ella de su negocio terminaba de cubrir los gastos.
Del matrimonio ellos procrearon tres hijos, los cuales dependen a un 100% de ellos y en los últimos años doña Miriam ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para su pulperia.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirian Oneida O. E. runs her own general and produce store, which is located in front of the bus terminal of Jutiapa Jamastran. She has 4 1/2 years of experience.

Her business has grown significantly due to her great customer service and management skills.

Ms. Mirian is married, and her husband immigrated to the USA 3 1/2 years ago, with the hopes of improving his living conditions and of obtaining his own house, a dream which he has almost completely achieved. Mirian has been living in their dream house for 4 months even though there is still some work to be done on it. However, she feels happy to live in her own home. In order to build this house, her husband would send her remittances from the US, but she would sometimes go over the budget and would have to cover the additional costs with the money from her business.

They have 3 children who depend on them 100%. Mirian has been both a mother and a father to those children in the last few years. She will use this loan in order to purchase merchandise for her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, doughnuts, churros, bathroom tissue, candy, beans, juice, chili peppers, and grains

loans.name: Akim Christel

texts.fr:
