Ce monsieur a ouvert sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale qu’il a appelé « Ets BAS prix »,  sa clientèle est composée de toutes personnes et grandit tous les jours, pour les satisfaire convenablement il doit rehausser son stock, raison pour laquelle il s’adresse à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en divers produits d’alimentation générale.
Il est marié et père d’un enfant, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This man keeps his own grocery shop called « Ets BAS prix » [“LOW prices too”]. His customer base is very diverse and grows day by day. In order to properly satisfy customer demand he needs to increase his stock, which is why he has turned to WAGES in order to be able to stock up on grocery items. He is married and the father of one child. It is with the income from his shop that he supports his family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various grocery items (for resale)

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye D. est âgée de 63ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Son ancienneté de 4 ans dans le Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE lui a offert la possibilité de bénéficier 8 fois de suite de crédit. Elle fait essentiellement de l'embouche bovine, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'aliment de bétail et un bœuf qu'elle engraissera pour revendre au bout de 5 mois. Elle participe au bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye D. is 63 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her four years of seniority with Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE has provided her with eight consecutive opportunities for loans. Ndèye essentially fattens cattle. Her new loan will allow her to buy livestock feed and a cow or steer, which she will fatten up for resale after five months. She contributes to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a steer to fatten

loans.name: Clerida Yaneth

texts.es:
la señora Clerida Yaneth A. A. tiene 43 de edad,  se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general en su negocio que lleva como nombre "la preferida". nos comento que la situacion al inicio de operaciones en su negocio fue muy dificil por muy pocas oportunidades para empezar su negocio, con el pasar del tiempo le llegaron oportunidades las cuales las aprovecho al maximo y desde entonces a salido adelante, la pulperia año a año a ido 
creciendo poco a poco pero seguro y tambien nos comento que las ventas no estan muy bien por muchas razones en nuestro pais. en la zona de nacaome hay mucho desempleo pero dice que esto tiene que mejorar lentamente para  salir adelante.   

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas variedad, su sueño es convertir su pulperia en un mini super para ofrecerle mas variedad de productos a los clientes ya que gracias a ellos a salido adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clerida Yaneth A. A., age 43, sells groceries and has named her business “The Preferred”. She told us that at the start of her business was very difficult due to the few opportunities available, yet with the passage of time, opportunities arose of which she took full advantage and since then, her business has moved forward. Year after year the grocery store has grown slowly but surely. She also told us that sales are not very good for many reasons in her country. In the Nacaome area unemployment is high, but she says it must improve slowly to move forward. The loan would be used to buy more merchandise and therefore offer more variety. Her dream is to make her grocery store a small super-market in order to provide a greater variety of products to customers, and thanks to such customers, move forward herself.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, churros, beans, rice, butter, sugar, coffee, bread, biscuits, corn flour, tortillas, soups, pastas, sauces, batteries, juice, candy..

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 37 años, casada y madre de tres hijos que aún son menores, y juntos viven en una pequeña casa, ubicada en la zona selva de Ayacucho. Perseverante y trabajadora, desde niña le prohibieron sus padres que trabajase para dedicarse por completo a los estudios. Con el pasar del tiempo se convirtió en madre y se dio cuenta que le faltaba algo por lo que determinó instalar un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, por lo que ya lleva trabajando casi 4 años en esta actividad, proporcionándole buenas rentas, no contenta con ello, también cultiva cacao, pero en pequeñas parcelas. Generalmente trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo, quien la ayuda a vender su cosecha en su propia comunidad. En el futuro espera comprar terrenos para que cultive diferentes productos y en grandes volúmenes. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, durante las fechas establecidas, además no tiene dificultades con su grupo  comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos que tiene mayor demanda y necesidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, is married and has three minor children; they live together in a small house in the Ayacucho jungle. Persevering and hard-working, as a young girl her parents would not allow her to work but insisted she concentrate on her studies. As time went by and she became a mother herself, she realized that she was missing something. She decided to open a grocery store that she’s now had for almost 4 years; it has produced good profits. Not content with just this, she also farms cocoa beans on small lots. She usually works alone but sometimes her husband helps her sell her harvested crops in her community. She would like to buy land in the future in order to grow large quantities of a variety of crops. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion; she also has no problem with her communal allotments. She will use the requested funds to buy the stock items that are in most demand in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye G. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Depuis 4 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE et a eu 08 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a eu aucune fois de problème de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de bétail, son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter un bœuf qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois. Et les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permetrront de participer financièrement à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Ndèye G. is 43 year old, she is married and the mother of six children. For the last six years she has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Dankh Sene. She has received 8 consecutive loans and never had a problem repaying. She sells livestock. Her new loan will allow her to buy an ox that she will fatten up and resell after 5 months. The profit engendered by her activity will enable her to participate financially in providing for the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her cattle fattening activity

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria tiene 47 años está casada con el señor Félix  y juntos tienen 3 hijos de (12,7 y 4) años, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos y actualmente se encuentra delicada de salud, pues los médicos de detectaron Quistes en el Útero por lo tanto ella y su marido están muy preocupados por la situación que se vive en la casa.

La señora Gregoria y su familia vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de chaupi suyo, viven en una pequeña casa humilde , su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda , cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos , actualmente tiene solamente 3 cabezas de ganado lechero, y el esposo traba de albañil todos los días de lunes a sábado , pues ella sigue trabajando a pesar de que esta muy enferma, ya que los pocos ingresos que tiene su marido no alcanza para los gastos del mes y para el tratamiento médico que está realizando.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de un ganado lechero, y de esta manera incremente la producción de la leche y mejora sus ingresos.

Entre sus metas y sueños es recuperarse muy pronto de ese enfermedad y seguir trabajando para que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 47 years old, married to a man named Felix, and has three children ages 4, 7, and 12. They are an economically disadvantaged family and currently dealing with health issues, since doctors found cysts in Gregoria's uterus. Both she and her husband are very worried about the situation their family is in.

Gregoria and her family live in the city of Cochabamba in the neighborhood of Chaupi Suyo. They live in a small, humble home and their principal business is producing raw milk, which they sell to a company that makes a variety of different dairy products. Right now they have only 3 milk cows and her husband works as a brick layer Monday through Saturday, so she has to keep working in spite of the face she is very sick because the income her husband brings home is not enough to cover the monthly expenses and her medical treatment.

The loan would be used to buy another milk cow and in this way increase their production of milk and earnings.

Among her goals and dreams is to recover quickly from her illness and continue working so that her children can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy another milk cow

loans.name: Dioula

texts.fr: Dioula S. est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi et a eu de belles performances en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficier 7 fois de suite et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son prêt lui servira à acheter 01 bœuf à engraisser pour être revendu au bout de 5 mois. Les profits générés par son activité lui permet de participer financièrement à la prise en charge familial.
texts.en:
Dioula S. is 38 years old, she is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” for three and a half years. She has shown great achievement in the matter of borrowing. She received 7 consecutive loans and has never had a problem reimbursing. She fattens cattle. Her loan will be used to buy one ox to fatten that will be resold after 5 months. The profit engendered by her activity enables her to participate financially to the family’s budget.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To better develop her cattle sale business

loans.name: Camino A Jerico Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Camino a Jerico con domicilio colonia morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es constituido con el fin de solicitar un prestamo para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo para inversion de sus negocios. son tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

 
El señor Faustino I. M. tiene de 58 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo que depende de el, los otros hijos estan en los estados unidos,  Faustino se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su pulperia que instalo en su casa de habitacioon, ademas destaza cerdos los fines de semana. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para su pulperia.

la señora Luz Idalia R. tiene de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos que estan estudiando y le ayudan en la casa con la limpieza mientras ella sale ha vender ropa y carne en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo,  el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior. Su deseo es que sus hijos se graduen del colegio.

doña Clisanta E. B. tiene 61 años de edad es viuda, dependen de ella dos hijos. tiene nietos.
Clisanta vende ropa usada y con una hija tambien tienen una pequeña pulperia. El credito lo utilizara para comprar un fardo de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The solidary group "Camino a Jerico", located in "colonia morazan" of the town of San Lorenzo has been established with the purpose of requesting a loan to be spent as work capital for business investment. It has three members, two women and a man. Below is the description of their activities.´

Mr. Faustino I. M. is 58 years old, single and has 1 son who depends on him, his other children are in the U.S.A. Faustino has a general store set up at his house and he also cuts pigs in pieces on the week-ends. The loan will be spent to buy merchandise for his general store.

Mrs. Luz Idalia R. is 49 years old, a single mother of two students who helps her with the chores while she goes out to sell clothes and meat in the neighborhoods of san lorenzo. The loan will be spent to buy underwear. It is her wish that her children graduate from school.

Doña Clisanta E. B. is 61 years old, a widow and two children depend on her. She has grandchildren. Clisanta sells second-hand garments and she also runs a small grocery stores with one of her daughters. The loan will be spent to buy a bundle of used clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes, meat, vegetables, beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, candles, cooking oil, coffee, bread, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Es el segundo crédito que solicita el señor R., el cual lo utilizara para el mantenimiento de cultivo de plátano.
Aparte de ser productor trabaja como profesor de educación primaria en la zona de Tonalá El Viejo, desde diez años.
Es casado padre de una niña la cual ha sustentado a su familia  con esta actividad
texts.en:
Es el segundo crédito que solicita el señor R., el cual lo utilizara para el mantenimiento de cultivo de plátano. Aparte de ser productor trabaja como profesor de educación primaria en la zona de Tonalá El Viejo, desde diez años. Es casado padre de una niña la cual ha sustentado a su familia con esta actividad

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: mantenimiento de platanos

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty M. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 3 ans et a reçu 6 fois de suite de crédit. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité qui est l'embouche bovine pour l'avoir pratiquée pendant au moins 03 ans. Elle va acheter de l'aliment de bétail et une paire de bœufs, les engraisser pendant 4 à 5 mois pour aller revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans les charge familiales.
texts.en:
Maty M. is a 26-year-old woman, married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Keur Ngalgou for the last three years and has benefited from six consecutive loans. She has a great experience in her sector of activity - fattening cattle - having practiced this for at least three years. She will buy cattle feed and a pair of oxen. She will fatten them up for four to five months and then resell them at the weekly markets in her town. This activity provides her with a profit that allows her to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her cattle sales activity

loans.name: Romulada Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery tiene 45 años lastimosamente se quedo viuda muy joven a los 30 años y con tres hijos pequeños, tuvo que ser muy fuerte y  trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos , su esposo murió en un accidente D. trabajo y desD. entonces vive sola con sus tres hijos D. (21,19,16) años D. los cuales el mayor ha logrado estudiar una carrera profesional (contaduría pública) , el siguiente ha empezado a estudiar ( odontología) y el ultimo esta en el colegio , por lo tanto la  señora Rosmery tiene que trabajar mucho mas hasta que los dos hijos terminen D. estudiar.

Esta familia vive en la ciudad D. Cochabamba en la localidad D. la Maica Central, su principal actividad es la producción D. la leche cruda cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración D. productos lácteos, actualmente cuenta con 10 cabezas D. ganado lechero.

El préstamo es destinado para la compra D. forraje, lo cual es importante para la buena alimentación del ganado y D. esta manera siga con la misma cantidad D. producción D. leche.

Entre sus metas lo más importante para ella es que los 2 hijos terminen D. estudiar una carrera profesional y aumentar la producción D. la leche para D. esta manera también ahorrar para su vejes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosmery is 45 years old. Unfortunately she became a widow when she was only 30 years old with three young children. She had to be strong and work hard to bring up her children properly. Her husband died in a work accident and since then she has been living alone with her three sons (21, 19, 16). The oldest has finished professional studies as a public accountant, one has started studying odontology and the youngest is in school. Therefore Mrs. Rosmery has to work hard until her two sons finish their studies.

The family lives in the town of Cochabamba in the neighborhood of Maica Central. For a living she produces fresh milk for a dairy product factory. At the moment she has 10 milking cows.

The loan will be spent on buying forage, which is important for the good diet for the cattle to continue with the production of the same quantity of milk.

The most important of her goals is that her 2 sons finish their professional studies and increase the milk production in order to save money for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase forage for milking cows.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. est une femme âgée de 24 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 5 ans et a eu 10 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter une dizaine de moutons, les engraisser pour ensuite les revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maguette D. is a 24-year-old woman, she is married and a mother responsible for three children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” of Keur Ngalgou for five years. She has had ten great experiences with borrowing. She fattens up sheep. Her new loan will enable her to buy about ten sheep, fatten them up to then resell them at the weekly markets in her area. Her goal is to help her husband in providing for the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her cattle sales activity

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Valeria E. le está haciendo falta las bardas alrededor de la casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargará de la mejora. Ya que tiene dos hijos de mediana edad y quieren estar jugando afuera, es por eso que desea la seguridad de sus niños cuando ella no los pueda cuidar.
Espera su cooperación para este crédito ya que es para la seguridad de su familia y bienestar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas de productos de belleza. Los gastos familiares se encargará  su esposo el señor Gerardo Reyes del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes en el área de documentador.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Gerardo Reyes esposo de la señora Valeria E.. Ya que ella estaba haciendo un demostración de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Valeri E.'s house is missing the walls around the house. She requests the loan to be able to buy the material and pay the person who will make the improvements. She has two young children and she would like them to play outside and therefore she wants to provide a safe environment when she cannot look after her children. She hopes for your support to obtain this loan as it is for the security and well-being of her family. She plans to repay the loan with the earnings from selling beauty products. Her husband, Gerardo Reyes is responsible for the family expenses that are covered by his income with a transport company in the area of legal workers. The person in the photo is Mr. Gerardo Reyes, husband of Mrs. Valeria E. as she was absent due to a demonstration of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build walls

loans.name: Miguel Leoncio

texts.es:
Miguel S. de 40 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Esta actualmente separado de su esposa pero tiene una hija de 9 años que estudia en una escuela particular. 

Hace 10 años atrás el hermano mayor de Miguel se fue de viaje y decidió dejar su negocio de legumbres en las manos de su hermano poco a poco el negocio fue creciendo pero por la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió comprar algunos artículos plásticos y comenzar a venderlos. 

Ahora el tiene su propio negocio de artículos de papelería y hogar, trabaja desde las 08h00 am hasta las 01:30 pm, su lugar de trabajo es en el mercado “San Vicente de Paul” (lugar donde hay muchos puesto de comerciantes). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar poncheras, mochilas y cuadernos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener otro local para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel S. is 40 years old, he lives in a suburban area of Guayaquil, his house is built of cement and has also the basic services. Presently he is separated from his wife but has a 9-year-old daughter who goes to a private school.

10 years ago Miguel's older brother went away and decided to leave his vegetable business in his brother´s hands, and little by little the business grew but the exasperating idea of having his own business made Miguel buy some plastic articles and start selling them.

Now he has his own business selling stationary and home products. He works from 8:00 am to 1:30 pm. His work is at the market "San Vicente de Paul" where there are many stalls.

With the loan he will buy lunch boxes, school bags, and notebooks for his business. In the future he would like to get other premises to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lunch boxes, school bags, notebooks

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Don  Joel de edad de 47 años, vive junto con su esposa y dos hijos que procrearon, aun estudiantes, su esposa trabaja como conserje en un hospital privado, la meta de ambos era poder tener una casa mas segura y digna para sus hijos ya que era toda de madera y ya en mal estado, con los financiamientos que ha obtenido en Afodenic ha logrado construir su casa de concreto el cual esta gozoso por tal objetivo alcanzado. Su trabajo es en seguridad, y lleva varios años laborando, es un trabajo arriesgado, pero tiene estabilidad lo cual le permite seguir anhelando a superar como persona. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, tablas para repellar la casa, a un falta embaldosar parte de la casa, hacer puertas y ventanas seguras, pintar, pero ira poco a poco ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Don Joel is 47 years old, he lives with his wife and their two children, who are still attending school. His wife works as a caretaker at a private hospital. It is their goal to own a house, safer and more decent for their children as it is built of wood and is in bad shape. With previous loans from Afodenic he has built a concrete house which makes him very proud. He has been working for several years in security, it is a risky job, but offers stability which allows him to continue hoping to improve as a person. With this loan he will buy building material such as sand, cement, wood. Parts of the house still need tiling, doors and safe windows, and paint. But he will do it little by little as it is very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand and wood.

loans.name: Los Triunfadores Del Rimac Group

texts.es:
LOS TRIUNFADORES D. RIMAC
Erlinda  Azaña D. 63 años D. edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos mayores D. edad, socia  D. la Alcancía Los Triunfadores D. Rímac, La Alcancía está integrada por 8 socios  quienes vienen trabajando  con la Institución  ya  desD. hace 3 años.
Se emprenD. en su labor  como negociante D. forma ambulatoria, ella venD. chocotejas  y papas rellenas en los mercados D. Chosica, también venD. cerveza en su domicilio, Inicialmente comenzó con 2 cajas D. Cervezas, y posteriormente fue mejorando su ingreso, llego el punto en que necesitaba comprar más mercadería  y fue que  a través D. una vecina, quien la invito a participar  en este tipo D. crédito grupal. Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra D. bebidas (4 cajas D. cervezas). Con su préstamo actual realizara  la compra D. insumos tanto para la preparación D. papas rellenas y chocotejas 
Su meta es lograr incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
LOS TRIUNFADORES D. RIMAC Erlinda Azaña is 63 years old. She is married and has 2 adult children. She is a member of the communal bank Los Triunfadores D. Rímac. The communal bank is maD. up of 8 members who have been working with the institution for more than 3 years. She works as a street vendor. She sells chocotejas and stuffed potatoes in the markets of D. Chosica. She also sells beer from her home. She started with 2 cases of beer, and later improves her income to the point that she needed to buy more merchandise. It was a neighbor that invited her to participate in this type of group credit. She invested her first loan in beverages (4 boxes of beer). With her present loan, she will buy ingredients to prepare the stuffed potatoes and the choctejas. Her goal in to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare stuffed potatoes and chocotejas.

loans.name: Máximo Javier

texts.es:
Es el crédito numero catorce que obtiene el señor U. en CEPRODEL, teniendo un buen historial crediticio,  limpio de mora se dedica  a la ganadería y la agricultura tiene 20 años  experiencia.
 El señor U. es casado jefe de familia, tiene dos hijos los cuales ha sustentado con esta actividad.
texts.en:
Es el crédito numero catorce que obtiene el señor U. en CEPRODEL, teniendo un buen historial crediticio, limpio de mora se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura tiene 20 años experiencia. El señor U. es casado jefe de familia, tiene dos hijos los cuales ha sustentado con esta actividad.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de ganado

loans.name: Sandra Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Alejandra A. tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
A su negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de comida y desea también tener otro tipo de productos para vender. Pero en este momento no cuento con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio sin descapitalizarlo, es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito. Con una parte de las ganancias del negocio planea pagar el crédito.  
Ya que es madre soltera y el negocio es la fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Alejandra A. has been working for more than a year making and selling food. Her business is lacking a greater variety of food, and she wants to also have other products to sell. However at the moment Sandra doesn't have the necessary money to invest in her business without taking away working capital, so she is seeking a loan. She plans to pay back the loan with part of her earnings. As Sandra is a single mother, the business is the source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and inventory

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta N. est âgée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Depuis 7ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qui ne lui ont jamais créé de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, elle va acheter de l'aliment de bétail et une paire de bœufs qu'elle va engraisser et vendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta N. is 42 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She has been a member of the KEUR NGALGOU “Banc Villageois” loan group for 7 ½ years, and has been granted 15 loans all reimbursed without any problems. She fattens cattle, and will buy cattle feed and a pair of oxen she will fatten and resell after four to five months. She aims to participate in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capacity for self-financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital to purchase inventory

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
Es el crédito numero dos obtenido en CEPRODEL, con un historial crediticio limpio.
Es un pequeño productor pequeño de la zona de Potosí, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, la mano de obra es familiar (hijos),  este crédito lo utilizara para la siembra de sandia.
texts.en:
Es el crédito numero dos obtenido en CEPRODEL, con un historial crediticio limpio. Es un pequeño productor pequeño de la zona de Potosí, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, la mano de obra es familiar (hijos), este crédito lo utilizara para la siembra de sandia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: siembra de sandias

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est âgée de 63 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle milite dans le Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU. Elle est vendeuse de bétail, son prêt lui permettra d'acheter du foin et deux bœufs, de les engraisser pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa N. is 63 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has been active in the KEUR NGALGOU “Banc Villageois” loan group for 7 ½ years. She sells cattle, and the loan will enable her to buy hay and two oxen which she will fatten for at least five months before she resells them at local markets in her vicinity. Her aim is to support her husband in managing their family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce her self-financing capability

loans.name: Deysi Milagro

texts.es:
La señora Deysi Milagro C. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Efrain Velasquez quien labora como albañíl en la zona de San Lorenzo. Deysi tiene una niña que depende de ellos al 100%.
la señora C. trabaja en su pulperia en donde vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta familiar vende arroz, frescos, pollo,  carnes, queso, manteca, harina de maiz, etc.
utilizara el prestamo para la compra de abarroteria.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Deysi Milagro C. is 39 years old. She lives in a common law union with Efrain Velasquez who works as a bricklayer in the area of San Lorenzo. Deysi has a daughter who depends on them 100%. Sra. C. works in her convenience store where she offers all the common staple goods such as rice, soft drinks, chicken, meat, cheese, butter, corn flour, and the like. Sra. C. plans to use the loan to purchase store inventory; she needs the additional income to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of convenience store inventory (bread, corn flour, cookies, soap, toothpaste, etc.)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ángela Amelia

texts.es:
Ángela M. de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Actualmente esta separada de su esposo pero tiene 3 hijos y solo uno de ellos estudia en una escuela particular. 

Hace unos años atrás empezó vendiendo helados y bebidas en su casa pero como necesitaba más ingresos decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en arroz, azucar y mas bebidas para vender en su tienda. 

Hace poco tiempo amplio su negocio y comenzó a vender verduras y vegetales en su pequeña tienda a las afuera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 22:00 pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites para su tienda. 

En el futuro ella quiere que su tienda sea una de las grandes en todo Fortín para darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángela M. is 39 years old and lives in a semi-urban zone in Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cane and only has light as a basic service. She is separated from her husband and has 3 children, only one of whom studies in a private school. Several years ago Ángela began selling ice-cream and drinks in her house, but as she needed more earnings she decided to invest her small savings in rice, sugar and more drinks to sell in her shop. A little while ago Ángela expanded her business and began selling vegetables in her little shop outside her house. She works from 6am until 10pm. With this loan she wants to buy rice, sugar, and oils for the shop. In the future Ángela wants her business to be one of the biggest in Fortín, so she can give her children a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna B. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banv Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 5 ans et demi et a eu l'expérience de 11 prêts au sein de son groupe. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter une dizaine de moutons qu'elle embouchera pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les écouler au niveau des différents marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité. Son objectif est de subvenir aux différents besoins de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Sokhna B. is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children under her care. She has been a member of the KEUR NGALGOU “Banc Villageois” loan group for 5 ½ years and has benefited from 11 loans within the group. She fattens sheep, and will buy ten sheep to be fattened for at least five months before they are resold in the area’s weekly markets. She aims to meet the various needs of her children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her activity selling livestock

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
la señora Karla Patricia M. tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Karla se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y cosmeticos, tiene 4 años con su negocio, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroteria y productos como ser:
cremas, sandalias, pan, galletas, refrescos, jugos, arroz, frijoles, harina de maiz y trigo, huevos, mantequilla, quesos, churros, jabones, papel higienico, candelas, pastillas, sopas, sal, condimentos..
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio cada dia esta creciendo un poco mas. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Patricia M. is 29, single, and has two children. Karla has been selling groceries and cosmetics for the past 4 years in a business in her house. She will use the loan to buy groceries and products such as: creams, sandals, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juices, rice, beans, corn meal and flour, eggs, butter, bread, churros (fried crullers), soaps, toilet paper, candles, pills, soups, salt and condiments. She tells us that she feels very happy since her business is growing a little more every day. She needs the profits to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: creams, sandals, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juices, rice, beans, corn meal and flour, eggs, butter, bread, churros (fried crullers), soaps, toilet paper, candles, pills, soups, salt and condiments.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Ii Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO  NUEVA ESPERANZA II ESTA COMPUESTO POR LA SIGUIENTE MESA DIRECTIVA:

EL PRESIDENTE DEL GRUPO ES EL SEÑOR LUIS SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE D. PASAJEROS EN EL RADIO MOVIL AMERICA, VIVE EN CASA EN ANTICRETICO EN COMPAÑIA D. SU MAMA EN LA ZONA PACATA BAJA AV. CIRCUNVALACION ES SOLTERO PERO PRONTO PIENSA FORMAR UNA FAMILIA, EL CORRE CON TODOS LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, ES UN PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA CON MUCHAS GANAS D. SUPERACION. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO REALIZARA EL MANTENIMIENTO D. SU VEHICULO.

LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA VIVIAN QUE ES OPERADORA DEL RADIO MOVIL AMERICA, SU DOMICILIO ES EN LA CALLE QUILLA  Y MELCHOR PEREZ D. OLGUIN A UNA CUADRA D. LA AMERICA S/N, VIVE EN COMPAÑIA D. SU HIJO Y SU MAMA EN ALQUILER, ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TRABAJA DURO PARA MANTENER A SU MAMA Y A SU HIJITO YA QUE ELLA SOLA MANTIENE EL HOGAR, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA UNA HELADERA PARA SU DOMICILIO.

EL SECRETARIO DEL GRUPO ES EL SEÑOR VICTOR VIVE SOLO EN LA CASA D. SUS PADRES ES SOLTERO Y ESTUDIA UNA CARRERA TECNICA SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE D. LA MISMA LINEA D. RADIO MOVIL AMERICA, UNO D. SUS DESEOS ES EL D. SALIR PROFESIONAL Y AS  MEJORAR LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. TODA SU FAMILIA CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA REPUESTOS  Y EL MANTENIMIENTO D. SU VEHICULO.

TODOS LOS SOCIOS ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION D. CREDITO.
texts.en:
The bank NUEVA ESPERANZA II is maD. up of the following board of directors: The president of the group is LUIS. He works in passenger transportation in Radio Movil America. He lives in a house in Anticretico with his mother in the Pacata Baja area, Av. Circunvalacion. He is single but is planing on starting a family soon. He is resposnable for all of the household expenses. He is a responsible and hardworking person who really wants to get ahead. He will do maintanance on his vehicle with the money from the loan. The treasurer of the group is Vivian. She ia a radio operator at Radio Movil America. Her house is on Calle Quilla and Melchor Perez D. Olguin one block from La America. She lives with her son and her mother in a rented home. She is a single mother and she works hard to support her mother and her young son, since she is the home's only support. With the money from the loan, she will buy a freezer for her home. The group's secretary is Victor. He lives alone in his parents home. He is single and is studying for a technological degree. He also works in transport in the same company, Radio Movil America. One of the things he wants is to get a professoinal degree and then improve the quality of life for the whole family. He will purchase replacement parts with the money from the loan and maintain his vehicle. All of the members are very thankful with EMPRENDER and KIVA for the trust they have put in them by extending them credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintainance

loans.name: Sopia Kotoine

texts.en:
Sopia Kotoine N. is 34 years old and married to Jackline. Together they have two children. 

Sopia is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land. He has been farming for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET from other members within his area of residence who are already registered as clients. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant more wheat on a bigger farm than the one he is currently doing because wheat has proved to be doing well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat.

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set of goals.

loans.use: To plant 20 acres of wheat

loans.name: Jose Ibrahan

texts.es:
el señor Jose Ibraham C. tiene 61 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Santos Raquel Cabrera, no tienen dependiente,  sus hijos viven en los estados unidos.
Jose y su esposa tienen su casa muy bonita, se llevan muy bien, trabajan juntos y se quieren mucho.
Tienen un negocio en su casa de habitacion, una pulperia en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar,  a demas tiene ingresos de un taxi. el credito lo utilizara para comprar granos basico, frescos,
carnes y embutidos.
su mayor deseo es estar bien de salud para seguir luchando junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Jose Ibraham C. is 61 years old, and married to Santos Raquel Cabrera. They have no dependents, and their children live in the United States. Jose and his wife have a lovely home, get along well, work together, and love one another. They have a business in their house, a general store where they sell basic items needed by families. They also have income from a taxi. He will use the loan to buy grains, fresh goods, meats, and sausages. His greatest desire to be in good health, to continue working hard alongside his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, corn, grease, oil, margarine, soft drinks, meats, sausages

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sector Tres Marías (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sector Tres Marías está localizado en la parroquia Turi  conocida como  el mirador de la ciudad Cuenca porque se puede admirar casi toda la ciudad, su gente adulta mayor y las mujeres se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y los más jóvenes han migrado a otras ciudades dentro y fuera del país  en busca de mejores días para sus familias, las integrantes de éste banco  son mujeres muy luchadoras que buscan en el día a día las oportunidades para brindarles a sus familias un mejor presente y futuro. En esta ocasión nos acompaña una niña hija  de una de las socias.
 
La señora  María  Lourdes L. es socia de éste banco hace cinco ciclos, vive en las afueras de la urbe cuencana en su casa propia pequeña de tablas con sus tres hijos de 12,10 y 8 años ya que el padre de los niños no le apoya en nada, los niños son estudiantes de primaria en la escuelita de la localidad.

 María Lourdes a sus 56 años se dedica a la compra de bosques los  tala y elabora  tablas, tiras, vigas, etc., ya lleva diez años y  trabaja de lunes a sábados de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de animales como chanchos, pollos, los que vende en las ferias de la localidad.

Ella ingresó al banco comunal gracias a una amiga que era socia del bankito, los créditos obtenidos le han beneficiado para la estabilidad económica de su hogar y para el crecimiento de su negocio, con su nuevo crédito va a  comprar más chanchos y alimento para criarlos y venderlos. Su mayor sueño es el de poder llegar a tener una bodega de madera.

Blanca E. también es socia de éste banco hace 8 ciclos y fue invitada por una amiga del bankito, los crédito le han beneficiado para el comienzo de su negocio, ella vende  comida rápida hace 5 años, arrienda un local cerca de su casa, trabaja de lunes a domingo, antes era la única que vendía en el lugar pero ahora tiene competencia, trabaja de 12 a.m. a 2 p.m. y luego sale a vender desde las 4 p.m. hasta las 9 p.m.

Blanca tiene 51 años,  enviudó  hace 5 años, su esposo  murió de un coma hepático, fruto de su unión concibió cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 29, 26, 20 y 18 años, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas y viven independientes, su hijo de 20 estudia  en la universidad y su último hijo trabaja  y es quien le ayuda económicamente en su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando, con su nuevo crédito va a invertir para arreglar su carreta que es su herramienta de trabajo, su sueño es llegar a tener un mini mercado.
texts.en:
The communal bank Sector Tres Marías is located in the Turi parrish. Turi is known as the place to view the city of Cuenca because from there you can admire almost the entire city. It's older adults and women work mainly in agriculture and the youngest people have migrated to other cities in and out of the country, seeking better days for their families. The members of this bank are fighters who day to day look for opportunites to offer their families a better present and future. On this occasion a little girl, daughter of one of the members, is with us. Mrs. María Lourdes L. has been a member of this bank for five cyles. She lives in the outskirts of Cuenca in her own little house. She lives with her three children, 12, 10 and 8. The father of the children does not support them at all. The children are students in the local elementary school. María Lourdes, at 56, buys lumber. She cuts it and makes boards, strips, beams, etc. She has been doing this for 10 years and works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She also raises animals such as pigs and chickens, which she sells in the area markets. She joined the communal bank thanks to a friend who was a member of the little bank. The loans she has obtained have benefitted the economic stability of her home and the growth of her business. With the new credit, she is going to buy more pigs and feed to raise and sell them. Her biggest dream is to be able to have a lumber warehouse. Blanca E. has also been a member of this bank for 8 cycles. She was invited by a friend to join the bank. The loans have helped her to start her business. She has sold fast food for 5 years. She rents a locale close to her home and works from Monday to Sunday. Previously she was the only person sellling in the area but now she has competition. She works from 12 a.m. to 2 p.m. and later she goes out to sell from 4 p.m. until 9 pm. Blanca is 51 years old. She was widowed 5 years ago. Her husband died of a hepatic coma. She had four children from her marriage. They are 29, 26, 20 and 18. Her two oldest daughters are married and independent. Her 20 year old son studies at the university and her youngest son works and he helps her out financially in the home. She does not own a home and so they rent. She will invest the new loan in fixing her cart, which is her work equipment. Her dream is to have a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed to raise them and to fix the fast food cart

loans.name: Harun Muchugia

texts.en:
Harun is a 33-year-old gentleman who is married to Judy, a tailor by profession. They have two children: a son who is six and a daughter who is four. 

Harun was introduced to Kadet by an existing Kadet client. He has been selling ready-made clothes for the past two years. He does tailoring with the support of his wife as his other source of income. He plans to add more clothes stock in his boutique shop with items like trouser suits and children’s clothes. He also has plans to relocate his business to a more viable market.

Harun intends to re-invest in the business and increase his capital to meet demand. His future hopes are to grow the business and sell as a wholesaler. He describes himself as a very enterprising businessman, intelligent and always determined to achieve what he sets out to do.

loans.use: To add more stock like trouser suits and children's clothes

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 45 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, juntos viven su casa propia, ubicada en un poblado de Ayacucho. Para Oscar, su meta siempre ha sido avanzar, terminó el colegio y desde su adolescencia ayudó a sus padres a cultivar y vender cacao. Con el paso del tiempo, tuvo la oportunidad de tener su propio terreno de cultivo, en donde ahora cultiva cacao, por lo que le esta yendo muy bien el negocio, vendiéndolo en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, es así que lunes a sábado, desde las 7:00AM hasta las 6:00PM se dedica a este trabajo de manera independiente. En el futuro piensa adquirir más terrenos para cultivar diferentes productos agrícolas, preservando además el medio ambiente. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y asegura en cumplir en pagar sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido, además tiene un buen concepto de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, servirá para darle mantenimiento adecuado a su terreno de cultivo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 45 years old and married with four children. They live together in their own home, located in a village in Ayacucho. Oscar's goal has always been to move forward; he completed high school and from adolescence has helped his parents grow and sell cocoa. Eventually he had the opportunity to acquire his own land on which he now grows cocoa. Business is going very well for him, and he sells his product from wholesale centers in his community. He works independently from 7 am to 6 pm Monday through Saturday. In the future, he plans to acquire more land to grow different agricultural products while also preserving the environment. This is his second loan with MFP and he is sure to make his payments on time; he also has a good understanding of his community. The loan he seeks would enable him to perform maintenance on his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To perform maintenance on crop fields

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La señora Luz I. Valladarez tiene 35 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Pompilio Ayala quien se dedica a la fotografia,  tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos, dos estan en el colegio. Luz se dedica 
a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas desde hace 15 años y nos dijo que le a ido bien y a luchado por sacar 
adelante a su familia, el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar de maiz, leña, cal. desea almacenar maiz para cuando este caro y tambien comprar leña para el invierno, ademas vende charamuscas, paletas y con esto obtiene un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz I. Valladarez is 35 years old and lives with her partner Pompilio Ayala, who is a photographer. They have three dependent children, two of whom are in high school. Luz has made and sold tortillas for 15 years. Things have gone well for her and she has struggled to improve her family's situation. She will use this loan to purchase corn, firewood, and lime. She would like to stock up on corn in case it becomes expensive and to purchase firewood for the winter. She also sells ribbon candy and lollipops to supplement her income.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, and lime

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has been in the motorcycle transportation business for the last four years, operating in Naivasha town. He is 28 years old, is married to Eunice Wangari, and they have one school-going child.

Michael was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to add the proceeds of the loan to what he has saved to buy a new motorcycle. He will employ someone else to operate it for him.

Michael plans to grow in the transportation business and his future plan is to buy and operate a taxi in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: LA SRA. MARGARITA ESTA CASADA, TIENE 3 HIJOS MAYORES, SU DOMICILIO ESTA UBICADO EN  LA LOCALIADAD DE LA GUARDIA, DISTANTE 20 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN EL BARRIO LINDO, SU DOMICILO LO ESTA PAGANDO EN CUOTAS, SU ESPOSO TIENE COMO OCUPACION CHOFER, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE DULCES, DETERGENTES, JAVON, CONDIMENTOS PARA LA COMIDA, OTROS, ESTO LO HACE DE FORMA AMBULANTE, TAMBIEN LOS FINES DE SEMANA VENDE PATO EN LA FERIA AGRICOLA DE EL TORNO, ASI TRABAJAN LOS DOS PARA LLEGAR A PAGAR EN SU TOTALIDAD EL CREDITO DE SU CASA, EL FINANCIAMIENTO SOLICITADO A LA INSTITUCION ES PARA REFACCIONAR ALGUNOS LUGARES QUE ESTAN EN MAL ESTADO DE SU VIVIENDA, UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES EL DE VER TERMINADA SU CASITA, ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita is married with three older children. She lives in La Guardia, 20 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz, in the Lindo neighborhood. She is making payments towards her home. Her husband works as a chauffeur and she works as a vendor, selling sweets, detergents, soap, condiments, etc. In addition, she sells ducks at the El Torno agriculture market on the weekends. Both her and her husband work very hard in order to be able to pay off the credit on their house. The loan that she is seeking is to fix certain parts of their home that is in bad condition. One of her dreams is to see her house finished. She is a responsible and hard working person. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for believing in her and offering her credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home refurbishment

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming for the last twelve years in Naivasha. He is 42 years old, is married to Alice Wanja, and they have three school-going children.

Paul was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm.

In the future, Paul plans to buy another piece of land for farming, hence increasing his output.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing

loans.name: Esinyen

texts.en:
Esinyen has been selling fruit and vegetables from his house in Naivasha town for the last year. This has been very limiting as he can only reach his neighbors with his sales.

Esinyen now wants to build a kiosk to sell his fruits from. This will help him reach many other passersby who do not know he sells fruit and vegetables. This is the purpose of the proceeds from his loan. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.

Esinyen is 38 years old, is married to Esther Gikuri, and they have two school-going children.

Esinyen plans to grow his fruit and vegetable sales, open a big grocery shop, and become one of the main suppliers of fruit and vegetables in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy build a temporary kiosk to sell from

loans.name: Ana Ester

texts.es:
Ana Esther Z. tiene 53 años y vive en el barrio Quiroga de Bogotá  la capital de Colombia;  ella esta casada y tiene 7 hijos de 14 a 33 años de edad; Para Ana la satisfacción mas grande es atender y suministrar a los clientes   alimentos higiénicos y bien preparados por ella y su empleada; es así como su “Restaurante y comidas rápidas Archíes 70”, no tiene competencia en el sector. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $1.800.000 para comprar materias primas e insumos necesarios para la preparación de estos alimentos: granos,  lácteos, comestibles, carne y pollo y algunos implementos de aseo para el mantenimiento higiénico de este sitio.  
Ana inició su restaurante en el año 2008, pero desde hace 15 años adquirió experiencia en esta actividad, pues sus padres y familiares  han tenido este tipo de negocio y ella ha estado muy de cerca desde entonces.  
Sus sueño es tener una cadena de restaurantes  que se destaquen por la calidad  en los proceso y generar mas fuentes de empleos; otro de sus sueños es hacer de sus hijas unas profesionales en los que a ellas les guste. Lo mas difícil fue tomar la decisión de montar su negocio con las expectativas de tener los recursos económicos necesarios para hacerlo; ahora su gran desafío es remodelar el restaurante  dándole un aire de modernidad y más llamativo para sus clientes, de tal manera que al momento de llegar a consumir los productos se sientan a gusto y siempre muy decididos a regresar. A Ana le gusta el barrio donde vive desde hace 25 años, por el buen trato de su la gente, porque lo considera seguro   y porque tiene en los colegios, clubes deportivos y en  la iglesia su mercado real y potencial.
texts.en:
Ana Esther Z. is 53 years old. She lives in the Quiroga neighborhood of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. She is married and has 7 children aged 14 to 33. Ana's biggest satisfaction is serving and providing customers with sanitary and well prepared food made by her and her employee. That is how her restaurant “Restaurante y comidas rápidas Archíes 70” has no competition in the area. At present, she is using a loan of $1.800.000 to buy the necessary raw materials and ingredients to prepare this food: grains, dairy, edibles, beef and chicken as well as some tools for cleanliness and sanitation for the locale. Ana started her restaurant in the year 2008 but she has had experience in this activity for 15 years. Her parents and relatives have had this type of business and she has been close to it since then. Her dream is to have a chain of restaurants that stand out with the quality of their processes and to generate more sources of employment. Another dream is to make her daughters into professionals in the areas they really like. The hardest part about deciding to start her business was the expectation of having the necessary economic resources to do it. Now her biggest challenge is remodelling the restaurant, giving it an air of modernity more attractive to customers. This way, when they arrive to consume the products, they will feel at ease and always wanting to return. Ana likes the neighborhood where she has lived for 25 years because it treats its people well, she considers it safe, and because it has in its schools, sports clubs and in its church a real and potential market.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains, dairy, edibles, beef and chicken and some cleaning equipment

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has operated his food stall among many other businesses in Naivasha town for the last two years. He now wants to move to a better and more spacious place and this is the reason for requesting this current loan. It will help him pay rent and renovate the new shop.

Simon was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Ksh 15,000 well and on time.

Simon is 39 years old, is married to Ruth Nyawira, and they have four school-going children. In the future he plans to buy a piece of land and run his business from there.

loans.use: To pay rent and renovate a new and spacious shop

loans.name: Judid

texts.es:
LA SRA. JUDID ESTA CASADA Y RADICA  EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA DE PUERTAS Y MARCO DE CASA, SU ESPOSO TIENE COMO PROFESION CARPINTERO, EL REALIZA ELTRABAJO Y ELLA LOS COMERCIALIZA, NO TIENEN DOMICILIO PROPIO, POR LO TANTO TRABAJAN AMBOS PARA JUNTAR UN CAPITAL INICIAL PARA COMPARAR SU PROPIA CASA, TIENEN 3 HIJO LOS CUALES  ESTAN ESTUDIANDO PARA SACAR UNA PROFESION, POR LO QUE SE LE HACE DIFICIL EL DE JUNTAR EL DINERO, POR TAL MOTIVO TUVIERON QUE SOLICITAR FINANCIMIENTO PARA AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, Y ASI CRECER ECONOMICAMENTE.

LA SRA. JUDID ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ms. Judid is married and lives in the El Torno district, located about 40 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She sells doors and door frames. Her husband is a carpenter. He makes the doors and frames and she sells them. They do not have their own home and for that reason, they both work in order to save for an initial capital to buy their own house. They have three children, all of whom are studying, which makes it difficult for them to save their money. As such, they had to seek a loan in order to increase their work capital y as a result, grow economically. Ms. Judid is a responsible and hard working person. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her with credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase prawns and fish

loans.name: Jaime Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Jaime Roberto Z. G., vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino tiene la edad de 39 años es  casado y con su esposa tienen 3 hijas, y las cuales estudian dos de ellas la escuela primaria y la mayor la secundaria, ellos tienen una pulpería desde hace 15 años.

Dentro de las necesidades que tiene su negocio está,  la falta de financiamiento, y apoyo de las microfinancieras y/o bancos, para este sector de comercio, agradece el soporte que se le ha brindado en otras ocasiones, pues su negocio a salido paulatinamente adelante gracias a los prestamos de Kiva, ahora tras esta inversión en la compra de mayor inventario de abarrotes y lacteos, espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida para brindarle a sus hijos estudio y comodidades que puedan servir a su diario vivir.
texts.en:
Jaime Roberto Z. G. lives in the the suburb of Medardo Andino. He is 39 years old and married. With his wife he has 3 daughters, 2 of whom study in primary school and the oldest in secondary school. Jaime and his wife have had a grocery store for 15 years. Amongst the necessities of running a business is the lack of finance and the support of microfinanciers and/or banks for this sector of commerce. Jaime is thankful for the support that has been given to him on other occasions, as his business has improved step by step thanks to the loans from Kiva. This investment will be put into the purchase of more inventory and dairy products. Jaime hopes to improve his living conditions to allow his children to study and provide them with daily comforts.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory and groceries

loans.name: Bolivia

texts.es: La Señora Bolivia esta casada y tiene dos hijitos pequeños se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, vende hamburguesas, pollo frito y salchipapas fuera de su casa, en esta ocasión ella necesita el credito para comprar sillas y mesas para la venta de su comida, el  esposo de la Sra Bolivia es chofer de transporte Urbano, entre los dos trabajan muy duro para poder comprar su lote y poder construir su casa, por el momento ellos estan viviendo en anticretico. Son buenos clientes en la institucion además de que no es la primera vez que acceden a un crédito con Emprender y no tubieron problemas con el pago de sus cuotas. La Sra. Bolivia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ms. Bolivia is married with two small children. She sells fast food, such as hamburgers, fried chicken, and hot potatoes outside of her house. She needs a loan to purchase chairs and tables for the sale of her food. Her husband works as a chauffeur for Urbano Transports. The two of them work very hard in order to be able to buy their plot of land and be able to construct their house on it. Currently, they are living without credit. They are very good members of the institution and this is not the first time that they have had a loan with Emprender. They have never had problems with paying their quotas. Ms. Bolivia is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their faith in her by giving her credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chairs and tables.

loans.name: El Pajonal Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "El Pajonal"  esta representado por la señora Elizabeth y está conformado por 12 socios D. los cuales 11 son mujeres y un  varón, este banco se caracteriza por ser muy unido y trabajador. La señora Elizabeth es  casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños que van al colegio, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en su barrio, y su marido que le ayuda con los gastos D. la casa se dedica al transporte D. pasajeros, ellos viven  en una pequeña casa por la cual pagan un alquiler, las expectativas D. la señora  Elizabeth son D. crecer poco a poco y poder comprase un terreno para construir un techo para su familia. El resto del grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades, la mayoría venD. comida ya sea D. manera ambulante o en puestos fijos, un socio es taxista y las  otras socias son promotoras D. productos D. belleza que se venden por catálogo. El grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias donD. venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital D. operaciones, comprando mercadería, insumos y herramientas para mejorar su trabajo, el señor Miguel destinara su crédito a la compra D. repuestos para su vehículo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es D. seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente es el primer financiamiento que da  nuestra institución y durante todo el tiempo D. relación comercial ellos demostraron ser personas responsables y puntuales.
texts.en:
The “El Pajonal” communal bank is represented by Elizabeth and is maD. up of 12 members, 11 women and one gentleman. This bank is characterized by the unity and hard working nature of its members. Elizabeth is married and has two young children who attend school. She sells food in her neighborhood and her husband helps her with the household expenses. He works in public transportation. They live in a small rented house. Elizabeth expects to grow her business little by little and be able to buy some land on which to build a home of their own. The rest of the group does different things. Most sell food on foot or in fixed locations. One member is a taxi driver, and others sell beauty products through catalogs. The group as a whole has plenty of experience running small businesses and the members are well known at the various fairs where they sell their products. Even though there is a lot of competition in their fields, they can count on their experience and regular customers who know of their businesses and insist on their services. They are also very enthusiastic about what they do. They will use the money from this loan to proviD. working capital, to buy tools and supplies, in order to improve their work. Miguel will use his portion to buy repair parts for his vehicle. The group will continue to work and take advantage of this financing in order reach their goals. The bank has plenty of experience with loans, as this is not the first time that they have borrowed money; however this will be first loan through our institution. The group has already demonstrated that its members are responsible and punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mirian Geraldina

texts.es:
la señora Mirian Geraldina E. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Hector Reyes, no tiene hijos con el,  pero ella tiene tres de una pareja anterior.
Hector le ayuda economicamente con los gastos de su hogar. Mirian  se dedica a la venta de queso por libras, mantequilla y embutidos a algunas pulperias cercanas a su casa de habitacion. 

nos ha comentado que se ha esforzado mucho para salir adelante con su familia por que los tres hijos estan estudiando y se le hace un poco dificil cubrir todos los gastos.
utilizara el credito para comprar mas lacteos ya que su negocio va creciendo y necesita mas capital de trabajo para poder cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
 
su deseo es tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es alquilada.
texts.en:
Mirian Geraldina is 40 years old and lives with Hector. They don’t have any children together, but she has three from a previous marriage. Hector helps her with the household expenses. Mirian sells cheeses by the pound, butter, and sausages to a few shops near her home. She tells us that she has worked hard to get ahead with her family because her three children attend school and she finds it a little difficult to cover all her expenses. She will use the money from this loan to buy more milk products, now that her business if growing and she needs more working capital to cover all of her customers’ needs. She hopes to one day have her own home, as she currently lives in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Kantutas 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Kantutas 2” esta representado por la señora Juana y conformada por 12 miembros residentes del mismo barrió y con la característica D. ser gente alegre, unida y muy dinámica. La señora Juana es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales aun son pequeños pero uno D. ellos va a la escuela del barrio, la señora Juana se dedica a la venta D. frutas en el mercado central, ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo por lo que tiene que verse en la necesidad D. madrugar para agarrar un puesto D. venta cada día D. feria y poder obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. su hogar ella vive en alquiler pero su máximo deseo es poder darle a su hija un techo adonD. pueda vivir con mayor comunidad. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. frutas, shampoo, comida, frutas, polleras, ropa en general y al transporte D. pasajeros. Las señoras son muy trabajadoras y le hacen frente a la competencia  y  continúan  trabajando para salir adelante. La mayoría D. las señoras utilizaran el crédito para incrementar su capital D. operación  y hacerle frente a  la competencia. Es un grupo que se encuentra en su 2do ciclo en la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que saben manejar bien sus fondos para salir adelante y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The "Kantutas 2" Group is represented by Mrs Juana and comprises 12 members living in the same neighborhood. They are cheerful, united and very dynamic people. Mrs Juana is married and the mother of two children who are still young. Her eldest child goes to the school in the neighborhood. Mrs Juana sells fruit at the Central Market. She does not have a fixed stall, so she is forced to get up early every market day to get hold of a place and earn the necessary income to proviD. for her family. She lives in rented accommodation, but her greatest desire is to proviD. her daughter with a home where she can better live in comfort. The other group members sell fruit, shampoo, food, skirts, clothes in general, and passenger transportation services. The ladies work hard in a competitive environment and are eager to succeed. Most of the ladies will use their share of the loan to increase their working capital and better face competition. This is the group's second loan cycle with the microfinance institution Fundación AgroCapital and its members know how to manage their funds to succeed and grow.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
la señora Norma H. C. tiene 33 años de edad esta casada con el señor Jose Maria H. C.  quien se dedica a la pesca artesanal, tiene una lancha en donde navega en el golfo de Fonseca, los pescados los lleva a casa para luego ser vendidos por su esposa.
tienen 4 hijos, dos de ellos van a la escuela. ademas la señora H. vende granos basicos en su casa,
los compra a precio bajo y ella lo revende por mayor a los clientes que ella tiene. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar pescado seco y granos basicos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Norma H. C. is 33 years old. She is married to Jose Maria H. C., a fisherman. He has a boat that he navigates in the Fonseca Gulf. He brings the fish home to be sold by his wife. They have four children who go to school. Mrs. H. also sells basic grains in her house. She buys them at a low price and resells them for more to the customers she has. She will use the loan to buy dried fish and basic grains. She needs the income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish and basic grains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: EL SR. NICOLAS NACIO EL 6 DE MARZO DE 1980 EN CHUQUISACA, VIVE CON LA SRA. GLADIS, TIENEN 3 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, HACE 10 AÑOS QUE EL SINDICATO QUEBRADA ALBARES LE DOTO UNA PARCELA DE 9HAS. PARA QUE EL TRABAJE EN AGRICULTURA JUSTAMENTE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS 3 HIJOS, EL SIEMBRA PAPA, Y POROTO Y TODOS SUS PRODUCTOS QUE LO COMERCIALIZA EN EL MERCADO DE EL TORNO, ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA QUE BUSCA EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA Y DESEA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO
texts.en:
Señor Nicolas was born on March 6th, 1980 in Chuquisaca. He lives with señora Gladis and they have three school-age children. Ten years ago the Quebrada Albares union have him nine hectares of land to farm, together with his wife and three kids. He grows potatoes and beans and sells all of his products in the Torno Market. He is a hard worker who is concerned for his family's well being and he would like to improve his family's quality of life. He is also very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting him with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Luz Carmelina

texts.es:
Luz C. de 50 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su esposo es soldador ellos tienen dos hijos de 22 y 17 años. 

Hace unos años atrás empezó a trabajar en el mercado Pedro Pablo Gómez (Lugar donde hay muchos puestos de comerciantes de alimentos) como vendedora de víveres. Pero por la frustrante idea de tener su propio negocio decidió invertir sus pocos ahorros en víveres y vitrinas para los productos. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las desde las 06h00 am hasta las 22:00 pm todos los días. Vende bebidas, aceites, granos, dulces en su pequeña tienda. Uno de los factores contra en su negocio es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, azúcar para su tienda. En el futuro quiere que su negocio aumente y que su esposo pueda comprar maquinaria para su taller de soldadura.
texts.en:
Luz C. is 50 years old. She lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. Her house is concrete, and she has all of the basic services. Her husband is a welder. They have two children, ages 22 and 17. Several years ago she started working in the Pedro Pablo Gómez market (place where they are a lot of food stands) selling food. Due to the frustrating idea of having her own business, she decided to invest her few savings in food and display cases for her products. Now she works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. everyday. She sells drinks, oils, grains, and sweets in her small store. One of the negative factors in her business is the delinquency that exists in the area where she lives. She wants to use this loan to buy rice, oils, and sugar for her store. In the future she wants her business to increase and for her husband to be able to buy machinery for his welding shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Iris Esperanza

texts.es:
la señora Iris Esperanza V. tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 04 hijos que dependen de ella.
Iris trabaja duro en la elaboracion de tortillas y golosinas, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. nos comento que trabaja fuerte para poder salir adelante ya que el padre de sus hijos se fue a vivir a estados unidos, desde alla le envia dinero para poder cubrir los gastos de sus 4 hijos.
tiene un proyecto el cual es terminar de construir su casa.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar harina de maiz, leña y cal para la elaboracion de tortillas.
observamos que Iris es una persona que no habla mucho pero bien dinamica y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iris Esperanza is 30 years old and has 4 children who depend on her. For 5 years now, Iris has worked hard making tortillas and delicacies. She tells us that she has worked hard to be able to get ahead since the father of her children went to the United States. From afar, he sends money to help cover the costs of their 4 children. Her project is to finish constructing her house. The loan will be used to buy corn meal, fire wood and lime for making tortillas to sell. We observed that Iris is a person who doesn't talk much but is very dynamic, with much desire to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CORN MEAL, LIME, AND FIRE WOOD TO MAKE TORTILLAS TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: CAPITAL FOR DRESS-MAKING, GROCERY AND SCHOOL SUPPLIES, AND BREAD MAKING

loans.name: Maria Lizeth

texts.es:
la señora Mirla Lizeth B. R. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Martir Romero quien labora en la empacadora de mariscos San Lorenzo. Tienen un hijo. Martir le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y Mirla atiende el pequeño negocio que tiene en su casa en donde vende maiz, arroz, azucar, manteca, aceite etc.

utilizara el credito para comprar mas productos y asi tener mas inventario en su negocio, ya que estos productos se venden rapido.
dice sentirse feliz porque esta viendo que su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y su meta es poder tener una pulperia grande en donde venda de todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Mirla Lizeth B. R. is 25 years old and lives with her partner Martir Romero, who works in the San Lorenzo fish packing plant. They have one child. Martir helps with household expenses and Mirla runs the small business they have in their house, selling rice, sugar, lard, oil, etc. Mirla will use this loan to buy more products to sell. She needs more inventory as these products sell rapidly. Mirla says she feels happy to see her business grow little by little. Her goal is to have a large grocery store selling all types of products.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, lard, rice, sugar, and corn for grocery.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga es una joven de 35 años de edad, desde hace varios años se dedica  a vender cosmético, el cual inicio con apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como albañil. Procreo dos hijos, que cursan el colegio. Con el objetivo de apoyar a su familia comienza ha vender en donde se afilia con la empresa Avon, vende una variedad de productos como: cremas, de piel, cutis, cremas para arrugas, shampoo, perfumenes, vanidad, pinturas, desorantes, vende al contado y al crédito, y muchos son encargos lo cuales los clientes lo hacen por catálogos.
