Con este préstamo comprara más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo cual espera colocar más cada día. Con estos financiamientos aumentado su inventario en productos y con ventas mas alta. Lo cual para ella es un beneficio. Sus planes es lograr mejorar su casa ya que solo ha invertido en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dominga is a young woman of 35 years of age. For several years she has sold cosmetics. She started the business with the support of her husband, who is a brick mason. They have two children, both in elementary school. With the objective of helping her family, Dominga began selling Avon products such as skin creams, face care products, wrinkle creams, shampoo, perfumes, make-ups, and deodorants. She sells for cash or on credit, and also orders items for customers from the catalog. With this loan, Dominga will buy more products to offer to her clients, who are growing in number each day. She will increase her inventory and thus increase her sales, which will be good for her. In the future, she would like to improve her house, as thus far she has invested all her money back into the business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon cosmetics such as makeups, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Lluvia De Oro Group

texts.es: El grupo “Lluvia de Oro” esta compuesto de 10 personas y representado por la señora Maria Tatiana, este grupo se caracteriza ser gente agrupada del oriente, pero que vive en Cochabamba hace muchos años, son gente muy unida y trabajadora. La señora Maria Tatiana tiene un hijo que va a la universidad, ella es casada y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda en la atención de un Karaoke que administran ambos los fines de semana el cual genera ingresos para el sustento de su familia, el mayor sueño de la señora Maria Tatiana es ver a su hijo profesional, el destino del financiamiento es para la remodelación del karaoke. El resto de los socios tienen negocios como la venta de ropa interior de mujer ellas generalmente traen de la frontera del brasil para hacer entrega al por mayor en el M., también venden edredones y otro tipo de ropa, otros de los socios se dedican al transporte de pasajeros, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de comida, venta y reparación de celulares. El nivel competitivo en el M. en el cual realizan sus actividades los socios es alto pero todos saben como salir adelante para obtener el ingreso diario que es el sustento de sus familias. El grupo va cursando un ciclo mas demostrando puntualidad y ganas de trabajar para sacar a delante a sus familias para pode darles una mejor calida y poder progresar cada día mas.
texts.en:
The Lluvia de Oro (Rain of Gold) Group is comprised of ten people. Maria Tatiana represents the group. This group is characterized as being people brought together from the east but who have lived in Cochabamba for many years. They are very united and hard-working people. Maria Tatiana has one child, and he attends the university. She is married, and her husband supports her work. He helps her work in a Karaoke bar. They both run it on the week-ends. It generates income to support the family. Maria Tatiana’s greatest dream is to see her son become a profession. The loan is to remodel the Karaoke bar. The rest of the members have businesses like selling underwear for women. They generally get it at the Brazilian border in order to deliver it to the wholesale market. Some members sell comforters and other types of clothing. Other members work in passenger transportation, making clothes, selling food, or the sale and repair of cell phones. The level of competition in the market in which the members work is high. But, all of them know how to get ahead to get their daily income, which supports their families. The group is in one more cycle, and they demonstrate punctuality and the desire to work to get their families ahead. They do this to give them a better quality of life and to be able to progress more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tamborada 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Tamborada 2” esta representado por la señora Patricia y conformado por 10 miembros que residen en la misma zona, es una grupo que esta empezando a trabajar con nosotros pero son gente muy trabajadora y muy unida. La señora Patricia es bastante joven y se la ve responsable con el grupo ya que ella los ha organizado en el barrio para participar en el crédito, su negocio es la venta D. carne en el barrio, tiene una hijita que ya va al colegio D. la zona ella es madre soltera y vive en la casa D. su madre ella sabe como salir adelante porque sabe que su pequeña solo depenD. D. ella, la señora patricia destinara el crédito en la adquisición D. mercadería para incrementar sus ingresos y poder construir un departamento mas cómodo para ella y su hija en el terreno D. su mama. El resto del grupo tienen distintas actividades como tienda D. barrio, venta D. golosinas, taxista, plomero, venta D. comida y atención en funeraria. El nivel competitivo en el mercado en el cual realizan sus actividades los socios es alto pero todos saben como salir adelante para obtener el ingreso diario que es el sustento D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo ellos ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Patricia is young, and she is responsible with the group. She organized them in the neighborhood in order to participate with the loan. Her business is selling meat in the neighborhood. She has a daughter who goes to school in the area. She is a single mother, and she lives in her mother’s house. She knows how to get ahead because she knows that her little one depends solely on her. Patricia will use the loan to get merchandise in order to increase her income. She will do this to be able to build a more comfortable apartment for herself and for her daughter on her mother’s land. The rest of the group has different activities like a neighborhood store, selling sweets, taxi driver, plumber, selling food, or funeral services. The level of competition in the market in which the members work is high. But, they know how to get ahead in order to get the daily income, which supports their families. In spite of being a new group, they have experience in unified groups thanks to loans in institutions like the Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Edwin Antonio M. G., tiene la edad de 26 años es casado y junto a su esposo y su hijo recién nacido habitan en el Barrio Juan Ramón Padilla, desde hace tres años tienen una moto taxi, la cual es su fuente de ingresos.

Dentro de sus mayores necesidades de la familia M., esta la construcción de su vivienda es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra  de materiales de construcción tales como bloques, cemento, hierro y tablas de madera, con esta inversión podrán ayudar a este joven matrimonio a edificar su vida y ofrecerle a su pequeño hijo de nueve meses de nacido, mejores condiciones de vida debido a que el pequeño, ha mostrado multiples complicaciones en su salud y desean realizar la inversión para la comodidad del pequeño.
texts.en:
Edwin Antonio M. G. is 26 years old, married and he lives with his wife and new born son in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood. For the last three years they have had a motorbike taxi, which is their source of income. Among the M. family's greatest needs is the building of their home. This is why he is asking for a loan - to buy building materials such as blocks, cement, iron and planks of wood. With this investment you will be able to help this young married couple build their life and offer their young new born son better living conditions. Given that the child has had multiple heath complications they want to make this investment for the comfort of their child.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his house

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline is the coordinator of her group, Paz y Amor (Peace and Love), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Jaqueline’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their six children.

Jaqueline is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a general store by purchasing clothing, beans and rice to sell to the members of her community.

Jaqueline will use her profits to invest in her home by building a wall and in her children by purchasing shoes and uniforms for school. She also has a dream of one day traveling to Panama and she would like to save money for that. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, rice and beans

loans.name: San Isidro Labrador Group

texts.es: El grupo de “San Isidro Labrador” esta representado por el señor Javier y conformado por 11 miembros nuevos pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante con el apoyo que les brinda la institución. El señor Javier se dedica a la costura y confección de trajes de varones y damas de corte sastre, mandiles y blusas para cholitas estas ultimas al por mayor para entregar al por mayor en el mercado central, el es casado y tienen dos niños pequeños que van a la escuela de la zona, el desea incrementar sus ingresos y para ello requiere de mas materia prima e insumos para poder realizar nuevas confecciones y poder obtener mejores ingresos para poder adquirir una pequeña casa para su familia. El resto del grupo tiene negocios varios como la venta de fruta, venta de laminas escolares, venta de cristales en las provincias, venta de cds, servicio de transporte. El nivel competitivo en el mercado en el cual realizan sus actividades los socios es alta pero todos saben como salir adelante para obtener el ingreso diario que es el sustento de sus familias. A pesar de ser un grupo nuevo ellos ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The "St. Isidro, the Laborer" group is represented by Mr. Javier and made up of 11 new members who have a large desire to get ahead with the help that this institution offers them. Mr. Javier works as a tailor and sews men's and ladies' suits, as well as aprons and blouses for the indigenous community. The latter he makes in bulk to sell to the central market. He is married and has two young children who attend school in the same area. He desires to increase his earnings and, in order to do so, needs more materials and supplies to be able to create more clothing and then earn more money to buy a small house for his family. The rest of the group has various businesses, like selling fruit, laminated school supplies, glass, and CDs, and providing transportation. There is a high level of competition in the market where they conduct business but they all know how to succeed in getting enough money for the daily expenses of their families. Although they are a new group they already have experience with loans thorugh institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Margarita Bonitas 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Margaritas Bonitas 2” esta representada por la señora Ubaldina y conformada por 10 miembros residentes del mismo barrio caracterizado por ser personas muy responsables, honestas, trabajadoras y muy capaces a pesar D. sus bajos recursos como lo demuestra la señora Ubaldina que es viuda y madre D. cuatro hijos a los cuales a sacado adelante a pesar D. no tener el apoyo D. su esposo que ya la dejo hace mucho tiempo, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en una pensión en la que venD. almuerzo familiar y los fines D. semana platos D. la tarD., ella vive en la casa D. su hija mayor que también es miembro del grupo pero con otro tipo D. negocio, ella desea poder tener una pensión mas amplia ya que sus clientes se han incrementado y no tiene un buen lugar donD. recibirlos es por esta razón que requiere del crédito para poder ampliar y mejorar su pensión y darles a sus clientes una mejor atención. El resto D. las socias tienen negocios varios como lechería, venta D. quesillo, repostería, atención D. local en la zona D. linD., carpintería, venta D. ropa americana, venta D. tripitas y la venta D. pollo. La competencia existe en sus negocios pero los socios saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y ganas D. salir adelante para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. El préstamo actual es para el incremento D. mercadería para agrandar sus negocios. El grupo va cursando un segundo ciclo con la institución por lo que saben como manejar los fondos y salir adelante para mejor cada día más.
texts.en:
The "Pretty Daisies 2" group is represented by Mrs. Ubaldina and maD. up of 10 members who are residents of the same neighborhood and considered to be very responsible, honest, hard-working, and capable despite their lack of resources, as shown by Mrs. Ubaldina, who is a widow and the mother of 4 children, whom she has helped get ahead despite not having the support of her husband who left her a long time ago. She works selling food in a boarding house. During the week she sells a basic lunch and on the weekends sells meals in the afternoon. She lives in her oldest daughter's house, who is also a member of the group, but who works in a different type of business. She desires to be able to have a larger boarding house, as her customers have grown in number and she does not have enough room to take them in. For this reason she needs the loan to be able to expand and improve the boarding house and proviD. her customers with better service. The rest of the members work with milk, cheese sales, pastries, carpentry, clothing sales, tripe sales, and chicken sales. They face competition in their businesses, but the members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and will to succeed to proviD. their families with a better quality of life. The current loan is for increasing supply of merchandise and enlarging their businesses. The group is completing their second loan cycle with the institution and knows how to manage funds and continue to improve each day.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene seis hijos mayores, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicado en la hermosa selva de Ayacucho. En años anteriores, vendía panes recorriendo las calles de su comunidad, pero en vista que no lo daba resultados, decidió emprender un nuevo trabajo, que es el cultivo de Cacao y frutas Cítricas, en donde le está otorgando buenos beneficios económicos. Usualmente se establece en su chacra de lunes a sábado a partir de las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero por lo general tiene a cargo peones que le puedan facilitar el trabajo de la siembra de cacao y frutas cítricas. En un futuro cercano quiere seguir apostando en abrir un Panadería, por considerarlo como un buen negocio, puesto que sabe que es una necesidad para el desayuno familiar. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además se siente contento por el respaldo que le están brindando sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su chacra, de esa manera obtener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 years old, married, and has 6 grown children. They all live together in their home, which is located in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle. In the past he sold bread on the streets of his community, but as he was not having much success, he decided to begin a new business farming cocoa and citrus fruits, which has benefited him financially. He is usually on his land from Monday to Saturday from 7:00 am until 6:00 pm. His family will occasionally help, but he generally has laborers who help with the harvest of cocoa and citrus fruits. In the near future he wants to try his luck opening a bakery, which he considers a good business since bread is needed for family breakfasts. This is his first loan with MFP, and he pledges to make the payments. He is happy for the support given to him from his peers in the community bank. He will use the loan for maintaining his farm plot to improve production.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For maintaining farm land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Esperanza (Women of Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Felicia’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Felicia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling cleaning products and women's underwear by purchasing more merchandise in the main markets and then reselling them in her community.

Felicia will use the profits to invest in her home by repairing the roof as well as saving towards her dream of opening a pawn shop. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bras, women's underwear and cleaning products

loans.name: Elsi Dinora

texts.es:
la sra. Elsi Dinora S. P. tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de tres años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres y desea comenzar a construir la casa que un dia le dejara a su hijo.
Elsi se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, tiene dos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. Elsi vive en San Marcos de Colon. el credito lo utilizara para comprar productos como ser desodorantes, lociones, cremas, perfumes, cosmeticos, esmaltes etc.
su sueño es poder construir una casa propia.
texts.en:
Elsi Dinora S. P. is 28 years of age and single mother of a three years old child. She lives with her parents and she would like to start building a house that one day she will leave to her child. Elsi sells personal care products; she has been in this business for two years. Elsi lives in San Marcos de Colon. She will use the loan to buy supplies such as deodorants, lotions, cremes, perfumes, cosmetics, nail polish, etc. Her dream is to be able to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cremes, deodorants, perfumes, lotions, hair gel, nail polish, cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase supplies & equipment

loans.name: Luci Dalia

texts.es:
la sra. Luci Dalia P. vive en la ciudad de San Marcos de Colon, en el barrio la Peñita.
Luci alquila donde vive desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 35 años de edad y tiene 4 hijas quienes le ayudan a trabajar en la elaboracion y venta de las tortillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años con lo cual a contribuido al crecimiento y educacion de sus hijas.
Su esposo se dedica a la fabricacion de calzado y tambien le ayuda a pagar las cuentas del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar maiz ya que en esta temporada esta un poco mas barato y asi tener en inventario para cuando se ponga mas caro. tambien la leña se pone mas cara cuando llueve.
texts.en:
Sra. Luci Dalia P. lives in the neighborhood of La Peñita in the city of San Marcos de Colon. She has been renting her home for a long time. Luci is 35 years old and has four daughters who help her with her work making and selling tortillas. She has been in this business for five years and it has contributed to the growth and education of her daughters.

Her husband is a shoemaker and also helps with the household bills. This loan will be used to buy corn since it is a little cheaper this season. She will stock up her inventory so that she will have supply on hand when the prices increase. Luci will also buy firewood because it gets more expensive when it rains.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, corn, lime, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Noel Anselmo

texts.es: El Señor Noel Anselmo tiene 67 años, el tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de carga pesada. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una persona muy admirable ya que tiene que trabajar muy duro para ganarse el pan de cada día. El está muy conforme con su negocio, pues es el que le proporciona los alimentos diarios. Esto lo conlleva a solicitar este financiamiento que será destinado para la compra de llantas, caja de velocidad y el sistema de freno hidráulico. El sueña con mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Noel Anselmo is 67 years old and has been working with the Foundation for a long time. He has been providing heavy cargo transport services for more than 16 years. Noel is an admirable person who works extremely hard to earn a daily income. He is very happy with his business, which provides for his everyday needs.

This loan will be used to purchase tires, a gearbox, and a hydraulic brake system. He dreams of improving the living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires, a gearbox, and a hydraulic brake system

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Don Ricardo S. se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicleta y a su vez reparación de las mismas desde hace 9 años. Anteriormente trabajaba para la Compañía Licorera pero a él lo sacan y con su liquidación decide poner su propio negocio, don Ricardo es casado y con 3 hijos los cuales están edad escolar, su esposa es profesora de educación primaria desde hace 20 años. 
A don Ricardo se le han otorgado 31 créditos desde el año 2004 trabaja con Ceprodel para invertir más en el negocio, ya que el vende repuestos y él mismo las repara.
texts.en:
Don Ricardo S. se dedica a la venta de repuestos de bicicleta y a su vez reparación de las mismas desde hace 9 años. Anteriormente trabajaba para la Compañía Licorera pero a él lo sacan y con su liquidación decide poner su propio negocio, don Ricardo es casado y con 3 hijos los cuales están edad escolar, su esposa es profesora de educación primaria desde hace 20 años. A don Ricardo se le han otorgado 31 créditos desde el año 2004 trabaja con Ceprodel para invertir más en el negocio, ya que el vende repuestos y él mismo las repara.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Repuestos de Bicicleta (rines, tuercas, asientos, manubrios, llantas, rayos, etc.)

loans.name: Pelayo

texts.es: Pelayo tiene 46 años, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el centro poblado del Rosario, Ayacucho. Apenas tiene primaria completa, pero ello no significó que se quedara sin oficio, es así que hace  10 años viene trabajando incasablemente como renovador de calzados en un puesto que tiene dentro de su comunidad. Normalmente él compra sus suelas de calzados cada mes en la ciudad de Ayacucho, para luego elaborar estos calzados, desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM en su pequeño taller, por lo que se siente fortalecido y contento por los buenos resultados que le está dando. Sus planes a futuro es comprar una rematadora para suelas de calzado, con la finalidad de minimizar tiempo y aumentar su producción. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pago de manera de oportuna, y además se siente contento con la solidaridad de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, adquirirá más suelas para todo tipo de calzados, ya sea de punta redonda, cuadrada, ovalada, con la finalidad de tener variedad en la fabricación de calzados y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Pelayo is 46 years old, single, and has two children. He lives with them in his own house, located in the central village of Rosario in Ayacucho. Pelayo only has an elementary school education, but this does not mean he has been without work. He has been working tirelessly for ten years repairing shoes from a stand that he owns within the community. Pelayo normally buys shoe soles each month in the city of Ayacucho that he uses for making shoes. He works from 7am until 6pm and says he feels stronger and happier with the good results that he has achieved. His future plans include purchasing a shoe repair machine that grinds the soles of the shoes so that he can complete his work in less time and increase his production.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Pelayo promises to continue making his payments on time and says that he is happy with the solidarity within his Communal Bank. With the requested loan, he will acquire more soles for all types of shoes. These include round tips, squares, and ovals so that he can produce a variety of handmade shoes and increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of shoe soles

loans.name: Cinthya Lissette

texts.es:
La joven Cinthya R. tiene la edad de 21 años, es casada y sin hijos, es estudiante de la carrera de Contaduría Publica Y Finanzas en la Universidad de Ciencias Comerciales en la ciudad de León, donde cursa el tercer año, al mismo tiempo trabaja como contador para la empresa que se dedica a la exportación de camarones (CAMANICA) desde hace dos años, su esposo es profesional y trabaja en una empresa familiar que se dedica al sector transporte urbano.
Cinthya es el primer crédito que Ceprodel le facilita, ya que ella quiere pagar los gastos de la universidad (matricula y otros).
texts.en:
La joven Cinthya R. tiene la edad de 21 años, es casada y sin hijos, es estudiante de la carrera de Contaduría Publica Y Finanzas en la Universidad de Ciencias Comerciales en la ciudad de León, donde cursa el tercer año, al mismo tiempo trabaja como contador para la empresa que se dedica a la exportación de camarones (CAMANICA) desde hace dos años, su esposo es profesional y trabaja en una empresa familiar que se dedica al sector transporte urbano. Cinthya es el primer crédito que Ceprodel le facilita, ya que ella quiere pagar los gastos de la universidad (matricula y otros).

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos de Universidad

loans.name: Martin Ismael

texts.es:
El Joven Martin Ismael S. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 niños varones que están edad escolar, él es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 8 años desempeñándose como recolector en el tren de aseo, además cabe mencionar que el habita en una comunidad llamada Villa Dolores y que a 5 km de ella es donde alquila tierras para sembrar, ya que aparte de su trabajo para la Alcaldía él se dedica a la Agricultura.
El joven ha obtenido con Ceprodel 6 créditos, desde el año 2006 se convirtió en cliente de Ceprodel, los cuales ha utilizado para invertirlos en la siembra Arroz y frijoles
texts.en:
El Joven Martin Ismael S. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 niños varones que están edad escolar, él es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 8 años desempeñándose como recolector en el tren de aseo, además cabe mencionar que el habita en una comunidad llamada Villa Dolores y que a 5 km de ella es donde alquila tierras para sembrar, ya que aparte de su trabajo para la Alcaldía él se dedica a la Agricultura. El joven ha obtenido con Ceprodel 6 créditos, desde el año 2006 se convirtió en cliente de Ceprodel, los cuales ha utilizado para invertirlos en la siembra Arroz y frijoles

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos Personales (Pago de Alquiler de tierras y Preparación de Tierras).

loans.name: Mujeres Capactiadas 5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Carmen’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their three children.

Carmen is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small fried food stand by purchasing the necessary flour, meat and cooking oil.

Carmen will use the profits to invest in her home by continuing to change her wooden walls to concrete block and purchasing a sewing machine to make adjustments to her and her children's clothing. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more flour, meat and cooking oil

loans.name: Yasmin Evelisa

texts.es: Yasmin Evelisa R. de 31 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su único hijo de 3 años y medio de edad. Yasmin posee un bazar, en el cual comercializa ropa para hombres mujeres y niños, así mismo otros tipos de accesorios como ropa interior, zapatos, sandalias, cinchos y otros más. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que ella se destaca por ser una mujer muy amable, la cual brinda un excelente servicio. Yasmin solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, tales como collares, pulseras, pantalones, accesorios para el cabello y otros más, ya que las personas que visitan este bazar lo hacen sobre todo buscando alguna prenda para obsequiar, es por ello que Yasmín desea contar con productos los cuales sean indicado para este tipo de uso. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza por mejorar su trabajo y de esta manera poder brindarle todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Yasmin Evelisa R. is 31 years old and resides in Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her only child who is 3½ years old. Yasmin owns a bazaar where she sells clothing for men, women, and children. At the same time she sells accessories such as undergarments, shoes, sandals, belts, and other items. Her business is located in her house, a place that is visited by many customers. She is known for being a very kind woman who provides excellent service.

Yasmin is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of merchandise such as necklaces, bracelets, trousers, hair accessories, and other items. More people are coming to her bazaar in search of clothes to buy as gifts. For this reason, Yasmin wants to have more products that are suitable for this situation. She is a hardworking woman who strives to improve her work and provide everything that her young son needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, accessories, and makeup

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es: Guadalupe de Jesús O. M. de 35 años de edad,  reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa privada y junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Guadalupe posee una venta de productos varios como cosméticos, granos básicos detergente, cremas para cabello y cuerpo y otros más. El negocio esta ubicado sobre la calle principal que lleva a Lourdes Colón, por lo que cuenta con muy buena visibilidad por parte de las personas lo cual le permite contar con muchos clientes. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de frijoles, arroz, harina, y más cosméticos, los cuales están entre los productos que más se venden. Guadalupe, posee el deseo de poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y de esta manera salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe de Jesús O. M. is 35 years old and resides in Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who is an employee for a private company, and together they have an 11 year old son who is a student. Guadalupe has a store where she sells various products such as cosmetics, basic grains, detergents, hair and body crèmes, and other items. Her business is located on the main road leading to Lourdes Colón, so it has good visibility and attracts many customers.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy beans, rice, flour, and more cosmetics since these are the products that she sells the most. She desires to improve her financial stability so that her family can move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & dry goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa A. C. de 43 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, quien es un hombre muy trabajador, y su única hija. Rosa posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, por lo que su negocio es muy próspero, ya que ella cuenta con una gran variedad de productos. Rosa posee la tienda, lo cual es un lugar muy apto para este tipo de negocio, ya que es una zona muy adecuada para esta. Es por esto que Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: arroz, frijoles, y azúcar, así mismo mayor cantidad de embutidos y leche, todo lo que sea necesario para mantener a flote su negocio. Rosa anhela poder contar con mayor cantidad de productos para poder ofrecer a las personas y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa A. C. is 43 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who is a hardworking gentleman, and their only daughter. Rosa has a store where she sells perishable products and basic necessities. Her business is thriving and is stocked with a large variety of products. Rosa’s store is located in area that is suitable for this type of business.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy large quantities of products such as rice, beans, sugar, sausages, and milk. All of these items are needed to keep her business afloat. Rosa hopes to have more products to offer to her customers so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: José Mercedes

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama José Mercedes C. A. es casado y tiene un hijo el cual esta bajo su cargo, don José es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 6 años desempeñándose en el cargo de recolector en el tren de aseo.
Don José es el tercer crédito que solicita y que se le otorga y esta vez es para compra de un Freezer, ya que su señora quiere vender hielo en su casa de habitación esto con el fin de obtener otros ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Este Sr. Se llama José Mercedes C. A. es casado y tiene un hijo el cual esta bajo su cargo, don José es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 6 años desempeñándose en el cargo de recolector en el tren de aseo. Don José es el tercer crédito que solicita y que se le otorga y esta vez es para compra de un Freezer, ya que su señora quiere vender hielo en su casa de habitación esto con el fin de obtener otros ingresos para el hogar.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra Electrodoméstico ( Freezer)

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester R. G. de 60 años de edad, reside en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su única hija la cual se dedica a estudiar.  Ester posee una venta de productos de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa, y de la que dependen en gran manera, ya que es de una gran ayuda para la estabilidad económica de su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, pan, jugos, golosinas y otros productos más. Ester tiene el deseo de poder mejorar el estado de su negocio, surtiéndolo y de esta manera poder mejorar en gran manera sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ester R. G. is 60 years old and resides in Antiguo Cuscatlán, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her only daughter who is a student. Ester has business in her house where she sells basic necessities. She is dependent on her business since it has been a great help in providing financial stability for her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy large quantities of rice, beans, sugar, soap, bread, juices, candy, and other products. Ester wants to improve the state of her business. By increasing her stock, she will be able to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene tiene 30 años, es soltera y madre de una pequeña hija, juntas viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un poblado de Ayacucho. A Rene siempre le ha gustado progresar y desde muy niña le gustaba ayudar a su familia en la  venta de frutas. Ahora produce y comercializa sus productos como: frutas cítricas, papaya, plátano y mango; siendo estos vendidos en su comunidad, pero generalmente los lleva a la ciudad de Ayacucho para su vetna a los mayoristas, dejándolo a buen precio. Ella recibe la ayuda de sus padres en tiempo de siembra y cosecha. En el futuro piensa invertir en una tienda de venta de ropa, en donde pueda ofrecer una gama de cualidades y variedades de prendas de vestir, además de variados precios de acuerdo a la economía de sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además desea continuar perteneciendo a su grupo comunal, por ser un grupo bien organizado. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en insumos y abono para su terreno de cultivo, de esa manera minimizar los riesgos de plagas que afecten sus productos.
texts.en:
Rene is 30 years old. She is a single mother of a young daughter and lives in her own house located in Ayacucho. Rene always enjoys making progress and has been selling fruits with the help of her family since she was a girl. She now produces and sells products such as citrus fruits, papayas, bananas, and mangos. These fruits are sold in her community, but she generally takes her produce to the city of Ayacucho to sell to wholesalers at a good price. Her parents help her during the planting and harvesting seasons. In the future, she wants to open a clothing store where she can offer a range of outfits that vary in quality and price based on what her customers can afford.

This is her second loan with MFP. She commits to meeting her payment obligations and also wants to continue participating in her Communal Bank, which is a well-organized group. With the loan she requested, Rene will invest the funds in supplies and compost for her farmland. The will minimize the risk of plagues that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & compost

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio R. de 56 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual le ayuda con el negocio, y junto a sus dos hijos los cuales estudian y así mismo colaboran con el negocio de la familia. Mario posee una panadería, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, lugar en el cual comercializa gran parte del pan que elabora. Tanto pan francés, nombre el cual se le da al  pan baguette en este país, como también pan dulce, es el que Mario junto a su familia elaboran día con día. Este pan también es comercializado a domicilio con muchos clientes los cuales compran por mayor para abastecer sus tiendas. Mario solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar harina por mayor, huevos, manteca, levadura, y otros instrumentos más los cuales son necesarios para hornear el pan. Este es un negocio muy productivo para Mario, ya que le permite sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario Antonio R. is 56 years old and resides in Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife who helps with the business. Together they have two children who are in school and also work with the family business.

Mario runs a bakery that is located in his house. From this place he sells most of the bread that he produces. He bakes French bread, which is known in this country as baguettes. Mario also makes sweet bread together with his family day after day. Many customers come to his home to buy bread in bulk in order to stock their stores.

Mario is requesting a loan so that he will have the necessary funds to buy flour in bulk, eggs, butter, yeast, and other supplies needed for baking bread. This is a very productive business for Mario, which allows him to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making bread

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Roxana Patricia

texts.es: Roxana Patricia R. R. de 24 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Sacacoyo, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante ambulante, y junto a su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad. Roxana se dedica a la venta de zapatos y medicinas, las cuales comercializa en su hogar y así mismo de forma ambulante, esto último con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias, por lo que sale día con día a ofrecer su producto por las diferentes calles del departamento de La Libertad, logrando obtener ganancias bastante aceptables. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando ropa  para hombres y mujeres, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad de medicinas y zapatos, todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera mantener el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana Patricia R. R. is 24 years old and resides in the municipality of Sacacoyo, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as an itinerant vendor, and her 5-year-old son. Roxana's work is selling shoes and medicines, which she offers for sale in her home and also as an itinerant vendor, in order to earn higher profits. Day after day, she goes out to offer her products on various streets of the department of La Libertad, which allows her to obtain quite acceptable returns. For this reason, she is a requesting a loan which she will invest in her business, buying men's and women's clothing as well as a larger quantity of medicines and shoes. She is doing all this with the desire to increase her earnings and thus maintain her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medicines, clothing and shoes

loans.name: Marilin Geraldine

texts.es: Marilin Geraldine R. D. L. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una fábrica textil, y junto a su hijo el cual se dedica a estudiar educación básica. Marilin posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa productos lácteos como queso, crema, y otros más. Su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa D. habitación, la cual esta ubicada sobre la calle principal, un lugar muy estratégico para ella, ya que todos los día hay una gran afluencia D. personas, las cuales consumen su producto. Marilin solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. queso en diferentes tipos D. este, así mismo más crema y requesón. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora quien siempre esta en vistas D. algo mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Marilin Geraldine R. D. L. is 29 years old and resides in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works in a textile factory, and her son, who attends elementary school. Marilin has her own business selling dairy products such as cheese, cream, and others. Her business is in her home, which is located on the town's main street. This is a very strategic location for her, since every day large numbers of people pass by and buy her products. Marilin is requesting a loan which she will use to stock her business, buying a larger quantity of cheeses of various types, as well as more cream and curds. Marilin is a very responsible woman who is always in search of something better for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her business with dairy products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rosa Marin

texts.es: Rosa Marin A. de 56 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Armenia, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Rosa posee una venta de pollos de engorde, los cuales cría y posteriormente comercializa a diferentes clientes. Desde hace muchos años atrás que ella se dedica a este tipo de trabajo por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales le compran su producto de una forma periódica, de manera que Rosa en la mayoría de veces obtiene ganancias diarias, las cuales a pesar de esto, no le permiten invertir en gran manera en su negocio, ya que la mayoría de estas las invierte en el hogar. Es por esto que Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de pollos, así mismo comprar las vitaminas y el concentrado necesario para brindarles una mejor alimentación a los pollos y de esta manera poder ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Rosa Marin A., 56, lives in the town of Armenia, located in the Sonsonate Department. She lives with her husband and two children in her own house. Rosa sells fattened chickens, ones that she has raised and then sells to different customers. She has been doing this type of work for many years, and can depend on many customers who buy her chickens periodically so that she is able to get a daily income. However, despite the earnings, she can’t put most of it into the business since she has to spend the majority of the income on her household. That is why Rosa is asking for a loan with which she can buy a larger number of chickens, and also the vitamins and the necessary concentrate to provide the chickens better nutrition and thus they will be of better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, vitamins and food for them

loans.name: Kenia Cristina

texts.es: Kenia Cristina G. M. de 23 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive únicamente junto a su esposo. Kenia posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de perecederos y de primera necesidad para los hogares. Cuenta con la ventaja de que la tienda esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, y así mismo que es una de las tiendas más conocidas en el lugar, por lo cual cuenta con muchos clientes fijos los cuales consumen a diario de sus productos. Kenia solicita un préstamo, ya que cuenta con el enorme deseo de poder surtir más su negocio, con el fin de poder contar con todos los productos que sus clientes buscan, de esta manera ella podrá satisfacer de la mejor manera a las personas y así mismo ganar clientes nuevos, los cuales consuman a diario de las ventas de su tienda.
texts.en:
Kenia Cristina G. M. is 23 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, located in the La Libertad department. She lives just with her husband. Kenia has a store where she sells food products and basic necessities for the home. She has the advantage of having her store located in her home. In addition, it is one of the most well-known stores in the area, and so has a lot of regular customers who consume her products daily. Kenia requests a loan, since she really wants to be able to increase the inventory in her store. With the loan she will be able to obtain all types of products that her customers are looking for, and in this way she will be able to satisfy her customers to a greater degree and also attract new customers who will buy daily from her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Fátima Yesenia

texts.es: Fátima Yesenia P. D. M. D. 29 años D. edad, ResiD. en la zona D. Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus dos hijos D. 14 y 11 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Fátima posee una venta D. platillos típicos, los cuales son hechos a base D. maíz, productos tales como: atol D. elote, tortas D. elote, atol D. maíz tostado y un sin fin D. productos más. Así mismo comercializa cosméticos como maquillaje, perfumes y cremas para el cuerpo y rostro. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos. Fátima solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz y cosméticos D. manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas y brindarle mayor ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Fátima Yesenia P. D. M. is 29 years old and lives in the Lourdes Colón area, located in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and their 2 children: aged 14 and 11, who are in school. Fátima has a business selling food. She makes traditional dishes based from corn, including items such as: atol D. elote (a corn drink), tortas D. elote (corn cakes), atol D. maíz tostado (roasted corn drink) and an endless number of other products. In addition, she sells cosmetics such as makeup, perfumes, and body and face creams. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman, who has very good references from her neighbors. Fátima requests a loan to buy a large quantity of corn and cosmetics, so that she can increase her sales and proviD. a more help to her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn and cosmetics

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: José Domingo

texts.es: José Domingo L. M. de 44 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Quezaltepeque, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus cuatro hijos de 14, 11, 10, y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. José comercializa carbón, el cual distribuye en los diferentes puestos del Mercado Central, un lugar en el cual todo se vende por mayor, por lo que él cuenta con una gran ventaja, así mismo se dedica a hacer viajes para otras personas y de esta manera transportar verduras o frutas al mercado, por lo que obtiene ganancias diarias por parte de los clientes fijos. José solicita un préstamo para poder comprar leña con la cual hace el carbón que posteriormente comercializa, de manera que pueda hacer mayor cantidad y así tener mucho más que ofrecerles a sus clientes. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para José ya que es gracias a el que puede llevar el sustento diario hasta su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose Domingo Lopez M. is 44 years old and he lives in the village of Quezaltepeque, logcated in the La Libertad region. He lives together with his wife and their four children, aged 14, 11, 10 and 7 years. They are all going to school. Jose sells carbon, distributing to various stands in the Central market, a place where everything is sold in wholesale, which he considers a great advantage. He also transports fruits and vegetables for other businesses in the market, earning him a second income aside from his regular clients. Jose requests a loan to be able to purchase wood to make coal for later resale. This way he will be able to make a greater quantity and have that much more to offer his clients. His business is very important to Jose. Thanks to his business he is able to meet the daily demands of his household.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Noé

texts.es: Noé R. R. de 50 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda en el negocio, cociendo ropa, y así mismo junto a sus cinco hijos de 16, 14, 11, 6 y 4 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Noé es un señor muy trabajador y responsable, el cual se dedica a trabajar en su propio taller de costura, en el cual se encarga de elaborar ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres, las cual comercializa de forma ambulante o en su propia casa, lugar en el cual esta ubicado su negocio. Su esposa le ayuda con el taller, elaborando también prendas de vestir, de manera que puedan cubrir los pedidos a la medida del menor tiempo posible, ya que esto habla muy bien de su negocio y les permite obtener nuevos clientes. Noé solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de tela en diferentes colores y estampados, hilos, agujas botones y todo lo necesario para la elaboración de la ropa. Para Noé es muy importante poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este le permite poder sostener a sus cinco hijos y de esta manera brindarles todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Noé R. R. is 50 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, located in La Libertad department. He lives with his wife, who helps him with his business, which is sewing clothing. He also lives with his five children, who are 16, 14, 11, 6, and 4 years old and are all in school. Noé is a very hardworking and responsible person. He works in his own sewing workshop where he makes clothing for children, men, and women. He sells them as a traveling vendor, or from his own home, which is where his business is located. His wife helps him in the workshop by also sewing clothing. In this way they can fill orders as requested in the least amount of time possible. This speaks well for their business and allows them to obtain new clients. Noé is requesting a loan with which he will buy a larger quantity of fabrics in different colors and patterns, threads, needles, buttons, and everything necessary for making clothing. It is very important to Noé to improve his business because this will allow him to provide for his five children and give them everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothing--fabric, threads, needles, buttons, etc.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Elsy Yanira

texts.es: Elsy Yanira B. M. de 38, años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad.  Elsy posee una panadería en la cual elabora diferentes tipos de pan, los cuales sale a repartir con los diferentes clientes que posee. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual se encarga de elaborar y hornear el pan. Debido a que su número de clientes ha aumentado, ella necesita poder comprar un horno nuevo el cual le permita hacer más pan, por lo que solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda obtenerlo y así mismo comprar mayor cantidad de harina, azúcar, levadura, y todos los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración del pan.
texts.en:
Elsy Yanira B. M. is 38 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, located in the area of La Libertad. She lives alongside her husband, who works as a shopkeeper, and her 12 year old son. Elsy has a bakery where she makes different types of bread which she goes out to deliver to her various customers. Her business is located within her home, a place where she handles the making and the baking of bread. As her number of customers has increased, she needs to buy a new oven which will allow her to make more bread. For this reason, she is soliciting a loan from Integral. With the loan, she will also be able to buy a greater quantity of flour, sugar, leavening and all the ingredients necessary to make bread.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new oven.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Y Esperanza 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Anal is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Fe y Esperanza (Women of Faith and Hope ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Anal’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband and two children.

Anal is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and is excited to be having access to capital at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a butcher shop and selling "habichuela con dulce" a type of Dominican dessert.

Anal will use the profits to help support her children in the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and a sack of beans

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis Ernesto A. M.  de 24 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Santa Tecla, ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, su hija de 3 años de edad, y su madre. Luis es un joven muy emprendedor, quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual le ayuda su esposa atender la tienda, lo cual le da muchas ventajas ya que le permite atender a su hija y al mismo tiempo atender el trabajo. Luis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda Comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: bebidas, pan, golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de Luis es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Ernesto A. M. is 24 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, located in the area of La Libertad. He lives alongside his wife, his 3 year old daughter and his mother. Luis is a young entrepreneur who owns his own business selling perishables and basic necessities from a small store located within his home. He and his wife tend the store which gives him many advantages as it allows him to raise his daughter while working. Luis is soliciting a loan in order to buy a greater quantity of products such as drinks, bread, candies, disinfectants, detergents and all the products that are most sought after by his customers. Luis’s main desire is to be able to improve his sales, as that is what allows him to maintain his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessities to sell.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El Sr. J. M. Jorge luis, vive en Prolongación Catalina Buendia de Pecho perteneciente al Distrito de Pachacutec. Tiene dos hijos. Su esposa es ama de casa. El Sr. J.  Trabaja como obrero de campo en la empresa agricola Drokasa desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con casa propia la cual esta construyendo. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda. Su sueño es poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El Sr. J.  agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis J. M. lives in Prolongación Catalina Buendia de Pecho, in the district of Pachacutec. He has two children. His wife is a homemaker. Mr. J. has been working as a field laborer for the agricultural company Drokasa for 10 years. He has his own house, which he is building. He is requesting a loan to finish his house. His dream is to finish building his house so that he can provide a better quality of life for his children. Mr. J. is grateful for the support we are able to provide him though this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvments

loans.name: Marta Silvia

texts.es: Marta Silvia M. de 53 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Soyapango, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su compañero de vida el cual trabaja como comerciante ambulante. Marta posee una venta de golosinas, pan, y bebidas, la esta ubicada en el centro de Soyapango, una de los lugares con mayor comercio del país, ya que es una ciudad llena de muchos negocios y empresas. Sus clientes son empleados de los centros comerciales y otras empresas del lugar, quienes se detienen por un momento a tomar un pequeño refrigerio. Marta se ha ganado la vida de esta manera desde hace 5 años, lo cual le ha funcionado mucho ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fijos, los cuales le compran a diario, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de golosinas, sodas, refrescos, pan y otros más, los cuales le permitan obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta Silvia M. is 53 years old. She lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her partner, who works as a street vendor. Marta owns a business selling sweets, bread, and soft drinks. It is located in the center of Soyapango, one of the most commercial areas in the country, because it is a city full of businesses. Her customers are employees at nearby shopping centers and other businesses in the area who stop by for a few minutes to eat a small snack. Marta has been earning a living this way for 5 years. Things have gone well for her because she has many regular customers who buy from her on a daily basis. She is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to buy a larger quantity of sweets, sodas, soft drinks, bread, and other items. This will allow her to have an increased income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, bread, sodas, and soft drinks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta T. is from the village of Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult and school-aged children. Julieta owns and operates a general store, selling daily food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for twelve years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. has an agricultural business. She is 40 years old and married to Rodan. They have 3 children. Her eldest child is 18 years old. She joined CEVI to get additional capital to sustain her business. She would like a loan of PHP 10,000.00. The loan will be used to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn M. is a hog raiser and is also engaged in farming. She is 43 years of age and a native of South Cotabato.

Ailyn joined CEVI to finance the business she owns. She loaned the amount of Php 12,000 which will be used to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Karla Iliana

texts.es: Karla Iliana Q. P. de 25 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa privada y junto a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Karla posee una venta de pupusas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas, así mismo vende chocolate caliente, sodas y café, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro de Soyapango, un lugar el cual posee gran afluencia de personas, sobretodo porque esta ubicado en medio de tres centros comerciales, lo que beneficia en gran manera a Karla ya que la mayoría de empleados de este lugar desayunan en su negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para la elaboración de las pupusas, así mismo para comprar chicharrón, frijoles y queso, y de esta misma manera comprar más bebidas tanto frías como calientes.
texts.en:
Karla Iliana Q. P. is 25 years old and resides in the La Libertad district. She lives with her husband, who is an employee of a private company, and their little son who is 3 years old. Karla has a stand where she sells pupusas (a traditional Salvadorean dish made of thick corn tortillas with filling), which she is responsible for making and selling. She also sells hot chocolate, sodas, and coffee. Her business is located in the center of Soyapango, a place which has a great crowd of people, mainly because it is located in the middle of three commercial centers. This greatly benefits Karla, since the majority of the employees in this area have breakfast at her stand.

She is applying for a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of corn to make pupusas and at the same time buy pork, beans, and cheese and also more drinks, both cold and hot.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, pork, beans, and cheese

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma R. is involved in agriculture and is presently raising pigs. She lives in South Cotabato and is 37 years old.

Alma joined CEVI in September 2009 with the aim of having a stable income. She borrowed Php 10,000 which will be used to finance feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. has been a member of CEVI since May 2008. She likes the program because it helps her to financially establish her business.

Erlinda is presently engaged in raising pigs and farming. She would like to borrow Php 15,000 which will be used to buy pig feed and farm supplies.

Erlinda is 60 years of age and has four children. Her eldest child is 38 years old.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feed for her pigs

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes F. D. C. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán. Vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 16, 14 y 6 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una panadería en la cual se encarga D. elaborar pan dulce y pan tipo baguette. La panadería está ubicada en su propia casa, lugar en el cual no posee ningún tipo D. competencia, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes. María es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza a diario por brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera y por esta razón debe esforzarse en gran manera. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, miel, azúcar, y todos los elementos necesarios para la elaboración del pan.
texts.en:
María Lourdes F. D. C. is 35 years old and lives in San Francisco Goteras, located in the Morazán department. She lives together with her 3 children - 16, 14 and 6 years of age, who all study. María has a bakery where she makes sweet bread and bread such as baguettes. The bakery is located in her own house, in an area where there is no competition, so owing to this she has many customers. María is a very hard-working woman who works hard every day to give her children everything they need. She is a single mother and for this reason must work very hard. María is seeking a loan with which to buy flour, honey, sugar, and all the ingredients necessary to make bread.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra Yanira G. O. de 40 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico. Sandra posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad así mismo posee una venta de tortillas, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, lugar al cual llegan las personas a traer los pedidos de tortillas, negocios los cuales se completan, ya que cuando las personas llegan a comprar tortillas aprovechan y compran otros productos. Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza a diario por obtener una mejor vida junto a su esposo. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz, gas propano, golosinas, pan, bebidas y todo lo necesario para invertir en la tienda, esto de manera que pueda obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra Yanira G. O., 40 years old, lives in San Juan Opica, located in La Libertad department. She lives together with her husband, who is a mechanic. Sandra has a shop where she sells basic necessities and also tortillas. The shop is located in her house, and people come to bring tortilla orders which she then completes. When people return to enjoy the tortillas they also buy other products. Sandra is a very hard-working woman who works hard every day to have a better quality of life with her husband. She is seeking a loan to have the necessary funds to purchase maize, propane gas, sweets, bread, lollies and everything else necessary to invest in the shop. In this way she hopes to obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishables

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en: Oyun is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Oyunbileg, is a student in the fourth grade. Oyun operates an electrical product repair service at her home. She has been operating her business since 1998, after she graduated with a certification as a television and auto electrician. She has been in this business for many years and has gained a great deal of experience. Oyun has built a loyal customer base, and her service has become well known among her customers.  She has purchased a refrigerator for her family with the profits from her business. In addition, she successfully paid off her previous loan. Oyun is a very hardworking person who is focused on providing for her children's financial futures. Oyun is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase spare electrical parts at wholesales prices from the UB Proton shop.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Enhbaigalmaa

texts.en:
Enhbaigalmaa is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two oldest daughters, aged 22 and 21, attend a university. One of Enhbaigalmaa's daughters helps her with the business.

Currently, Enhbaigalmaa operates a tailoring business at a rented workplace. She is assisted in the business by her entire family and has been successfully operating her business since 2007. Initially her working capital was 80,000 tugrugs (approximately 60 USD), but she has managed to increase her working capital to more than 400,000 tugrugs (approximately 290 USD).

Enhbaigalmaa has been planning to expand her business in the future. She is a very hardworking and open person. She is focused on growing her business and says, “My dream is to one day create my own comfortable workplace for my business.”

Enhbaigalmaa is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan to purchase more necessary materials, including silk and fabric, for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials, including silk and fabric

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya is 61 years old and lives with her daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

During the day, Marusya operates a raw materials such as animal skin, cashmere trading business with her daughter, Battsetseg, who is 34 years old. They have been operating their business since 2005 and have gained valuable experience. Marusya started her business with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (approximately 725 USD) and, with a lot of hard work and determination, has increased her working capital to more than 3,000,000 tugrugs (approximately 2170 USD).

Marusya has been planning to expand her business in the future. Since she started her business, her family's standard of living has improved. With her earnings, she has purchased a car for her family and is providing money towards family expenses.

Marusya is an industrious person who has good communication skills. She says, “I have been planning to grow my business with my daughter and to increase the number of my livestock.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa T., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. She is married to Dante T. and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Ma. Luisa manages her own variety store while also maintaining a hamburger stand, a mami (beef noodle) stand and a halo-halo (shaved ice dessert, similar to Singapore’s Ice Kechang) stall.

Ma. Luisa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her businesses, Ma. Luisa would like to apply for a PHP 30,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding businesses by buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her hamburgers, noodles and halo-halo. She will also invest some of the loan in buying groceries for her variety store.

Ma. Luisa dreams that her businesses will continue to grow so that she can have more patrons and thus ensure herself and her family of a comfortable future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for more hamburgers, noodles and halo-halo, and to buy more groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia S. owns a piggery and she also raises cows. She is 40 years old, married to Rogelio, and they have four children. Her eldest child is 12 years old.

Mrs. S. is involved in her business to sustain her family. In order to help augment her family's living conditions, she joined CEVI and would like to obtain a loan of Php 15,000. The loan will be used primarily to buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel is 40 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Hulantahi, is 21 years old and attends a university.

Oyungerel operates a food products trading business from a shipping container which she owns at a local food market. She has been operating this business with her husband since 2005 and they have built a stable operation. She started her business with a working capital of 800,000 tugrugs (approximately 580 USD). After years of successful operation she has managed to increase her working capital to more than 2,100,000 tugrugs (approximately 1510 USD).

Oyungerel has been putting her earnings towards her family's expenses and her family's quality of life has been improving. She is a very hardworking person and is focused on the future. She says, “I would like to grow my business and provide a good education for my child.” She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more food products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa S. owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of cornfield and a hectare of rice field. This enterprise helps her support her family’s needs.

S. is aged 40, married to Glen, and they have four children. Her eldest child is 18.
