S. would like to obtain a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI to finance her business. The loan will be used to supply her needs like seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely E. raises pigs. She is 43 years old and is a resident of South Cotabato.

Mely has been an active member of CEVI since October 2008. She would like to obtain Php 15,000 to finance her business. The loan will be used to buy feed and piglets.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn B., 30, works hard to make sure that she earns enough so that her family can have a better life. She has been selling processed meat such as cured hams and sausages, sweetened pork, and native cured meats for some time.

Ronalyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues and uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her meat business. She would now like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan to be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful someday.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda H. possesses several sources of income. She is engaged in farming, hog raising, goat raising and poultry. She is 55 years old, married to Marlon, and they have five children. Her eldest child is 22 years old.  She wanted to join CEVI to finance her business. She would like to borrow 15,000 PHP. The loan will be used to buy feed, vaccines, and farm supplies.

loans.use: Feed, vaccines, farm supplies

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz C., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Eduardo C., a driver, they are blessed with two children. Beatriz makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while also having a direct-selling business for quite some now.

Beatriz has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct-selling business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she is applying for a 37,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying advance orders for her direct-selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow. She also dreams to have her own outlet of the popular brands that she sells.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders from her direct selling line and additonal inventory for her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Elsa Reyna

texts.es: Elsa Reyna A. G. de 45 años de edad, reside en Cantón San Juan Mesas, ubicado en el municipio de San Pablo Tacachico, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como agricultor y junto a sus 6 hijos, de los cuales los cinco mayores se dedican a trabajar como jornaleros y solo el menor se dedica a trabajar. La señora Elsa se dedica a comercializar ropa para mujeres, niños y hombres, así mismo vende cosméticos, cremas para el cuerpo y el cabello. Ella comercializa su producto de forma ambulante por lo que cada mañana debe caminar muchos kilómetros para poder vender las prendas de vestir. Elsa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes tallas y colores, así mismo comprar cosméticos, los cuales sean de diferentes precios para poder comercializarlos de mejor manera. Para ella el mejorar sus ganancias es muy importante ya que cuenta con una familia bastante extensa, en la cual todos luchan por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elsa Reyna A. G., 45 years old, lives in the village of San Juan Mesas of the municipality of San Pablo Tacachico, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and their six children, the eldest five of which are day laborers, while only the youngest goes to school. Elsa sells clothing for men, women, and children, as well as cosmetics and creams for the hair and body. She sells her products door-to-door and must walk many kilometers each morning in order to sell the clothing. She's requesting a loan to buy more clothing in a wider variety of sizes and colors, as well as buying cosmetics of various price points to improve her sales. Increasing her earnings is a major goal for her, since she has a large family that is struggling to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

location.town: San Pablo Tacachico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth R. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada, y es con el ingreso, en gran parte, que él genera que esta familia logra salir adelante. Los pequeños dos hijos D. esta pareja, D. 11 y 12 años D. edad, Alesandra y Rodrigo respectivamente se dedican a estudiar. También habita dentro D. este grupo familiar el suegro D. Roxana, quien a sus 70 años D. edad es un jubilado y ayuda en la atención del pequeño negocio familiar. Roxana posee una librería, en la cual comercializa cuadernos, lápices, borradores, diferentes tipo D. papel, cinta adhesiva y otros más. Así mismo posee una pequeña tienda en la que comercializa productos D. primera necesidad. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, que por contar con muy buena localización, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos, quienes en varias ocasiones buscan ciertos productos que Roxana no posee. Es por esta razón que Roxana desea poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir  la librería y así mismo comprar granos básicos para la tienda, D. esta manera ella podrá satisfacer a sus clientes D. todo lo necesario, y así aumentar sus ventas y ayudar mas a la economía D. su familia.-
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth R. D. M. is 34 years old. She lives in Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband who works for a private business. She also lives with her two children, aged 12 and 11, who work, and with her father in law who is retired. Roxana has a book store where she sells notebooks, pencils, erasers, different types of paper, tape and other things. She alsoohas a small store where she sells basic necessities. The business is located in her own home and she has many regular customers. They come on various occasions and look for certain producs they haven't been able to find. This is why Roxanne wishes to have enough money to beable to supply her bookstore and also buy basic grains for the store. This way she will be able to satisfy her clients with everything they need and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for a book store

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Wisma Cempaka 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made R. S. (0) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Made is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Wisma Cempaka 2 (MUK-0019).


Ni Made is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Ni Made owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Ni Made has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Made joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Made is requesting her first loan from MUK.  She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 IDR, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Ni Made from MUK.  Ni Made plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers.  As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. 

To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click on the following link: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking


Ni Made R. S. (0) merupakan 39 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Made adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 4 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Wisma Cempaka 2 (MUK-0019).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Made sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Made bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Made meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.  "

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila B. has been an active member of CEVI since May 2008. She joined the program believing that she could augment her business. She is 42 years old, married to Rogelio, and they have two children, the eldest of which is age 12. She would like to borrow 14,000 PHP to buy farm supplies like fertilizers for the farm and also feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maura Del Carmen

texts.es: Maura del Carmen P. M. de 40 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 12 y 11 años de edad. Maura posee un comedor, en el cual se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos así mismo comercializa golosinas y bebidas frías y calientes. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se encarga de llevar el sustento diario a sus dos hijos, los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Es por esto que Maura día con día se esfuerza por lograr mayores ventas, las cuales beneficien a su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir el comedor comprando mayor cantidad de verduras, frutas, granos básicos y otros más los cuales le permitan elaborar mayor cantidad de comida y de esta misma forma atender a mas clientes.
texts.en:
Maura del Carmen P. M. is 40 years old. She lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her two children, aged 12 and 11. Maura has a restaurant where she makes breakfasts and lunches and where she also sells snacks and hot and cold drinks. She is a very hardworking woman who supports her two children, who totally depend on her. That is why Maura strives every day to have more sales, which benefit her family. She is asking for a loan with which she can add variety to the restaurant by buying greater quantities of vegetables, fruits, basic grains and other things that will allow her to make a greater quantity of food and in this way serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegentables, fruits, and basic grains to prepare food

loans.name: Anicia

texts.en:
Anicia L., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Emmanuel, a water distributor, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She manages her own variety store.

Anicia has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, Anicia would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business, with which she will buy groceries needed to replenish stocks so she can continue the operations of her variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also prays that they will be able to find jobs after they graduate this year.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to replenish stocks

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sari Kencana (MUK-0020).


Jro Nyoman is married and has two infant children.  To make a living, Jro Nyoman owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Jro Nyoman has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities.

Jro Nyoman is requesting her first loan from MUK. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Jro Nyoman from MUK.  Jro Nyoman plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Jro Nyoman T. (0) merupakan 31 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Jro Nyoman adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sari Kencana (MUK-0020).

Jro Nyoman sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jro Nyoman menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Jro Nyoman bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Jro Nyoman meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,000,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Otgonlhagva

texts.en: Otgonlhagva is 43 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Otgonhlagva and her family live in a house and yard belonging to her relatives. Her husband, Boldbaatar, is a driver. Otgonlhagva has a bakery business at Bayanzurh, a local market. She started her business in 2008 with a working capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~ 290 USD), and in only two years her working capital has increased to 500,000 tugrugs (~ 362 USD). With her business earnings she has been providing for her family and saving money. Before moving to Ulaanbaatar Otgonlhagva was a telephone operator in Tov province. Otgonlhagva is a very-hard working person. Her family and business are both important for her and she has tried hard to improve her family's quality of life. Now Otgonlhagva's priority is to purchase her own place to live. Otgonlhagva is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~  505 USD) loan to purchase more baked goods and bread as well as to expand the number of products her business is able to offer.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena N., 59, makes sure that her family's daily needs are met. She and her retiree husband, Pacifico N., have three children. She has had her own variety store for some time, which helps their family have a better life.  

Magdalena has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues and uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 27,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and become successful. She prays that God grants her a long life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to replenish inventory

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 50 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Two of his children, aged 21 and 18, are university students. His third son, Munhsaihan, is 15 years old and attends a local secondary school. Batsaihan operates an auto repair service which he started in 2000 with working capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ 362 USD). After ten years he has managed to increase his working capital to more than 4,500,000 tugrugs (~ 3252 USD). He has built a loyal customer base because of the good quality of his work and service. After saving his profits for many years he was able to build his own auto garage and repair center. Batsaihan is an honest person and has good communication skills. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~  1445 USD) loan to increase the working capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin P., 46, is married to Restituto P., and they have four children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own food processing business while also operating a jeepney taxi service with her husband as driver.

Jasmin has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues and uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

She would like to apply for a PHP 35,000 loan. This amount will be used to buy materials needed for the jeepney’s repair and for the raw ingredients needed to continue production of her processed meats and foods.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also dreams of having her own house someday.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying spare parts for jeepney maintenance and raw ingredients for her processed meats and foods

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia T., 45, makes sure sure that her family's daily needs are met by running her own variety store, which she has had for quite some time.

Celia has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues and uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by replenishing her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to replenish her inventory

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda O. is from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Renilda has a business butchering and selling pork in the market. She has been in this business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

They have two employees. Oidov also has a day job as a network engineer for a branch of the Mongolian  National University, and works at the carpentry business in his spare time. He and his father have had their business for 10 years, and his father is a well-known carpenter in their province. They have been planning to expand their business and to increase the number of their employees in the future. Oidov is an enthusiastic person and has been working hard to provide a better life for himself and his family. He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~  435 USD) loan to purchase more timber for the carpentry business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
During the two years she has been a member of ASHI, 67-year-old Catalina S. has been faced with a lot of challenges in her family and business matters. Her grandson lives with her, and her husband got sick and has been hospitalized. His medication expense has consumed almost the entire amount of Catalina’s business capital that was meant to maintain her small “sari-sari” (variety) store. Because of that, inventories at Catalina’s store were not replenished and eventually it became empty. After that incident, Catalina and her family went back to zero. They restarted with hopes that they will be able to have another business again. 

Although life was hard for Catalina and her family, their aspirations of overcoming poverty strengthens their bond to each other and they work hard together as hired laborers just to have money to support their needs, especially those of their grandchildren. Now, she is requesting another loan through ASHI because she wants to restart her “sari-sari” store and also to start a new business of hog-fattening.  Both businesses will be based at their home and in their backyard. Therefore, aside from managing her businesses together with her husband, she can also take care of her grandson and the rest of the household.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her store and a piglet for fattening.

loans.name: Bushran's Group

texts.en:
Bushran is from the city of Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She is a responsible lady. She manages her family and her house very efficiently. She is fond of cooking. Her specialty in cooking is “Chicken Biryani” and “Kababs”. Her family admires her a lot when she cooks these two dishes. 

She has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. Her kids are older than 15. Her sons work in a factory on a monthly wage. Her daughters help her with her domestic chores. Her husband's name is A. M.. He is a tailor by profession and runs his own tailoring shop in the market. His stitching is limited to gents wear. He has a good number of customers. He has been operating this business for over five years. His earnings allow him to meet his financial expenses. Now they are planning to purchase an electric sewing machine, which will help him to complete more orders on time. To purchase it they require a loan.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Despite being married so young, 19-year-old Joy B. really wanted to be productive in her own way to support the needs of her three children. Her children range in age from three months old to four years old. Joy learned to make ice cream from her husband. To be able to make this a business and have their own source of income, Joy joined ASHI and requested a loan. At first their business went well. However, because of all their expenses for food, clothing, and other basic needs, Joy has not able to re-invest their income in the business. It was just small enough to cover all of the expenses of her family and business. With that, Joy was not able to sustain her business. Her husband sells “pandesal” (a Filipino favorite bread in the afternoon) every day to have an income to support their needs.

Now that summertime has come to the Philippines, Joy wants to restart her ice cream making business. Therefore, she is requesting a much larger loan through ASHI to purchase the needed ingredients. Her husband will be the one to sell the ice cream to people around their town and in the villages. With this business and with the support of the loans she can access, Joy and her family hope that someday her business will be stable and profitable, providing them a better kind of life.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making ice cream.

texts.en:
Zainab is a 56-year-old woman who lives in the city of Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She is uneducated because her parents were not able to afford to send her to school.  She is a hardworking lady. She manages her household chores and she helps her husband in his dairy business. Her husband's name is M. S.. He has been doing this work for over 25 years.  They both get up early and help each other get milk. Presently, they have a buffalo. They get milk from it and then her husband goes to the milk shops to sell the milk. Their income helps them to meet their financial expenses.

Zainab has given birth to two kids: one son and one daughter. Her son is 28 years old and works in a factory on a monthly wage. Her daughter is 13 years old and stays at home to help with the domestic chores. Her son also helps to pay the financial expenses of their house. Zainab and her husband feel good about his positive behavior towards the family.

Zainab has fully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase another buffalo to expand their dairy business.

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is 54-year old woman and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

Zainab is a widow. Her husband died at the age of 63 from heart attack. This was a big loss for Zainab, she will not forget him. She is a very caring lady. She stays at home and takes care of her family. She finishes her household chores on time and sews clothes in her free time. Her activity gives her rewards in the form of money, which she uses to pay off the utilities. 

Zainab has given birth to two sons. Her elder son is 28 years old and drives a rickshaw. Her younger son is 25 years old, a tailor who runs a tailoring shop in the market. 

Zainab has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) which she took for her younger sons’ tailoring shop. Now she is applying for the second time to repair her elder sons’ rickshaw because its engine is creating problems and requires maintenance.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: José Víctor

texts.es: José Víctor A. A. de 43 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su familia la cual está conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a cinco hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. José es comerciante de zapatos deportivos para mujeres, hombres y niños, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante en las playas del Puerto de La Libertad, y así mismo en las colonias de Ciudad Arce. José cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales siempre están a la espera de él para poder adquirir zapatos nuevos, es por esta razón que él desea tener las posibilidades de mejorar su negocio, surtiéndolo con más pares de zapatos en diferentes estilos de manera que pueda obtener nuevos clientes. Es por esto que José solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar más zapatos y así mejorar su negocio y la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
José Víctor A. A. is 43 years old and resides in the Department of La Libertad. He lives with his family which consists of his wife, who takes care of the household chores, and their five dependent children who all attend school. José is a merchant who sells sports shoes for women, men, and children. He works as a traveling merchant along the beaches of Puerto de La Libertad and in the neighborhood subdivisions of Ciudad Arce. José has many customers who always wait for him when he acquires new shoes. For this reason he wants to have the possibility to improve his business by stocking up on more pairs of shoes in different styles so that he can attract new customers.

José is requesting a loan in hopes of buying more shoes to improve both his business and his household finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes in different styles

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: Julia Patricia E. de 45 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, ciudad ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos, los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Julia posee una panadería en la cual comercializa pan dulce, nombre que se le da en este país al pan hecho de harina con azúcar o miel, del cual existe una gran variedad. Ella se encarga de elaborar el pan que posteriormente comercializa en su propia casa, la cual está ubicada frente al parque municipal de Ilopango, contiguo a la Alcaldía de este mismo lugar, esto le da muchas ventajas a Julia ya que es un lugar muy concurrido, el cual es apto para este tipo de negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con la capacidad económica para comprar harina, azúcar, miel, y otros elementos de primera necesidad para la elaboración del pan. Julia desea mucho mejorar su negocio y de esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Julia Patricia E. is 45 years old and resides in Ilopango, a city located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her three children who are completely dependent on her. Julia owns a bakery where she sells sweet bread, the name given in this country to bread made of flour with either sugar or honey. This type of bread exists in a wide variety. Julia is in charge of preparing the bread that she subsequently sells from her home, which is located in front of the municipal park in Ilopango. The city hall is located next to the park. This has many advantages for Julia’s business since it is a very busy place, thereby making the location of her bakery a suitable area.

She is requesting a loan so that she will be financially capable to buy flour, sugar, honey, and other ingredients for making bread. Julia wants very much to improve her business so that she can provide her three children with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Asman's Group

texts.en:
Asman lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Asman owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past three years.  

Asman is an uneducated lady, but she doesn’t want to pass along the same destiny to her kids. For this reason she has encouraged her kids to concentrate on their studies. She has three sons. Her elder son is 18 years old and he started doing work after completing the 10th standard. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Her husband's name is M. J.. He works as a driver in a company and earns a meager income. That income doesn’t allow him to fulfill the needs of his family. With mutual discussion with the family, they have decided to start a grocery shop at their house. They have chosen this business because the other grocery shops are located in the main markets and there’s no grocery shop in the community. Therefore, Asman is applying for a loan to buy groceries, such as rice, flour, and cooking oil, to start a grocery shop.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to start a grocery shop.

loans.name: Kennybeth

texts.en: Kennybeth S. already has her own business, a small bakery. She joined ASHI because she wants to have access to a loan which she will use to grow her business until it becomes stable and profitable enough to support her dreams for her three children. Her children range in age from one to seven years. Kennybeth and her husband are both hard working want to improve the standard of living for their family, especially for their children. Through the proceeds that their business will earn, Kennybeth wants to save some amount for the future expenses of her children's education, until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase large volumes of ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: Francisca del Carmen C. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar, y junto a su padre D. 85 años D. edad. Francisca posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual está ubicada en su casa D. habitación, contando con la ventaja D. ser la única en la zona, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes, que en muchas ocasiones no logra satisfacer sus necesidades por falta D. productos. Es por esta razón que Francisca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos alimenticios como: frijoles, arroz, pan, golosinas, leche y otros más. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder mejorar sus ventas y D. esta manera mejorar la economía D. su familia, los cuales necesitan en gran manera las ganancias D. esta tienda.
texts.en:
Francisca del Carmen C. D. L. is 47 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. There she lives with her husband, who is dedicated to his work, and her 85 year old father. Francisca has a store in her home where she sells perishable products. She has the advantage of having the only store in the area, but she has many customers who often cannot satisfy their needs because of a lack of products.

For this reason, Francisca is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of food products such as beans, rice, bread, candy, milk, and other items. All of this is done with the desire to improve her sales so that she can improve her family’s finances, which are heavily dependent on the earning generated by her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda P. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Hilda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hilda owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as some food for snacks, noodles, eggs, shampoo, candies, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Hilda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Hilda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth M. D. S. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo quien en la actualidad no posee empleo, pero ha dado en alquiler un terreno D. su propiedad. Ana Ruth posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad para el hogar,  su negocio está ubicado en su casa D. habitación, lugar en el cual comercializa este tipo D. productos desD. hace 6 años, tiempo durante el cual ha logrado obtener muchos clientes fijos, los cuales compran en su negocio a diario. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda, aumentando la cantidad D. productos que posee y D. esta manera satisfacer todas las necesidades D. sus clientes. Para Ana mejorar su negocio es D. mucha importancia, ya que es gracias a este D. donD. obtienen la mayor parte D. ingresos para sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth M. D. S. is 45 years old and resides in the town of Jiquilisco, which is located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who is currently not employed but receives rent from a piece of land that is part of their property. Ana Ruth has a store in her home where she sells food products and basic household necessities. She has been selling these types of products for six years. During this time, she has gained several established customers who shop at her business on a daily basis.

Ana is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to invest in her store. She will increase the quantity of products she has in stock so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers. Improving her business is of great importance to Ana since it generates a large part of the income needed to sustain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is 50 years old and lives in a two room brick house, which is located in Lahore city, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

She couldn’t get a good education because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses due to their big family to support. Manzooran got married at the age of 18 to a man whose name is M. S.. He is a dairy farmer, by profession, and has twenty five years of experience in this business. He learned this work from his father. Now he is benefitting from his father's teaching. 

Manzooran has given birth to four children: three sons and one daughter. Her sons work in a factory on monthly wages and her daughter is 19 years old. The daughter stays at home and helps her mother with domestic chores. 

Manzooran is applying, for the first time, from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase another buffalo to expand her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth S., from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, is a 28-year-old married mother of an infant. To make a living, Jenneth owns and operates a business venture providing transportation services "habal-habal" to the local community members. Jenneth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jenneth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan, her third, of 5000 PHP as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis A. S. 38 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja como comerciante de productos varios y junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad. José posee una venta de gas propano, la cual comercializa en el mercado Municipal de Jiquilisco,  en donde abastece a la mayoría de personas del mercado, así mismo a las personas de Jiquilisco, ya que él brinda servicio a domicilio. José solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cilindros de gas propano, ya que cuenta con una gran demanda. José es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que desea mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
José Luis A. S. is 38 years old and resides in the town of Jiquilisco, located in the Department of Usulután. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant selling various products, and their two children (ages 9 and 2). José has a business in the Jiquilisco Municipal Market where he sells propane gas. His business serves most of the people who come to the market as well as the residents of Jiquilisco, since he also provides home service.

José is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy a large quantity of propane gas cylinders, which are in great demand. He is an extremely hardworking person who strives each day to move forward with his family. Therefore, he wants to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase propane gas cylinders

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya, 40-years old and married with four children, three sons and one daughter, is a simple and honest woman. She is a resident of Lahore, Pakistan, a city famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her elder son has a clothes-sewing business whereby he stitches gents' clothes. The other sons work in a local factory on a monthly wage, while her 17-year-old daughter reads in 9th standard. She is an intelligent girl and wants to get a good education.

Suraiya’s husband, M. R., is a milk seller by profession. He purchases the milk from the milk shops and sells to the community, a business he has been involved in for over 15 years. Suraiya is applying for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase a buffalo so they can start selling milk from their own buffalo and earn a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase a buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is from the town of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Myrna is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling peanut butter, snacks and some processed food like longganiza, hot dogs and more in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosa Francisca

texts.es: Rosa Francisca U. O. 35 años de edad, reside en  Puerto el Triunfo, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su hija de 7 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar y junto a su madre. Rosa posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual junto a su madre se encargan de elaborarlas y posteriormente venderlas. El negocio está ubicado en el mercado Municipal de Puesto el Triunfo, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes fijos quienes consumen su productos a diario, contando con la ventaja que las tortillas son parte de la dieta diaria de los salvadoreños por lo que las compran todos los días. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor con el fin de obtenerlo a precio más bajo. Esto será de mucha ayuda para el sostenimiento de su negocio, y de esta manera obtener más ganancias las cuales le permita brindarle todo lo necesario a su pequeña hija la cual depende por completo de Rosa.
texts.en:
Rosa Francisca U. O. is 35 years old and resides in Puerto El Triunfo, which is located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her 7 year old daughter who is a student. Rosa and her mother sell tortillas. They are both responsible for preparing and selling them. The business is located in the Puerto El Triunfo Municipal Market, a place visited by many regular customers who come by every day to buy her products. Rosa is at an advantage since tortillas are a daily part of the Salvadoran diet, so people buy them every day.

She is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to buy corn in bulk and obtain a lower price. This will be a great help with maintaining her business and generating more revenue. The extra money will allow her to provide all the necessities for her young daughter, who is completely dependent on her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Gladis Milagro

texts.es: Gladis Milagro L. de 51 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor y junto a sus dos hijos de 14 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar educación básica. Gladis posee una venta de tortillas, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, ella se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas cada mediodía y cada noche. Este negocio es muy importante para ella ya que representa gran parte de los ingresos fijos de su familia, los cuales le permite contar con todo lo necesario. Gladis solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz lo cual le permita atender mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales le permitan colaborar junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Gladis Milagro L. is 51 years old and resides in Puerto El Triunfo, which is located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two children. They are both 14 years old and are studying for their basic education.

Gladis has a business in her home selling tortillas. She is in charge of making and selling tortillas every afternoon and every night. This business is very important to her because it represents a large part of the stable income for her family and allows them to have everything they need. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of corn. This will enable her to serve more customers and obtain better earnings so that she and her husband can cover all the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Ata

texts.en:
Ata T. is a young man from Nablus. In the picture above, he is shown in his shop. Ata started this business four years ago in the old city of Nablus. He sells CDs, records, DVDs, accessories and gift items, and he provides the service of burning CDs or DVDs of materials provided by his customers, such as research material or wedding party images.

Ata wanted to provide his customers with professional services, so he took a loan from FATEN in order to purchase a CD-cover printing machine. Ata hopes to increase his income and be able to expand and improve his business. His shop is in a very good location and he has a good number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase a printing machine

loans.name: Gloryme

texts.en: 23-year-old Gloryme P. is a new member of ASHI and a partner to 30-year-old Ariel Fuentes. The two have been living together since 2007 and have wanted to have their own child since then. Next year, Gloryme and her partner plan to get married in the church. They hope that once they are married, God will bless them with a child. While waiting for her wish to come true, Gloryme wants to be productive and to save for their planned wedding. After she was recognized as an ASHI new member, she requested a loan which she will use to start up a small “sari-sari” (variety) store business. She hopes that the business will grow and become profitable to improve their lifestyle, especially once they have children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store's inventory.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús M. de 36 años de edad, reside en Nahuizalco, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como carpintero, su suegra quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus tres hijos de 6, 4 y 1 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores estudian. Teresa se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 10 años, negocio el cual está ubicado en el mercado de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, por lo que cada mañana debe viajar una larga distancia para poder llegar a su lugar de trabajo. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con la capacidad económica para surtir su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de verduras, sobre todo aquellas que se venden más, esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean de gran beneficio para su familia y hogar. Ella es una mujer muy alegre que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús M. is 36 years old and resides in Nahuizalco, which is located in the Department of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband who works as a carpenter. Her mother-in-law takes care of the household chores and looks after her three children (ages 6, 4, and 1). The two older children are in school.

Teresa has been selling vegetables for 10 years. Her business is in the Santa Tecla Market, located in the Department of La Libertad. Each morning she has to travel a great distance in order to get to work. Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can have the financial capability to restock her business. She will buy a large quantity of vegetables, especially the ones that she sells the most. Teresa hopes to improve her sales and obtain more earnings that will be of great benefit to her household. She is a cheerful woman who has many good references from her neighbors. They consider her to be a hardworking woman who has great desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Jonaldine

texts.en:
Jonaldine B. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Jonaldine is single. To make a living, Jonaldine owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish in the local community. Jonaldine has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Jonaldine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonaldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jonaldine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jonaldine from GDMPC.  

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Darleen

texts.en:
Darleen B. is from the village of Santiago, Gerona, Tarlac. She is 29 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Darleen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Darleen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Darleen joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Darleen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esmael

texts.en:
Esmael C. is from the town of Maamot, San Jose, Tarlac. He is 50 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Esmael owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling and buying wood or lumber in the local community. Esmael has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Esmael joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mamichu

texts.en: Mamichu is a 26-year-old mother of two children aged 8 and 2 years. She is a tailor in Hoima, Uganda and she sells clothing material. Her husband is also a tailor. She lives in a family of four people in a rented house. She has been in the business of tailoring for eight years. Having started working with her mother, Mamichu gained skills in tailoring. With the help of the HOFOKAM credit facility, she has been able to start up her own shop. She intends to use the loan funds to buy clothing material for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing material

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon L. is from the town of Maamot, San Jose, Tarlac. He is 29 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns and operates a furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Marlon joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 44-year-old carpenter based in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with six children and he is the breadwinner for his family of eight people. He has been doing carpentry and joinery for 26 years, through which he has been able to build his residential house and educate his children. He says as he grows older he is looking forward to starting a business that involves use of less energy. This is his third loan from HOFOKAM and he will use the funds for construction of his rental house.

loans.use: For construction of his rental house

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 55 years old and married. To make a living, Olivia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Olivia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Olivia from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delia

Delia S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Delia is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Delia raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Aurora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Aurora has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and gain working capital. Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane S. is the 26-year-old mother of a seven-month-old baby. She lives along with her husband and child in the house of her husband’s parents. Mary Jane dreams of having a house of their own where her family can have their privacy and enjoy their freedom. Her husband, who receives a small daily income as a hired baker, doesn’t make enough money at present to be able to afford construction of their own house. Moreover, she herself has no current source of income to augment her husband’s income. 

However, Mary Jane has a business plan. She would like to buy a fishing boat in order to start up a fishing business that can be regularly managed by her husband, who has fishing experience. She will take care of her child and help her husband sell their fish to people in their village, or in the market if the volume is large. To attain this goal, she joined ASHI and is now requesting a loan which will be used to purchase the fishing boat. Once their child has grown, Mary Jane would like to start her own business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and married with six children ranging in age from five to 22.  Three of her children currently attend school. She has run a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for over 10 years now and sells tomatoes, vegetables and milk for her primary source of income. She also earns income from selling surplus maize and beans to the local market when they are available. She says that one challenge currently facing her is the lack of good storage facilities for her produce, like maize and beans.

Mary has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, having recently paid off her first loan of Kes. 40,000. She has now requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow and to expand her stock of poultry. She says that this loan will improve her life and provide extra milk for consumption by her family. In the future, she would like to acquire a high-yield dairy cow and run a posho mill business. (A posho mill is a machine that grinds maize into flour.)

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and expand her stock of poultry

loans.name: Kibimbiri Development Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Friendly and very hardworking B. Robert has run a fishing and fish-selling business for ten years from Kihihi, earning him a reasonable monthly profit. His main challenge has been having a small stock due to the hindrances of low capital to put into his business.

This loan is to help Robert buy fishing nets to increase his stock to match his customers’ demands. He thinks that commercializing his business and expanding it will enable him to earn more revenue and be able to pay school fees for his seven children and other dependent children and cater for other family needs.

Robert belongs to a group of which he is the leader. They hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets to improve his catch

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 54 years old and married with seven children ranging in age from 15 to 35 years old. Only her youngest child is still enrolled in school. She has been running her mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for the past 12 years now. Her primary income comes from the sale of maize, beans, and potatoes. She also runs an agrovet (a small animal veterinary store) in her home area for additional income. She says that the main challenge to her business is fluctuation in market prices for local goods. This also makes it difficult to get customers to buy supplies from her shop if they are making less income than before.

Jane has built up a good credit history with Juhudi Kilimo, having satisfied two loans of Kes. 10,000 and Kes. 20,000. She has now requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to expand her stock of poultry. She says that this loan has helped her diversify her farming and enabled her to have multiple sources of new income. She is also in a better position to meet her family's basic needs. In the future, Jane would like to expand her agrovet business to other town centers within the area because she feels there is an untapped market.

loans.use: To expand her stock of poultry
